name: Kyle Leahy
bio:
I am the CEO of Glossier. I initially joined Glossier in 2021 as the first-ever Chief Commercial Officer. I am passionate about building brands that connect deeply with consumers, and have a proven track record of delivering top and bottom line performance, particularly in enterprise transformation and growth acceleration phases.

I have extensive experience across industries in brand and merchandise development, consumer insights, marketing and activation, digital strategy and e-commerce, retail, wholesale and omni-channel strategy and execution. I enjoy building and leading teams, developing and evolving organizations, instilling culture and managing through change.

Prior to Glossier, I spent nine years at Cole Haan, including several years as part of Nike Inc., in multiple Strategy, General Management, E-Commerce and Retail leadership roles, most recently as the Executive Vice President & GM of North America.

name: Mary van Praag
bio:
Mary is an inclusive, visionary Executive Leader skilled in Corporate and Entrepreneurial business environments.  She has driven breakthrough results and P&L performance in Omni-channel specialty retail, direct to consumer, wholesale and new business channels for companies and major brands in intimates, beauty and consumer products. 

Mary is a results-oriented, people-centric leader and has a reputation for driving change and innovation.  She is an accomplished business leader who thrives on energizing and challenging others and building businesses through high-performing teams.  She is a strong champion of talent, holding all to the highest standards of excellence, transparency and accountability. 

Named Top Women in Retail by Women in Retail Leadership Circle, as well as honored with numerous innovation awards namely UnderFashion Club Femmy Award for Innovation and Newsweek‚Äôs Best in Customer Service for Intimates Retail. 

If you would like to learn more about my positions, experiences, or to network, please connect on LinkedIn.  

‚úî  Let's connect!

bio: Asmita is an Indian national, with a background in economics and statistics. She began her career in the advertising industry, working in both India and China on campaigns for some of the world‚Äôs biggest FMCG brands. She joined L'Orealin 2013, as Chief Marketing Officer for L'OrealChina, where she was responsible for laying the foundations for the Group‚Äôs e-commerce acceleration in China (including building the Group‚Äôs first joint-business partnerships with Alibaba and Tencent). Mother of two teenage boys, Asmita lives in Paris since 2017, when she moved to become Chief Digital Officer for the Consumer Products division. Additionally in 2020 was named as Chief Media Officer for the L'OrealGroup. She has helped the Group and its brands maximize media value and ROI by focusing on the key digital growth drivers. Asmita joined the Group‚Äôs Executive Committee as Chief Digital & Marketing Officer in April 2021.

name: Vismay Sharma
position: President of South Asia Pacific at L'Oreal
bio:
Vismay is the President of South Asia Pacific, the Middle East & North Africa (SAPMENA) at L'Oreal .  He joined L'Orealin India when the subsidiary was first established in 1994, and part of the pioneering team who grew L‚ÄôOr√©al‚Äôs brands and the world of beauty in India.  Vismay has held various senior leadership positions at L'Oreal  spanning across India, Indonesia, France, UK and Ireland with strong track records in driving growth of business and people. His leadership style is defined by  innovation, trust and empowerment;  he is known for innovating business models and empowering every person who has worked with him to achieve their full potential. He is the first non-European appointed to the Executive Committee at L'Oreal , and is paving the way for more diversity in business leadership. 
 
Born and raised in India, Vismay holds a degree in computer engineering from the University of Poona and completed his MBA at the Symbiosis Institute of Business Management. A self-confessed digital geek, he is curious and passionate to explore the potential of digital in beauty for new consumer experiences.

He is currently the Chief Marketing and Digital Officer for the L'Oreal Groupe in the UK & Ireland; he has been part of the group since 2016 with roles in the Middle East, Africa and Western Europe. Before joining L'Oreal, Lex was head of digital marketing for McDonald's Europe and part of the Business Partnerships team at Facebook where he worked with a select group of clients to drive better ROI on their marketing investments.

He is a 'recovered' ad-man having spent the first part of his career in the agency world, with both WPP and Publicis ‚Äì his last role was Regional Director for Digital Strategy & Innovation for Leo Burnett MENA.

Father of 3 girls, he is a #DigitalNative, Global #geek, and a #Parisian. He balances time between work, the web and family ‚Äì almost always on his phone.

name: Nathalie GERSCHTEIN
position: President of L'OrealConsumer Products Division, North America
bio:
‚ÄúLife isn‚Äôt about avoiding the storm or waiting for the storm to pass. It‚Äôs about learning to dance in the rain.‚Äù Those words capture the spirit of my career journey across various roles and continents.

Almost 20 years ago, I started working for L'Oreal - the world's leading beauty company - and had diverse opportunities to grow the business in various markets around the world. Now leading an amazing, energetic team who inspires me daily, together we democratize the best of beauty across our diverse portfolio of brands and product categories throughout North America, activating game-changing consumer initiatives in a fast-paced, dynamic organization.

I combine strategic and operational expertise and am devoted to inspiring multi-cultural teams. Connecting with people and creating human connections across L'Orealand our fascinating beauty industry energizes me - it's about gaining insights and unleashing human magic. It's the joy of mentoring, coaching, and growing high-performing teams.

Besides being a beauty enthusiast, I'm committed to elevating women in the workplace and empowering the next generation. Whether it's sharing career advice with college and MBA students or connecting with our DE&I affinity groups. I'm also a strong advocate for pay equity, gender equity, and investing in women in STEM because we're all worth it. 

As a board member for DermTech, a public American biotech company, I work with the board and the leadership to transform lives through the genomic revolution in skin health. 

Personally, I'm a French native and world citizen. I‚Äôm also a proud wife and working mom who is devoted to family and committed to career. It's my mission to set an example for my daughter that women can break through any barriers to pursue their dreams and succeed!

I'm a lifelong learner and explorer who loves to travel. When I‚Äôm not traveling around the globe, I like to discover every corner of New York that I‚Äôve been calling my home since 2018.

I graduated from the HEC School of Management in Paris (#1 European business school according to the Financial Times), have an MBA in Business Strategy from the London Business School (#2 best European MBA program according to the Financial Times) and have completed several INSEAD executive leadership programs.
location: New York, New York, United States

name: Sue Y. Nabi
bio:
Sue Y. Nabi is the Chief Executive Officer of Coty Inc. She is a true veteran in the beauty space, with roughly 30 years of experience across key strategic focus areas for Coty. This includes a track record of success across the mass and luxury channels, and across the core fragrances, color cosmetics, and skincare categories, as well as successful brand building across key international markets. 

Born in Algeria, Nabi has an Advanced Master's degree in Marketing Management from ESSEC (Paris Business School) and an engineering degree in Agronomy and Environment. She began her career at L'Orealin 1993, where her passion, ambition and talent for bringing brands alive established her reputation for exceptional leadership and innovation. In 2004, Nabi was promoted to General Manager of L'OrealFrance, managing a business of more than 400 million euros in turnover with a team of over 400 people. In mid-2005, she was named the youngest ever president of L'Orealworldwide. 

Her tenure saw the L'Orealbrand‚Äôs strongest years of growth in the decade - reaching the 4 billion euros mark in 2009 - while her decision to evolve the slogan of L'OrealParis to ‚Äúbecause we‚Äôre worth it‚Äù cemented the brand‚Äôs commitment to inclusivity. During this period Nabi was named Manager of the Year in 2008 by Cosm√©tique Magazine and won the Prix d‚ÄôExcellence Marie Claire award 3 years in a row. 

In 2009, Nabi was tasked with revitalizing Lancome. The same recipe for success was applied to make Lancome the brand of happiness, resulting in three years of up to double-digit growth and a record turnover of ‚Ç¨3.2b. During her tenure Nabi pioneered the launch of the most successful fragrance of the last twenty years - 'La Vie est Belle' - which is now the second best-selling prestige perfume in the world. Nabi also oversaw the launch of global blockbusters including G√©nifique Light Pearl, Teint Miracle, Hypnose Doll Eyes Mascara, √ânergie de Vie, Visionnaire and Absolue L‚ÄôExtrait skincare during her time at Lancome.

In 2014, Nabi left L'Orealto co-found a new brand and product range with Nicolas Vu, which they in 2017. Green, clean, vegan and genderless, Orveda delivered an empowering, new-age skincare range that is based on the science of glow and working with skin, not against it. Since Nabi joined Coty, Nicolas Vu is the CEO of Orveda. The products are sold on Orveda.com and the brand is present in the most beautiful points of sale or luxury spas and medi-spas in the UK, France, USA, Switzerland, Mexico, Germany, Italy and Net-A-Porter.

name: Barbara Lavernos
position: Deputy CEO in charge of Research , Innovation and Technology
bio:
The future of beauty is being defined today, with cutting-edge science and game-changing technologies. I have the privilege of being entrusted with L‚ÄôOr√©al‚Äôs deputy CEO role, at the junction of  world-class teams leveraging the best of science and technology. Together, we work to shape the future of beauty, while transforming into an ever more nimble and data driven organization. 

Our Research & Innovation and IT & Beauty Tech teams are constantly pushing the borders of science and harnessing the power of technology and data, to deliver on our goal to satisfy all consumers‚Äô beauty needs and desires in their infinite diversity. With a background deeply rooted in science and technology, and a genuine passion towards innovation, I find the possibilities engendered by associating the power of science with the new opportunities offered by data and Artificial Intelligence thrilling. I am deeply convinced that science and technology have the power to shape a better future, and that women have a key role to play in that field.

To meet the challenges of the tech revolution, we need to invent new ways of working, and enable our employees with the right technologies, digital tools and workplaces, which help them accelerate and propel them into the future.

In other terms : creating the beauty of the future while becoming the company of the future.

This rhymes well with my leadership journey, where my ambition is to foster a symmetry of attention between our relationship with consumers and with employees. My personal source of pride is to contribute to empowering the most inclusive, diverse teams and allowing them to develop and grow their individual and collective talents. I‚Äôm a firm believer in collective intelligence, empowerment, and the co-creation of solutions.

Personally, I have a mixed cultural origin as my parents are respectively French and German. I have been married for more than 20 years and my husband has always accompanied me in my career. We have the great pleasure to be the parents of our super nice son.

name: Betty Quigley
bio:
I am very proud to work for a company that creates Beauty that Moves the World. I am privileged to lead a team and function that inspires me daily as we democratize beauty with our retail partners across all geographies through our diverse portfolio of iconic brands. Retail is changing and we are changing with it, being more digital, data driven, agile and with the best people.

Personally I love the energy at L'Oreal - the performance culture, the real diversity and inclusion you live everyday. I passionately believe in elevating women in the workplace, get great energy from working with the next generation and I love being surrounded by people who share this passion.

An Irish national, I hold an Honors Business degree and I am an associate member of the Chartered Institute of Management Accountants. I started my career in Ireland with Kerry Group as a Management Accountant in 1992 before moving to the UK in 1995 to join Fujitsu Computers as Finance Manager.
In 1997 I joined MARS Ireland and held various Sales and Marketing positions before joining the Leadership Team in 2007 as Sales Director. In 2010 I was appointed Business Unit Head for the MARS Chocolate Business. In 2014 I was appointed to Global Category Leadership Director for the MARS Petcare business which gave me the opportunity to work with markets in Latin America, Asia, US and Europe. In 2017 I became Global Sales Director for MARS Pet Nutrition.  As of Feb 2021 I was appointed as Chief Commercial Officer for the L'Oreal Consumer Products Division. 

I love sports, marathon-running, skiing, golf, camogie and coached under aged girls‚Äô football.

In 2001, I started as a Product Manager for L'Oreal Paris in Portugal and by the time I was 35 I became the first and youngest woman to be nominated Country Manager. L'Orealhas truly allowed me to pursue the life I want to live, as I embody the company‚Äôs values of a fast-paced, multi-cultural and human-focused experience.
 
L'Oreal has enabled me to chase my dreams around the world, from France to Spain to now Thailand. Here, we strive to become the country's pioneer of a consumer-driven and e-commerce-forward world while remaining socially and environmentally conscious towards our planet. name: Marc Toulemonde
bio:
Marc Toulemonde is a beauty and digital thought leader with over twenty-five years of international experience in the beauty industry. As the Chief Digital and Marketing Officer of L'Oreal USA, Marc is charged with leading the Group‚Äôs digital acceleration across its portfolio of brands. From driving new marketing models to spearheading new digital capabilities, Marc is a results-driven leader committed to Creating the Future of Beauty. Putting the consumer at the heart of L'Oreal‚Äôs business, driving digital innovation, and building high-performing teams is what fuels Marc to continue pushing the beauty industry forward and build a best-in-class beauty tech company.

Prior to this role, Marc served as the President of L'OrealUSA‚Äôs Active Cosmetics Division (ACD) for six years. In that time, Toulemonde led the Division to 5X growth, increasing the e-commerce share of business from 16% to 36%. Toulemonde built a customer-centric organization with digital and data at the core of marketing, medical engagement and sales. All digital channels ‚Äì e-boutiques, e-retailers and pure e-commerce players ‚Äì strongly accelerated in sales growth under his leadership. The Division‚Äôs acquisition in 2017 of CeraVe experienced explosive growth under Toulemonde‚Äôs direction and became the #1 dermatologist recommended brand in the US. This, plus SkinCeuticals being the #1 dispensed skincare brand, has enabled L'OrealUSA to become a leader in the mass and prestige clinical skincare category. 

Marc has had a long, successful career since joining the group in 1995. After his early experience in the Luxe Division, he joined the Consumer Products Division as Product Manager for Maybelline and Garnier in 1997. In 2000, he was transferred to L'OrealParis as Group Product Manager and was promoted to Vice President of Marketing in 2002. In 2007, Toulemonde was appointed General Manager of Travel Retail for the Consumer Products Division. In July 2008, he was promoted to General Manager of Maybelline and Garnier Spain. In October 2010, Toulemonde was transferred to L'OrealUSA as General Manager of SkinCeuticals DMI.

name: Marissa (Pagnani) McGowan
bio:
Marissa is the Chief Sustainability Officer, NA at L'Oreal, the world's largest beauty company, where she stewards the company's sustainability platform, L'Orealfor the Future, in North America. Together with L'Oreal's leadership team, Marissa believes that L'Oreal has a responsibility and opportunity to drive transformation towards a more circular, just and inclusive beauty industry benefiting all stakeholders, and she is dedicated to collaboration and innovation to accelerate this progress.

Marissa is drawn to the beauty (and fashion) industries because of their humanity, creativity, and power to influence great change. She is passionate about the power of partnerships and collective action, and believes that working with people that bring a different background, perspective, and input will always lead to something greater than any individual can achieve alone.  

Marissa started her career as a lawyer focused on international mergers and acquisitions, and corporate compliance. She received degrees from Georgetown University and Georgetown University Law Center, and studied at Georgetown University‚Äôs Villa Le Balze in Florence. Marissa serves on the Board of Directors of the Cradle to Cradle Products Innovation Institute. She served on the Steering Committees of the Global Fashion Agenda, the Accord on Fire and Building Safety in Bangladesh, the Industry Association, and the Board of Directors of the Fair Labor Association.

----
L'Orealfor the Future is the company‚Äôs 10-year sustainability transformation strategy, embodying the two complementary dimensions of corporate responsibility: transforming the company towards an increasingly sustainable business model, and contributing to solving the challenges facing the world. As part of that, the company set bold, measurable targets for 2030 on climate, water, biodiversity and natural resources, in accordance with what scientific experts demand. For more information about L'Oreal‚Äôs sustainability strategy, visit: https://www.loreal.com/en/commitments-and-responsibilities/for-the-planet/.

bio:
My objective is to steer the digital acceleration of a business or a brand thanks to the understanding of consumer's behaviour changes and thanks to innovation, partnering with team members to assure a pertinent, responsible, innovative and sustainable change and to become a leader in ‚Äúinnovation for good‚Äù.  

I love to roll my sleeves up alongside the creative and business teams, mining for meaning and bridging different cultures.

I have 25 over years of experience working at a senior executive level across Asia Pacific, Europe, and North America. As a brand manager and business leader I have demonstrated throughout my career, the ability to define, lead and implement internationally successful scenarios and long term economic performance in the Beauty, Luxury and Home sectors. 
 
Being innately curious in human behavior while fundamentally data driven allows me to understand markets dynamics, clients unmet needs in order to unlock new business potentials and encourage  and foster  innovation. My two focuses to achieve such result : ‚Äúcultural relevance‚Äù and ‚Äúresponsible desirability‚Äù.
 
My interest for ‚Äúgenerational cultural relevance‚Äù has led me to learn and orchestrate digital transformation strategy and integrate technology and Design Thinking approach as powerful tools to change offers, customer & user centric experience and business models. I decode and understand how digital forces have changed consumers‚Äô expectations and demand, and visualize the latest dynamics to identify new businesses. By assessing the impact of a new competitive landscape combined with my client sector pace change, my focus is in engaging and developing people while transforming brand and business. 

My interest in "responsible desirability" has led me to practicing innovation processes while still learning how to face the entreprises innovation dilemma.

I enjoy bridging different cultures, aligning ambition, meaning and commitment, helping each individual and the team progress. I organize cross-functional work, share findings and solutions in order to foster commitment to ensure a sustainable business success.

Strong of an international career of more than 20 years at L'Oreal, Maya Colombani distinguishes herself through a rich and comprehensive career path. She joined L'Oreal Group's Professional Products Division in 2001. She held positions there in operational marketing as well as in DMI (International Marketing Direction), on the K√©rastase and L'Oreal Professional brands. She carried out missions of brand creation in India, before joining L'Oreal Brazil in June 2010 as Marketing and Innovation Director. Since the end of 2016, she has served as Sustainability & Human Rights Director for Brazil.

In this role, she profoundly transformed L'Oreal Brazil's value chain including sustainability impact in all the decision taken from the product creation until the recycling process. She has implemented strong social actions with communities and autochthones, created an impactful Amazonia regeneration program and launched the living wage movement that inspired the L'Oreal Group and positioned L'Oreal Brazil as an international benchmark. L'Oreal Brazil has been regularly cited as a reference and is used to fuel new reflections on environmental challenge, climate change commitment, social protagonism as well as human rights respect, especially in relations with the indigenous peoples of Brazil and communities' inclusion.

Her projects have been rewarded by prestigious rankings such as Guia exame 2017/2018/2019; were recognized as The best company in climate change as well as biodiversity management; and have received the WEP Gold Award 2021 on Women empowerment supported by ONU Women and Compact Global. In 2022, thanks to her strong inclusive social programs for indigenous and communities, the GLOBO recognized L'Oreal Brazil as '' The company that makes the difference in term of inclusion and diversity".

In Canada, Maya's mission, together with the local teams in place, is to increase L'Oreal Canada's positive footprint internally and externally in terms of sustainable value chain transformation, empowering its ecosystem, scaling up its social protagonism and warranty human rights respect.

name: Alexandra Palt
position: Chief Corporate Responsibility Officer and CEO of the Fondation L‚ÄôOr√©al
bio:
As Executive Vice-President Chief Corporate Responsibility Officer of L'Orealand Executive Vice-President of the Fondation L‚ÄôOr√©al, my mission is to ensure that we collectively go beyond the transformation of our business model to build a more inclusive and sustainable world. We had already started it with our first sustainability program with targets set to 2020, and are now accelerating with our new program L'Oreal for the Future, with a new generation of bold sustainability targets for 2030.

Ever since I studied law specialized in human rights in Austria, I‚Äôve felt drawn to issues centered on women‚Äôs rights and asylum rights, and started working with different NGOs. While taking part in the European ‚ÄúPreparing Young Women to Lead‚Äù program, I was mentored by the then Secretary General of Amnesty International in Germany. 

When I moved to France, I started focusing on human rights and corporations as well as environmental issues. I became Executive Vice-President for equal opportunity at the HALDE, France‚Äôs High Commission against Discrimination and for Equal Opportunities, then was an independent consultant on sustainable and social issues. Throughout my career I have strived to face the world‚Äôs challenges and to make a positive impact. 

I joined L'Orealin 2012 as Chief Sustainability Officer, later becoming Executive Vice-President of the Fondation L‚ÄôOr√©al. As a leader of our industry, we want our contribution to be exemplary. Over the last ten years, we have undertaken an in-depth transformation to reduce our impact across our entire value chain. However, as environmental and social concerns increase, we know that this is no longer enough. 

With L'Orealfor the Future, we are aiming for an even more radical transformation: put L'Orealin line with the only possible scenario for humanity, respecting planetary boundaries across the entire lifecycle of our products. Our responsibility is to take into account our impact beyond L‚ÄôOr√©al, by involving our entire ecosystem (our consumers and suppliers). And through the programs of our Fondation, we are also aiming to build a more inclusive world by empowering women to shape their life and the world. 

Because we believe we have a double role to play in society: achieve a sustainable transition for ourselves and our ecosystem, and above all, contribute to face the world's challenges.

bio:
In today‚Äôs dynamic and expanding world of digital, data and insight, I have the privilege to contribute to and shape a Global Insight function. 
Developing business strategy based on human and data fueled insight. 

In doing so, I am passionate about:

* Creating an environment in which our people feel inspired to explore their full potential, think big, be creative and have true impact;
* Finding new, meaningful and sustainable solutions for changing environmental, societal, cultural and human needs;
* Pioneering and experimenting new ideas, tools or models, while making things happen today. 

I am fortunate that my career provided me and my family with a tremendous window to the world. 

I joined Unilever in The Netherlands and spend five years there. Subsequently, almost six years in the U.S.A., three in South Africa and 3 years in London, which has given us fantastic cultural experiences as well as personal growth opportunities. At the moment, I am with L'Oreal in Paris shaping the insights function.

I am married and have two teenagers who are global citizens and digital natives. In my spare time I try  to keep up with the digital world by learning 'Python coding', and a lot of online shopping :-)

Curious by nature, a psychologist by training and a scuba diver at heart.

bio:
Experienced  multi brands President with a demonstrated history of working in the cosmetics industry. 
Skilled in Finance, Marketing Management, Luxury Goods, Business Planning, and Retail. 
Strong entrepreneurship professional graduated from ESSEC Business School and ESC Clermont.

***************************************************************

After receiving a Master's degree in International Business and Finance in 1996, I joined the Clarins Group International Marketing Development Division. A first experience in the field gave me the taste for business, and i was be named Deputy Managing Director for the French subsidiary two years later. 
 
This productive experience opened the doors for me to international operations. In 2006, at the request of the sons of the Clarins founder, i became the first woman expatriate president of two Group subsidiaries in Spain and Portugal at the age of 32.

With the help of the team, we accelerated the development of the Group's beauty and fragrance brands ‚Äì Clarins, Azzaro and Mugler ‚Äì over a period of five years. We developed strategic partnerships by opening the Group to the distribution of new brands with the Interparfums Group. 
During this time, Clarins rose from seventh to third position on the beauty care market.

Committed and tenacious, I am a woman of challenge and adventure. In parallel to the Clarins Group, I created a digital start-up with my husband and developed it for five years. 

In 2013, I became President of Clarins Fragrance Group and Mugler Fashion, with a major challenge to meet, relaunch the dynamic of fragrance and fashion brands.
Enthusiast, i love to share my energy to the teams and puts expertise and vision at the service of Group brands. The Azzaro brand recovered a worldwide dynamic with the major launch of Azzaro Wanted

In 2020, i joined L'Oreal to continue the adventure in the Beauty Industry as Global Brand President

name: Christophe Babule
position: Group Chief Financial Officer - Member of the Group Executive Committee
bio:
As L‚ÄôOr√©al‚Äôs Group CFO, I make Finance a leading drive at the core of our Group‚Äôs transformation journey. 

L'Orealis a personal story to me, one that started in 1988, year of my graduation.

Commitment and passion are the emotions that led me to take my first job in the Group, in Italy at our Luxe Division.  There followed years of passionate work as CFO, first in China then in Mexico. After these fantastic human and business experiences abroad, I moved on to Paris as Internal Audit Director, before heading back to Asia as L'OrealAsia-Pacific CFO. In 2019, I was named Group CFO and Executive Vice-President.

In each of the positions I held at L‚ÄôOr√©al, I appreciated the range of our assets: our ability to outperform our competitors on each market and in each continent, the strength of our business model, the innovative spirit of our teams, the loyalty of our shareholders, and our long-term vision based on values. 

32 years on, the ideals of my youth have endured and thrived at L‚ÄôOr√©al. I still have the same curiosity about the world, and the same eagerness to protect it while transforming it.

My interest in different cultures and various ways of life lies at the core of my vision of human richness. At L‚ÄôOr√©al, I strongly value the diversity of our teams and the various backgrounds of our employees: they are a driving force for L‚ÄôOr√©al‚Äôs renown and growth in a global world.

My other passion is sailing. I love gliding on water at wind speed, as much as quietly savoring the beauty of the seas. This bond with nature gave me a personal awareness of the need to protect our environment by our collective commitment.

Today, as L'OrealCFO, I have a unique opportunity to use my passion for transformation and my commitment towards sustainability to nurture our Group‚Äôs lasting growth and along with the Finance teams, identify new sources of value creation, key for our future.

Let me share one business tip that has helped in my success: ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt get distracted by what other people are doing. Stay focused on self-progress, give the best possible results and understand that each person‚Äôs journey is unique and can‚Äôt be compared.‚Äù   

I‚Äôm a happy, eclectic, diverse person who lives life by following a famous quote from Walt Disney, ‚ÄúThe way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing."

 I welcome the opportunity to connect and make new professional acquaintances. Please feel free to contact me at aalmazlinos@gmail.com

Specialties: FP&A, Controlling, Tax & Laws, M&A, IT and Media, Traditional and Digital.

As a CFO, I believe the impossible is an excuse of those who give up too fast. Understanding the business needs, bringing financial expertise to the discussion, and collaborating with business partners supporting strategic decisions, is how we tackle complex business challenges in a successful way. 

This is true for complex acquisitions or divestitures, acquisitions integration, new business frontiers, digital upskiling and the new medias, multicultural team management, backbone integration, major projects rollout and any other situation a management team is confronted with.

Passionate about my teams and ways of working, I believe the transformation agenda can be handled with transparency, dialogue, making sure everyone has context for the decisions made.

I am a firm believer that telling the truth and having a facts based approach is always the way to achieve things in life. It does not detract from being inspirational and having a bold vision, it helps build trust to deliver on the vision.

bio:
I joined L'Oreal almost 30 years ago. I did not imagine at that time I would be a man of one company. 
I am still at L'Oreal simply because I have been lucky enough to constantly learn, discover new cultures, new ways of working, to get exciting challenges, and the most important, to work with passionate people, smart people, inspiring people‚Ä¶ and because I am having a lot of fun ! Not everyday of course but most of the time.
And also because L'Oreal stands for values that are important to me: believing in people before processes, standing for sustainability with very concrete actions behind an ambitious program, for true diversity and inclusion, and with a constant quest of innovation and superior quality. 
Beauty is an industry I love because it‚Äôs about product performance, solving consumer problems, making them feel better. But also because it‚Äôs about emotion and aesthetic. 

Over the years I have had the chance to live with my family in Japan (fascinating), Spain (energizing), the US (understanding what scale means) and France.

My job is President for the L'Oreal‚Äôs newly created Europe Zone.
Together with my team, we are accelerating the transformation of L'Oreal in Europe to invent the future of beauty. A beauty powered by green sciences and technology. A beauty that is diverse. A beauty that is committed to the planet and to society. In a word a beauty that moves the world.

L'Oreal is a French company, a European company: we also want to contribute to a Europe that is agile, bold and innovative.

bio: Hello, Thanks for stopping by and I hope you are having a good day. Since, I have few seconds to catch your attention, here is what you need to know about me : I am a passionate, creative and hard-working person who loves all aspects of being in the Human Relations function, thanks to a great MBA internship experience at the start of my career. I see myself as a multi-functional people partner who believes in people proximity, likes to dig deeper and collaborate at all levels in a cross-functional, multi-cultural context to get the best experience and impact for our people. In my 16 years+ professional journey so far, I have been fortunate to lead roles in both regional and country scope, designing and implementation people policies and practices through my roles covering HR Business Partnering, People Development and Learning , Talent Acquisition and Employer Branding, Diversity and Inclusion, Rewards and numerous global Change Management projects.

name: Lennard Boogaard
position: Senior Vice President Human Resources Europe Middle East and Africa at Coty
bio:
I am an Experienced Senior Human Resources professional with broad experience across countries cultures and the HR profession. 

My purpose is "To spark what‚Äôs inside".

I unlock growth in people, organisations and systems by "sparking what is on the inside", not pushing from the outside. This way growth spreads and becomes sustainable and lasting. 

I help people and organisations discover their energy and potential. I am passionate to leverage talent as  potential growth should not be wasted.

I like to be part of a business and team that has a positive impact on people and society.

I have lived and worked in several countries across Europe, North Africa, Middle East and Asia and have a broad perspective and deep insight in cultures and business dynamics.

I have deep HR experience covering a broad range from setting up the HR function and fundamentals, Organisation Strategy, OE/OD, Change management, Talent and Leadership development, Employer Branding, Outsourcing, Restructuring and Compensation and Benefits.

name: Michelle VERSCHOORE
bio:
Thank you for your interest in my expert profile.

I am a doctor specializing in dermatology, clinical pharmacologist and manager of international projects with a solid experience in defining strategic orientations and partnerships in the field of inclusive skin sciences. 

I have constantly developed my expertise in the sectors of the pharmaceutical industry and the cosmetics industry.

Passionate about the multinational environment, I succeeded in inventing and implementing projects co-constructed with local actors, for a sustainable implementation of disruptive and beneficial practices for products.

Having always practiced dermatology part-time in recent years, I regularly lead brainstorming sessions on new strategic avenues, where feedback from the field is essential.

My medical and multi-ethnic background is strongly rooted in respect for ethics.

I worked mainly transversally, which allowed me to develop a virtuous and sustainable vision in the construction of private / public partnerships and to achieve objectives with strong respect for local cultures;

My serious strengths from my international experience give me the opportunity today to offer you the opportunity to join a board of directors of a company looking for skills that match my profile.

Thanks to my expertise in emerging markets, I offer you my talents to support you in your organization by helping to bring you high added value in your need for international growth.

I am convinced that we can combine great synergies to link diversity to growth.

position: Chief Financial Officer - L'Oreal Op√©rations Luxe - Gauchy Plant - Perfume
bio:
I have an extensive experience in Corporate and Business finance. I have served as plant business controller and Chief Financial Officer (CFO) in subsidiaries and at headquarter level. This experience includes large and medium-sized US and French public companies as well as a family owned and ruled company. 

My successive functions include the management of a commercial international zone and enable a global approach of finance. On the top of an international CFO network, I have managed marketing and commercial teams as well as logistics and customer service department. Thus I provide General Management and Shareholders with a 360 view of business based on strong figures highlights in growth or turnaround environments.     

My purpose is to improve performance and cash through:
-	aligning the organization with the company strategy
-	initiating and leading change in the teams
-	managing the resources with an efficiency approach balancing quality and costs within the defined targets. 
-	timely delivering accurate and synthetic financial information and operational KPIs
-	implementing internal controls to protect company‚Äôs assets (cash, goods, buildings, trademarks‚Ä¶)

My key sectors are Health, Beauty and Wellness and manufacturing industries. My preferred channels are a combination of retail and digital as well B2B or B2B2C. Traditional mailorder is also part of my background.    

French born, I performed two two-year expatriations in Turkey and Sweden. My latest position gave me the opportunity to discover business in the Middle-East and I have been working in a multicultural environment since 1993.

name: Delphine Viguier-Hovasse
bio:
Global Brand President of L'Oreal Paris, forever fascinated by the advancement of science, driven by an ambition to make a positive impact on our planet, and inspired to empower women across the world.  

Guided by the overarching belief ; ‚ÄúBecause we‚Äôre all worth it.‚Äù 

#empoweringwomen #allovertheworld
As the first woman to lead L'OrealParis worldwide, I am honored to continue the commitment of an iconic brand to the emancipation of women. I am the head of a dedicated team; we are compelled to uphold the values and mission of L'OrealParis through the choices we make and the actions we take. From the passion of the people we employ to the inspiring ambassadors we sign, the brand has a universal vocation, to bring the collective power of women together. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre Worth It‚Äù, is more than our signature, it‚Äôs our mission statement.  

#aspirational #accessible #efficacy #transparency #safety 
As an engineer who trained at the Institut National Agronomique Paris Grignon, I have always strongly held the opinion beauty should not be the exclusive preserve of the privileged few, but available to all. L'OrealParis beauty is aspirational, yet accessible to everyone, worldwide, without ever compromising on superior efficacy, absolute transparency and above all, safety. 

#sustainability #duty  
As a brand that bears the name of the world‚Äôs largest beauty group, I feel a responsibility that L'OrealParis has a duty to meet the biggest global warming challenges humanity is facing. 

#Inclusivity #diversity #sisterhood 
Inclusivity, diversity and a sense of sisterhood are not trends, they are fundamental pillars of L'OrealParis‚Äô positioning, values which I hold very close to my heart. I champion the bond between women of every age, lifestyle and nationality. My conviction: we may be both a feminine and a feminist brand.

name: Adrien Koskas
bio:
Since 2019, I have been fortunate to be the Global Brand President of Garnier.

Our mission is to transform the industry and lead the way for #GreenBeauty for all of us. As the 4th largest beauty brand in the world, it is our duty to build and promote a more purpose-driven, inclusive and responsible business worldwide. Here at Garnier, our goal is to accelerate the sustainable transformation of our brand thanks to our advanced knowledge on Green Sciences: the combination of nature and science to deliver the best results for all. This ambition can only be achieved with a community of passionate and diverse talent, working all together to provide our consumers with the maximum efficacy but with a minimal impact on the planet.

I am incredibly proud to have worked at the L'OrealGroup for over 15 years, in various categories (Makeup, Skincare, Haircare), all around the world (Rio de Janeiro, London, Paris), in both global and local teams, always driven by the same motivation: creating products that meet the aspirations of our consumers while reinventing the face of beauty towards a more sustainable and responsible society.

‚Ä¢	Ecommerce: achieved 2.4x the ecommerce market share of our next competitor and No.1 champion on 6.18 & 11.11 on Alibaba Tmall & JD; ecommerce sales weight from 21% to 60% (2016-2020); No. 1 biggest company across all industries on 11.11 2021 (Tmall flagship stores 10 B RMB club) and No. 1 brand in FMCG (L'OrealParis)
‚Ä¢	Digital marketing: from 2 to 5 of the industry‚Äôs top 6 digital love brands (Gartner L2 2017-2020)

Previously, as Associate Partner (at age 29) of McKinsey and Co-Leader of the Greater China Consumer Digital Practice, I led various digital transformations and multi-year performance programs, market entry and expansion strategies, marketing and sales accelerations, and due diligences and Sino-foreign partnerships. I had the privilege to work with Chinese, European and US companies/JVs in automotive, food & beverage, cosmetics, high-tech, household care, consumer electronics, children‚Äôs products, and sports.

Passionate about China, where I have spent 14 years, I am fluent in Mandarin and have published a book on winning in China. I have also enjoyed living in Germany, France, US, and UK, where I studied economics & management on a scholarship from the University of Oxford and graduated as the best student. Immersion in different cultures feeds my curiosity while flying through deep powder snow frees my mind.

name: Vania LACASCADE
bio:
I‚Äôm the Global Brand President of Vichy Laboratoires, a member of the L'OrealActive Cosmetic Division‚Äôs Management Committee, and a Doctor in Pharmacy by training.

I have had the opportunity to experience a diversified international career, starting in the luxury market at LVMH, where I was the head of Givenchy Skincare, followed by an entrepreneurial adventure, before finally joining the L'OrealGroup in 2010 in the Consumer Products Division. 

At L‚ÄôOr√©al, I began as the International Head of Marketing for Garnier Skincare, before moving to lead the Garnier Marketing Hub in China. In 2014, I was nominated as the Deputy Brand General Manager for The Body Shop in London and in 2017, I joined Lancome‚Äôs Board of Directors to lead the brand‚Äôs international marketing strategy for skincare. In 2019, I was appointed as the Global Brand President of Vichy Laboratoires.

All these experiences have influenced who I am today. I have often been told that I have the particularity of balancing my scientific and rational left brain well while using my emotional instinct and creative boldness to open myself to innovation through my right brain.

As a scientist, I always considered skin as a vital organ and a barometer of our health that we need to understand and take care of. Skin is our first line of defense and it‚Äôs essential to preserve our skin‚Äôs health capital over time. At Vichy, our brand tagline ‚ÄúHealth is vital. Start with the skin" is the foundation of everything we do.

As a Doctor of Pharmacy, I took over Vichy Laboratories with the strong desire to revive the medical roots of this leading dermo-cosmetic brand, through the innovations we are carrying out. I truly believe science is the most powerful tool to preserve and optimize our health.

As a manager of a large, international, diverse team, I want to make Vichy an inspirational place to work, share my expertise and vision with my team. I truly believe people flourish and are inspired when they feel connected, recognized, and responsible.

As a leading woman of a big organization, I believe passion, resilience, bravery, positivity, and purpose drive success. My life experiences have given me the chance to play a role in pushing the boundaries of health, embracing sustainability and inventing dermatological solutions for all.

As a mother of 2 daughters, I have always believed that it is possible for a woman to seek both an exciting professional life and a fulfilling personal life. I commit to teach my daughters that experiences and connections enrich life, and that we must make every moment count.

name: An Verhulst-Santos
position: President and CEO of L'Oreal Canada
bio:
I am Belgian and since July 2021 I have the privilege of being President and CEO of L'Oreal Canada. Our sense of purpose is to create the beauty that moves the world. A beauty that is positively impacting our planet and all of its inhabitants. A beauty that is a force for creation, innovation, and self-expression and drives freedom and empowerment. A beauty that is a force that fosters exchange and promotes sharing, that brings barriers down and communities together. 
I work at the number 1 beauty company in the world for more than 30 years. My career began in 1991 at L'Oreal's Professional Product Division in Belgium. Between 2005 and 2009, I acted in this division in Brazil and I was responsible for building the "Hairdressers against AIDS", L'Oreal's worldwide preventive education program in partnership with UNESCO to promote the prevention of AIDS.

After that, as the head of this division in the United States, I worked on the implementation of the SalonCentric project, L'Oreal USA's professional product distribution operation.
From 2011 to 2016, I participated in the Executive Committee of the L'Oreal Group as President of Professional Products Division, reporting directly to CEO and Chairman Jean-Paul Agon, and I worked strongly in the acquisition of the professional cosmetic brands Decl√©or and Carita, as well as in their integrations, turning the Division into a global player in the professional beauty market. From 2017 to last June, I have been leading a team of close to 3,600 employees as President & CEO of L'OrealBrazil.

After obtaining my PharmD in Lebanon in Saint Joseph University, I decided to continue my path at ESSEC Business School Paris in the Grande Ecole Master in Management Program.

Finally, If I have to confess hating something in life; I would definitely say stagnation.

name: Bryan Mahoney
bio:
As a long-standing advocate and architect of API-first commerce solutions, I‚Äôm on a mission to help founders and teams‚Ä¶

1. Deepen their relationship with technology to build better businesses.

2. Make crucial technology decisions to bridge knowledge gaps. 

3. Understand the build versus buy question to roll up their sleeves and scale with purpose.

I‚Äôve been lucky enough to work with and shape some of the world‚Äôs most innovative brands, like Glossier, Blue Bottle, Honest, and Samsung.

Today, I support the next generation of founders and commerce brands with Chord‚Äôs commerce-as-a-service platform, connecting with the hearts and minds of customers every step of the way. Having grown out of arfa, a consumer goods business that developed personal brands, Chord is the extension of my belief in creating brilliant, unforgettable commerce experiences.

My goal is to give founders access to the same tools as the biggest and most well-funded D2C players. 

Earlier in my career at Glossier, I wrote the company‚Äôs first line of code, was its first engineer hire, and scaled its tech team to beyond 65 people. 

During the Dot Com boom, I started Dynamo‚Äî a direct-to-consumer digital design agency‚Äî with a friend of mine from McGill University. We delivered commerce stacks with recruiting and retention in mind for early-stage, venture-backed startups. The agency survived 25 years, resulting in a team of exceptionally talented designers, programmers, UI/UX specialists, and managers.

What started out as a way to make money while in school, led me to where I am today:  grateful to have built a career out of my love for enabling early growth stage brands to reach their full potential.

I have a passion for building things‚Äî personally, and most importantly, my home in New York with my wife, daughter, dog, and grumpy cat. Professionally, tech stacks, startups, and diverse, distributed teams. And there‚Äôs a small business side of me working on a grassroots winery in Santa Barbara.

My team and I are always excited to be a part of industry discussions on topics ranging from the intersection of business and technology to how to have a better relationship with data. 

If there‚Äôs anything we can do to support, let‚Äôs talk. My email is bryan@chord.co.

name: Khalid Alkhudair
bio:

Khalid last role was the Chief Experience Officer (CXO) at Riyad Bank, leading the internal and external experience transformation which includes brand, internal/external communications, digital, all internal/external campaigns, PR, research and insights, CX design and customer journey's for all business lines ,business processes for all products, UX and UI, Customer & SAMA Care, Employer of Choice program, and establishing their core CSR department, for the entire Riyad Bank Group which includes Riyad Capital. Khalid also worked as an advisor to the Saudi Banks Media Committee in which he was tasked to  restructure it in 2021 as an acting Secretary General and recruited the team to proceed with the job. Prior to this role Khalid Founded Glowork, an employment organization that created thousands of jobs for women and placed over 40,000 women thus far. He is the first Saudi Ashoka Fellow, Young Global Leader at the World Economic Forum & an Endeavor Entrepreneur. Previously he held the role of Chief Operating Officer- Markets at KPMG in Saudi, Kuwait and Jordan. In 2013 Khalid led Glow Group to an investment to expand its current operations into different verticals. 
He has a Bachelors Degree in Commerce from Saint Mary‚Äôs University in Canada with three majors, Marketing, HR and Psychology, and has completed his Executive Education in Leadership at the University of Yale, and in Public Policy from Harvard Kennedy School.
Khalid has been awarded many awards such as the Chaillot Prize for Human Rights by the European Union, The King Salman Award for Entrepreneurship, Ranked #3 Most Influential Arab by Arabian Business, EY Entrepreneur of the year, amongst many others. Khalid also sits on a number of Advisory boards throughout the Globe such as the L'Oreal Global Panel of Critical Friends, The Global Agenda Council on Middle East and North Africa Issues at the World Economic Forum, and is an Amend‚Äôs Fellow at the University of Stanford.


Specialties: Management, Financial Management, Team Building, Corporate Governance, Branding and Identity, Research, CSR, Public Relations, Communication, Event Management, Networking, Strategy & Performance, Intranet & Website, Campaigns and Managing Budgets, Human Resources, Recruitment, CRM, Cost-Efficient Marketing, Gorilla Marketing, Awards, Sustainability, Empowerment, humanity issues, Labor markets

During her 10 years running L'OrealLuxe, she has moved from a $1B business to a $1.8B business, gaining market share and increasing its profitability in a strong and regular way. 

In January 2016, Carol Hamilton was promoted to Group President L'OrealLuxe USA where she began to delegate the operational animation of the USA business and focus more on the animation of the existing US beauty brands DMIs, the search and evaluation of new acquisitions as well as their integration into L‚ÄôOr√©al, and contribute to the global division‚Äôs strategy with an American perspective. name: Dr. Ayesha Khanna
bio:
Hi and thanks for stopping by! I'm a data geek on a mission to help companies and people reach their potential through the innovative and responsible use of data. Making data and AI more accessible and usable, whether in the physical or virtual worlds, can empower people to innovate, create and build more easily.

I'm an advisor to CEOs and Boards on how to become globally competitive data-driven organizations. As Co-Founder and CEO of Addo, an artificial intelligence solutions firm, my rockstar team of data engineers and machine learning scientists build intelligent data platforms for some of the world's largest enterprises. For our clients, these platforms turn their data into gold and form the foundation for using machine learning to automate, optimize and innovate their processes. 

A passionate advocate of teaching women about AI, I am the founder of 21C Girls (21st Century Girls), a charity that teaches girls the basics of coding and artificial intelligence. And I'm launching Squad, a global women's collective that teaches women about Web3 (crypto, blockchain, NFTs, metaverse) and is the world's first job board for women in Web3. Every gal in our programs makes me super duper proud!

I'm also a huge believer in human-centred technology. Throughout my college years, I volunteered in human rights organizations and I strongly support movements for data dignity, digital justice, and AI ethics.

Finally, I'm a city-lover who has lived in New York, London, Boston, Berlin, Singapore, and Lahore. As a big people person, I love meeting interesting people with diverse interests and passions! I wanted to study how cities can benefit from big data and wrote my Ph.D. on smart city information systems. Modern cities not only boost the quality of life for residents but also enhance their ability to succeed in the growing digital economy.

name: Sasha Muir
bio:
Sasha Muir is a seasoned Executive and Entrepreneur with over 15 years of experience in consumer-focused businesses ranging from Fortune 500 to Start-ups. With a passion for the business of fashion and an eye for the twist, she build brands that always go above and beyond ‚Äòthe expected‚Äô.

Upon graduation from Cambridge University, UK, with a Masters in Engineering, Sasha worked for Gemini Consulting in the Global Strategic Consulting Group. After that, Sasha went on to earn her MBA, with a focus on Branding, Marketing and Entrepreneurship, from INSEAD Business School, France. 

Sasha moved to Seattle in 2002 and engaged with several early stage companies whilst investigating possible ventures to launch on her own. She spotted a gap in the prestige beauty marketplace and founded butter LONDON in 2005. 

As CEO and Chairman, Sasha successfully built butter LONDON into the leading prestige nail lacquer brand recognized world-wide for its high fashion colours, non-toxic formulations, and dressing-table worthy packaging.  In July 2014, butter LONDON completed a significant financing and strategic partnership with Encore Consumer Capital.

Sasha is now focused on her latest venture, BEV√âE - a luxury handbag and accessories brand that is both ‚ÄòBeautiful and Brilliant‚Äô. Launched in March 2014 and available exclusively online at www.bevee.com, BEV√âE is fast becoming the bag of choice for Hollywood stars and NYC go-getters alike. 

Whether it‚Äôs combining designer and fast fashion or urban life and adventure sports, Sasha loves mixing it up. She is passionate about women‚Äôs causes and entrepreneurship. She has backpacked in every continent, except Antarctica, and counts family and friendships as her most treasured possession. 

Still a passionate Brit at heart, Sasha loves living in Seattle with her husband and three young children. Her mantra is, ‚ÄúIf there is fun to be had, I will find it!‚Äù

name: Mia Talavera
position: Director, Global Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion ‚Äî LVMH
bio:
Mia Talavera is a high performing leader who is passionate about strategy and inspiring positive culture change by designing and driving Global Diversity & Inclusion strategies‚Äîcreating a clear vision for the future of Inclusion, Diversity and Equity work. Providing tactical leadership in corporate sectors, she is passionate about improving business outcomes by removing barriers to inclusion and promoting equitable business practices that engage and advance marginalized underrepresented groups.
In her work, Mia developed and implemented the first enterprise-wide D&I strategy and standards, commissioned multiple Global D&I Councils, lead Global ERG/affinity networks and was the founding Chair of the Person of Color Committee at Stantec. Mia believes that inclusion is a fundamental human right and that the equitable treatment and dignity of all human beings should be exercised and valued. 
Outside of work, she‚Äôs an active member of the Edmonton Business Diversity Network (EBDN), a network of companies and organizations who share a vested interest in advancing and shaping inclusion and diversity in the local Edmonton region. 

[Bio] I have had the incredible opportunity to design and drive inclusive corporate culture for an international architecture, engineering, and consulting design firm and now, for a prestigious multinational corporation, with operations spanning around the world. I am proud of my work that remains focused on instilling Diversity, Equity and Inclusion into the heart of an organization, taking a holistic view of the diverse talent that exists, enabling all employees to truly thrive. I partner with leadership to identify and eliminate unfair biases, stereotypes, or barriers that may limit full participation of talent; educating and collaborating with key internal/external stakeholders. I am passionate about building truly inclusive workplace cultures and engaging in meaningful conversation to better understand how we can continue improve our inclusivity efforts despite barriers. 

‚ÄúDiversity and Inclusion isn‚Äôt a solitary achievement. It‚Äôs a continuum that constantly improves and directly contributes to the sustainability of our society.‚Äù

bio:
Aurelie Jean has been working for more than 15 years as a research scientist and an entrepreneur in computational sciences, applied to engineering, medicine, education, economy, finance and journalism. In the past, Aurelie worked at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and at Bloomberg. Today, Aurelie works and lives between the USA and France where she shares her time between consulting, research, and teaching in grad schools and executive education mainly at MIT. Aurelie is also a tech and science advisor for several companies, and a mentor at the Frontier Development Lab at NASA. name: Njara ZAFIMEHY
position: Member of L'Oreal international startup accelerator
bio:
Njara is a purpose-driven tech and marketing entrepreneur with a successful track record in Europe, in the US and in Canada across multiple industries including retail and eCommerce, media, software development and philanthropy. 

Determined to create value for society, Njara is the Founder & CEO of WhatRocks‚Ñ¢, the "Crypto Rewards as a Service" platform for good that enables brands to engage and reward consumers with crypto in appreciation for their time, their attention, their engagement, or their purchases on social media, on the web, in newsletters, on TV/OTT/CTV, on billboards and digital ad screens, on print media, or in retail stores. Thanks to this crypto, consumers make donations to their charities of choice from the 200+ organizations available in their WhatRocks‚Ñ¢ mobile wallet. 

Njara also serves as an Advisor of Epic, the philantropic foundation of Alexandre Mars that provides innovative giving solutions to support carefully vetted charities around the world. He previously served as SVP, Global head of development and partnerships of Epic.

Njara is a co-founder and board member of French Tech Toronto, the French government-backed community of Toronto-based French, francophone and francophile entrepreneurs, top executives, business leaders, investors, government officials and academics that connect business ecosystems around the world with the vibrant tech and innovation community of Toronto.

Previously, Njara was the COO of VC-backed ScrOOn that he pivoted from a B2B video-sharing platform to a leading social marketing software startup with global clients such as Louis Vuitton or Nespresso. ScrOOn was successfully sold to BlackBerry in May 2013 where he was appointed Global Head of Media sales for BBM (BlackBerry's mobile instant messenger). Under his tenure, BBM drew premium brands such as Coca Cola, Red Bull, Disney, FC Barcelona and Desigual.

Njara started his career by creating and developing successful digital services including downloadable music, SVOD and catch-up TV for European juggernauts such as Fnac Group and Vivendi‚Äôs Canal Plus Group as well as for tech startup AudioSoft.

name: Denis SIMONNEAU

bio:
Graduate of the Institut d‚ÄôEtudes Politiques (IEP) and the Ecole Nationale d‚ÄôAdministration (ENA) in Paris, I hold a Masters degree in Economics.
As a member of the French Diplomatic Service, I served in India (1988- 1989) and South Africa (1993-1996), was Adviser to the Minister of European Affairs, Michel Barnier (1996-1997), Counsellor at the French Permanent Representation to the European Union in Brussels from 1997 to 2001, and was appointed Consul General and Head of the French Trade Economic Mission, specialized in energy, in Houston, Texas (USA) from 2001 to 2005.
Deputy spokesperson for the Department of Foreign Affairs of the French Government from 2005 to 2007, and head of communications during the launch of UNITAID, the agency set up to purchase medical supplies for developing countries, I was then Chief of Staff of the Minister for European Affairs, Jean-Pierre Jouyet, from July 2007 to December 2008, the period of the French presidency of the Council of the European Union. During that time, I also worked as Deputy chief of staff for Bernard Kouchner, French Minister of Foreign Affairs.
In May 2009, I took up a position within the energy company, GDF SUEZ and was appointed Diplomatic Adviser to the Group‚Äôs Chairman and CEO, G√©rard Mestrallet. In March 2010, I was nominated Senior Vice President for International Relations and Member of the Executive Committee in charge of European and International Relations for the ENGIE Group (ex GDF SUEZ).

I am also President of EUROPANOVA, a French NGO specialized in European issues. I am a member of the Boards of the French section of the International Chamber of Commerce, PROPARCO, MEDEF International, and Chairman of ‚ÄúLes Amis de l‚ÄôUniversit√© Fran√ßaise d‚ÄôEgypte‚Äù. name: Emanuele Monti
bio:
Sono pap√† di Ettore, ho 37 anni e tantissima passione per il mio lavoro. Amo le sfide e il cambiamento, cerco di dare il massimo per la mia comunit√† potendo in parte contribuire al successo collettivo a beneficio di tutti. Di certo sono un pragmatico, a volte troppo. 

Sotto la mia storia, se ti va di curiosare, in qualche riga:

Dal 2018 presiedo la Commissione Sanit√† di Regione Lombardia, con 20 Miliardi di Euro di budget annuale tra i Sistemi sanitari principali al mondo. Sono impegnato nella ricerca a fianco delle aziende, la Lombardia √® il primo produttore di farmaci in Europa e il 14.2% del PIL Lombardo √® legato agli ambiti di mia competenza.
Ho promosso numerosi provvedimenti legislativi, dalla legge 23/2020 contrasto alle droghe e dipendenze alla legge 24/2020 che ha messo in sicurezza il sistema sociosanitario post covid. Certamente il provvedimento pi√π rilevante √® stata la legge 22/2021 di Riforma del Sistema Sanitario regionale con 2 Miliardi di Euro di stanziamenti e la riorganizzazione complessiva della medicina territoriale per oltre 10 Milioni di cittadini.

La mia formazione istituzionale parte nel 2006 da Consigliere comunale, ruolo ricoperto per 3 legislature, Consigliere Provinciale e Consigliere Regionale dalla X legislatura.
Sono stato nel board di diverse societ√†/Istituzioni, tra queste certamente l'Universit√† Carlo Cattaneo LIUC √® stata un esperienza di grande valore.

Professionalmente sono Dirigente nella pi√π grande Azienda cosmetica del Mondo, L'Oreal. Avventura iniziata nel 2008 da neolaureato con ruoli diversi dal commerciale al finanziario passando per la gestione retail e di sviluppo del business oltre che di direzione dei pi√π importanti brand del gruppo. In 14 anni ho avuto l'occasione di lavorare su 7 diversi brand internazionali nella divisione luxe e professional, guidare lo sviluppo omnichannel e multibrand dell'industria e raggiungere importantissimi risultati di business in un contesto di forte cambiamento. Ho sviluppato da zero per l'azienda un nuovo canale legato alle vendite ai dipendenti in Italia e in diversi paesi nel mondo contribuendo ad un nuovo modello di business che oggi √® un successo riconosciuto ovunque.

La mia formazione √® economica con una laurea 110/110 all'Universit√† Carlo Cattaneo LIUC in Economia e numerosi master e formazioni executive nelle principali universit√† al Mondo, da INSEAD in Francia a IESE a Barcellona, Londra sia in LSE che all'Imperial College e infine a TOKYO presso la KEYO Business school.  

Dovrei fare pi√π sport che adoro, seguo l'arte e amo stare con la gente. 

Emanuele

name: Dr. Holger Schlageter
bio:
DEVELOPING LEADERS IN BUSINESS AND POLITICS. The Schlageter Institute [SI] is a globally acting psychological consultancy with its headquarters in Germany developing leaders in business and politics. 

SI specializes in organizational psychology offering custom-fit Executive Assessment, Transformational Leadership Training, and C-Level Coaching - - remotely or face-to-face. 
_______

DR. SCHLAGETER is the CEO of SI. In two consecutive ratings (2016 and 2019) he was voted one of Germany's top 10 Executive Coaches by XING and FOCUS. He is also a best selling author and renowned organizational counselor and strategy consultant to top executives / board, politicians and persons of public interest. 

He serves as the psychological expert for public media, the chamber of commerce, and federal governments. Dr. Schlageter is a widely known public speaker and broadcast commentator.

His blockbuster book "Under German Beds" was made into a movie and was brought to cinemas by 20th Century Fox in 2017.

_______

Management Assessment | Leadership Developement | Executive Coaching | Change Strategy Counseling

Specialties: Treating the Human Factor in Business Organizations, Accompanying Change Processes, Global Leadership Development, Comprehensive Stress Reduction Programs, Burnout Prophylaxis Programs, Resilience Psychology, Positive Psychology, Analytical Psychology, Behavioral Psychology, Systems Psychology, Ethics, Leadership, Assessment, Training, Coaching -- Publishing, Radio, TV, Media

 T&G Offers no overhead to it's customer.T&G can guarantee a professional esteem business experience that the customer can say ethics are still alive. All of our competitors either need an external Air Conditioning unit to cool the board which increase the operating costs, or use ventilation which require filters, thus leading to increased maintenance. name: Lisa R. Ginn, MD,  FAAD
bio:
Lisa R. Ginn, MD is one of a handful of African American board certified dermatologists and fellowship trained cosmetic laser surgeons in the country. Dr. Ginn has completed extensive work and training in both medical and cosmetic industries, and is a true product and laser expert with an artistic side that makes her love of cosmetic dermatology the perfect fit. She designed her private practice in Chevy Chase, MD to encompass all of her training in clinical medicine, strong chemistry background, research, aesthetics and laser surgery. Dr. Ginn's vision was clear-to offer innovative and clinically proven skincare and cosmetic laser surgery for patients of all ethnicity and skin color who are seeking a vibrant natural and fresh appearance.

Her awards are extensive and include being named: One of Washington DC's Best Dermatologists for 2016; Skincare.com Expert Panel Member in 2016; Essence Best in Black Beauty Expert Honoree in 2015. Dr. Ginn holds the prestigious honor of co-authoring the 'Laser Treatments' chapter in "Dermatology for Skin of Color." It is one of few clinical dermatology reference books dedicated to skin of color and serves as a valuable reference for physicians worldwide.

Dr. Ginn's commitment to education remains a priority. She is an active member of the American Academy of Dermatology, the American Society for Laser Medicine and Surgery and the National Medical Association. She takes special pride in her dedication to mentoring young adults. 

A Few of Our Treatments Include:
‚Ä¢ SculpSure¬Æ - Non-Surgical Body Contouring
‚Ä¢ Pelleve¬Æ - Wrinkle Reduction
‚Ä¢ Dysport¬Æ, Botox¬Æ, & Restylane¬Æ

name: Dr Daisy Bennett
bio:
Dr Daisy Bennett is the Chief Medical Officer, L'OrealUKI. She has a passion for ageless beauty within & on the outside, as well as skin health, physical & mental well-being, & raising self esteem for all. She is passionate about supporting the various L'Oreal charities & partnerships. She is honoured to be the elected Chairwoman of the CTPA working group committee of the industry national association, working towards ensuring a safe & responsible industry.

Dr Daisy Bennett is a practising GP. She qualified from the world-renowned Guys & St Thomas's Hospitals, London (now merged with Kings College, London). She has been practising medicine for over 20yrs & has a degree in medicine & surgery, as well as Membership of the Royal College of General Practitioners.

She is active in medico-politics as the elected divisional Chairwoman of the British Medical Association (BMA), representing over 153,000 doctors in the UK. Through this role, she is involved in shaping health care policy in the UK. 

Dr Daisy currently regularly appears on Sky News to discuss topical medical & health related issues. She was the LBC global radio resident medical expert & broadcaster, answering medical questions live on the LBC Health Hour on Tuesday evenings with Clive Bull. Her father was an NHS Doctor & her mother was a BBC world service Broadcaster, so it was inevitable that one day she would enter the world of medical broadcasting.

She has been passionate about producing the next generation of top doctors, evident in her past role as GP Tutor & Examiner for medical students at Imperial College, London.

In her spare time she enjoys playing tennis & dabbles in golf. She loves a challenge & has recently taken up cycling. Her mental & physical limits were tested when she accepted the challenge of cycling over 300 miles from London to Paris in order to raise thousands of pounds for a small children‚Äôs cancer charity. She is committed to charitable work, and is an active charity Ambassador. She enjoys travel, art & culture.

bio:
As the Chairwoman of the Board of Directors and CEO of Sodexo, my ambition is to ensure we build a strong future for our company, while upholding Sodexo‚Äôs mission and longstanding values of team spirit, service spirit and spirit of progress.

name: Noor Kaur
bio:
I am a Senior at the Gabelli School of Business at Fordham University Lincoln Center pursuing a B.S. in Global Business with a Consumer Insights and Marketing concentration and a Sustainability minor. While at Fordham I spent a semester studying at Fordham's London Centre campus. I am pursuing full-time sustainability opportunities in New York City.

I have held a number of sustainability internships with some of the world's leading companies including The Estee Lauder Companies and ViacomCBS.  At Viacom, I have been instrumental in supporting a racial justice community partnership with CBS Sports that offers marginalized youth positive role models in the sports broadcast industry as well as planning and executing Virtual Community Day, company-wide community building day where VIacomCBS employees lend their expertise to local nonprofits. I was honored to interview five ViacomCBS Impact Award recipients and learn how their volunteer work benefited their communities and write an article, ViacomCBS Puts a Spotlight on Employees Who Exemplify Volunteerism with the Impact Awards, that was published on 3BL Media, a sustainability news portal.

At The Estee Lauder Companies, I was a Global Corporate Citizenship & Sustainability intern where I worked with a team of sustainability professionals to perform a competitive benchmarking of skincare and make-up consumer products companies to establish best practices for cause marketing and philanthropic donations. My findings were summarized in a PowerPoint presentation which was influential in allocating over $300,000 in grants. I also performed extensive research on racial equity metrics to inform a scale for evaluating grant applications and was instrumental in planning an employee speaker series featuring Brian Stevenson, author of Just Mercy.

Finally, I have spent nearly three years working for the Palms For Life Fund, a global non-profit dedicated to restoring basic human rights supporting their mission through planning and executing a social media strategy.  

On-campus I have also gained valuable exposure to corporate social responsibility through my work as the Vice President and Mentor for Social Impact 360 a group that aims to instill a socially conscious mindset in college students.  I am also active on campus writing for Fordham's student newspaper, The Observer, serve as Co-President of the Dean's Council, and as a Captain of Urban Plunge, a student community service, and social justice organization. 

You may contact me at ykaur1@fordham.edu

name: Obaa Amponsah
bio:

Some of my research interest include stratum corneum homeostasis, barrier functionality, efficacy of natural products, and more. I believe the application of such research to product formulation would result in major innovation in product development and ensure inclusivity of sensitive skin, black skin, and healthier and effective skin solutions.
As a young social entrepreneur, I tackle the issues of mass exploitation of Africa's resources and the capitalization of the false narratives of the continent in the industry. I focus on improving self esteem, community, and insight into the continent through my research and its application to the real world i.e skincare products and the community inspired around them.
Such ventures have afforded me the win of Social Impact 360's 2020 Shift series, a pitch competition for social entrepreneurs. As well as, the opportunity to be co-lead mentor at Social Impact 360's Howard Chapter, to afford Howard's freshmen this same opportunity.

name: Alexia Ayuk
position: L'Oreal USA Diverse Future Leaders Fellowship
bio:
My nickname growing up was ‚Äúbasket mouth,‚Äù because my favorite word was ‚Äúwhy,‚Äù which reminded my mother of a Cameroonian fable about someone who could never stop asking questions.  I approach problems through a strategic lens of efficiency. At the very core of who I am, curiosity is at the essence of what drives my passions. I view my inquisitive nature to be at the very essence of what business practices should be about: utilizing strategy to provide solutions which will enhance organizational design.

I'm an Operations Management & Business Analytics major and Philosophy minor at the University of Maryland, College Park passionate about business leadership oriented towards our social obligation to bring about a greater good in the world and learning how to heed equitable systems throughout the world in the corporate and public sectors.

Through my interest in human behavior and personality tests, I have found my passion for the role psychology plays in the business environment. The intersection between psychology and business is where I find the necessity of strategic design in implementing solutions in that process. Investigating methods about people, organizational effectiveness, and its applications have transitioned to be where I see my best fitting role.

My belief is that what the world needs now is not self-interested business leaders but self-aware advocates for business rooted in compassion to heed equitable systems and methods throughout the world. By utilizing data to demonstrate the synergy of my innovative and analytical ability, I hope to use my problem-solver skills for good.

The goal is to go beyond the typical boundaries of the human factor set by the current world order.

name: Kean Levreault
bio:
I believe that storytellers have a responsibility not just to entertain, but also to challenge the ideas that make up our modern society. For this reason I started Spillsheet, a video production company that has a fearless approach to film making.

I very much like combining the absurd with the beautiful. I work to create satirical realism and to hold a mirror up to the audience. I encourage them to look at themselves and their actions, but strive for subtlety, allowing them to come to their own conclusions about the questions being raised. 

Whether I'm creating a satirical over the top narrative film or showing the impact of our society on the planet, I work to serve only the story being told and create an an emotional connection with the audience and encouraging conversation.
