name: Ebony Spratley
bio:
"She's So NY" 

#LetsWork 

Known to "add anyone" I am Ebony McGleese. I strongly feel that everyone has a story and everyone has a purpose. I love getting to know all cultures near and far. I know there are millions of people who just want to share with someone who cares to know and I just...care. 

I decided to start my consulting agency, Ebony, Inc. A Public Relations Co. for a number of reasons mainly
because I needed an outlet for who I am. I also desired the ability to express my philanthropic views and concerns with people who just wanted to know. Ebony, Inc. aims to help clients reach their goals and relationships with the public. Providing Public Relations consulting and services geared towards honesty and transparency for independent brands in the Entertainment, Fashion and Non - Profit sectors. 

What's Behind the Tags

"She's so NY" 
I am balance, I can fit in anywhere and NY is the home of "anywhere"... anyone you meet can be from anywhere! I have met people and through sharing stories I have experienced so many places and experiences I would never have. So I am able to understand and be compassionate of all situations. 

"LetsWork 
I love to network and connect business relationships. I feel as though the hash tag, let's work, was perfect modern day, easily identifiable way to show my eagerness and determination for what I do. It also identifies my understanding and position in modern day social communications.

name: Nuno Cornélio da Silva
bio:
Nuno is a passionate, ambitious, and hardworking person. Comes from a small village near Lisbon and he wants to become a very successful person while creating value for the humanity.

He did a master‚Äôs program called Double Degree with Catolica Lisbon School of Business and Economics and with FGV EBAPE in Rio de Janeiro. It was a wonderful experience as he got the chance to meet an entire new country, their ways of teaching, learning, living and working. 

Nuno believes that traveling is the greatest way to grow as a person and that preparation alongside trial and error is the best way to grow professionally. 

Challenges are what keep Nuno motivated! Especially the ones that need several people with different skills and make him to exceed himself. Seeing results and improvements, in the company or in the clients‚Äô he¬¥s working with is what gives him the biggest professional satisfaction. 

During his career he has passed through Deloitte working in Data and Reporting for the Oil and Gas sector, he went to L'Orealbecoming a product manager for Lancome Makeup and Project Manager of the CRM in the luxury division. While working at L'Orealhe used his weekends and free time to develop, with his main partner, a company of Health and Wellness services at home. After 4 months they secured Angel funding leading to Nuno to give the leap to full time entrepreneur. 

The company was officially founded in September 2020 growing and surviving during the pandemic. Now it¬¥s on close to its first million euros in revenue.

name: Danielle Keasling
bio:
North America Hairstylist of the Year for 2018 and 13 time Naha nominee; Danielle has worked in the beauty industry for over 23 years.  Establishing herself as one of the most sought after extension artists worldwide as well as an editorial session hairstylist, Danielle travels the world consulting an extensive list of clientele and brands including L'Oreal, Ulta Beauty, Hairuwear and Great Lengths USA and International.  She specializes in strategy and development collaborations with marketing, as well as executing the artistic beauty imagery to represent the client's campaign.   

With her extensive list of clientele, brands and private students, and her ability to specialize and thrive in digital creation as well as events on stage; Danielle as establishing herself in the industry as an iconic educator and sought after beauty artist.  After joining the Ulta Beauty Pro Team as the Matrix and Biolage Ambassador, Danielle has expanding her name into the consumer market as well and works closely with a team of top professionals to create imagery, direction and education for Ulta Beauty.   

As founder of Hair Biz and Beyond,  Danielle offers customized private coaching and mentorship for hairstylists across the world via digital communication and in person consulting and education.  As a previous salon owner, Danielle also provides support and consulting to salon owners in brand development, remarketing,  salon management,  business and financing.  This enables Danielle to expand her reach in the industry and create more growth and positive change for stylists worldwide.

Zero... that‚Äôs how many people purchased my service when I first launched.

I remember that time like it was yesterday; I‚Äôd spent weeks building out the modules, creating the PowerPoint slides and drafting what I thought was my marketing launch plan. 

Imagine the devastation I endured, once I realized that all of my hard work and effort was tragically going down the drain.

That one failed attempt didn‚Äôt stop me though! I kept going back to the drawing board and trying again. It was literally one failed attempt after the next. I made not one sale from any of my launches!

I started joining free masterclasses, webinars and challenges hoping to learn my sales and marketing mistakes. The additional free information made it worse! I was piecing together different marketing and sales tactics, trying to make it all work for my business. None of it worked at all. 

At this point I was frustrated, confused and beginning to lack confidence. I had thoughts of quitting this newfound second business and just focus all of my energy back on the first one. My passion wouldn‚Äôt let me though! I knew I could master the online sales and marketing beast.

FAST FORWARD TO TODAY AND THINGS HAVE DRASTICALLY CHANGED! I‚Äôve had 5-figure launches in under 7 days! It‚Äôs surreal to see just how far I‚Äôve come in such a short period of time.

My second business is thriving; I‚Äôve created a warm engaged audience that‚Äôs ready to buy. I‚Äôm no longer scared to launch and hear crickets because I finally understand the psychology behind sales and marketing.

My businesses run and generate sales on autopilot while I work 9 ‚Äì 5; just how an employee would. I unplug worry free and dedicate my evenings and weekends to spend time with my family. With my effective marketing strategies in place, I know sales will continue to generate without much manual effort from me.

My mission today is to help service-based women entrepreneurs scale to consistent 5K months so they can surpass their 9-5 income. I know how frustrating and confusing it can be to learn sales and marketing. 

If you‚Äôre a service-based entrepreneur, let‚Äôs connect to see how my sales and marketing coaching can help you generate you consistent sales online. 

My goal for you? To surpass your 9-5 income so you can have the option to leave if you choose.

Let's connect! Email me directly at hello@missashleyallison.com

position: Award Season Pro Team Makeup Artist
bio:
April M. Chaney has had a passion for beauty since the age of 16 years old. She started Work in cosmetic retail while in high school and never looked back. After obtaining her degree from THE UNIVERSITY OF ALABAMA at Birmingham with a B.A. in Mass Communications & Minor in African American Studies, April has taken every opportunity to learn and hone her artistic craft. While vacationing in California in 2003 April decided to attempt a transfer with the company she worked with. In 2015, April set her sights even higher & earned her Esthetician license, while also accomplishing her dreams of becoming a member of IATSE Local 706 HAIRSTYLIST and MAKEUP GUILD. In 2018 April was nominated for a Makeup and Hair Guild Award for her work on MICHAEL JACKSON SEARCHING FOR NEVERLAND. In 2019 April earned a 2nd nomination as Dept Head of makeup on the NBC show A Legendary Christmas. 

With humble beginnings as a retail consultant and makeup artist in Beverly Hills, April has since seen her work featured on TV, film, print, and fashion runways. She has done over 100 commercials and has worked backstage on numerous awards shows, including Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Sports, The Emmy‚Äôs, BET AWARDS, Golden Globes, SAG Awards, and The Academy Awards. April continues to collaborate with L'Oreal as a Brand Ambassador and works frequently with WB for events, like WonderCon, Comic Con SD, and Comic Con NY. April has also Day played on such shows as The Doctors, The Real, & Dancing With The Stars, Jane The Virgin, World Of Dance, SuperStore, Face The Truth & her published works include features in People, Us Weekly, O Magazine, Variety, Essence, Marie Claire, and editorials for Kohls, GAP, Nordstrom, and Sears. In 2018 April opened her Dream Salon Spa in her  neighborhood Burbank, Ca. Effleurage Studio is a Skincare salon specializing in facials,waxing & makeup. In 2021 April moved her salon to The Wilshire corridor in Beverly Hills. April Department Heading makeup for season 2 of the HBO Emmy Nominated show ‚ÄúA BLACK LADY SKETCH SHOW‚Äù.  In the first Season of the ABC hit comedy April served as Department Head Makeup Artist for‚ÄúAbbott Elementary‚Äù 

for booking info please visit www.AprilChaney.com

name: Mehreen Syed
bio:
Equipped with over 15 years of experience in modelling, acting and philanthropy, I started my social entrepreneurship journey with IFAP, a company that works towards skill enhancement for the economic benefit of women and girls. Soon I realised that there were far too many girls who needed financial and social help as well. So I set up ICARE, a not for profit organization that works towards women empowerment in all its nuances.
I strongly believe, that social conduct is extremely important and more so for the coming years. This is one of the ways that we distinguish ourselves from other species. Beauty and fashion are beyond gender and have the potential to impact every aspect of our lives be it ourselves, our homes, our work, our thoughts or our philosophies. In other words each and every part of our lives is impacted through our inward and outward conduct, beauty and fashion. All combined they give us that spring board of confidence that propels towards the greatness that we can all achieve. It is with this belief that I started IFAP and ICARE and I am humbled by their achievements even this short time since their establishment.

name: Drew Schaefering
bio:
A talent in the world of hair stylists, Drew Schaefering has worked with some of the world's top stylists, brands, celebrities and models in his multi-faceted career. 
The St. Louis, MO native now calls Brooklyn home and works on high fashion and editorial shoots, advertising and commercial jobs, red carpet clients and private appointments with clients for haircuts. Backstage has been home for him at countless Fashion Week shows in cities around the world and in major productions such as the coveted Victoria's Secret Fashion Show. Drew shares his passion and expertise as a global artist and educator, creating advanced workshops for hairstylists specializing in cutting and styling and performs as a National/International Artist for L'Oreal Professionnel. His latest vision, taken in the form of Cruxe, delivers the highest quality hardware and unparalleled education for the industry through a new lens and mindset. 

CRUXE- @cruxebrand
"I began the process of Cruxe after feeling a large gap in my connection to the industry. The products and the companies behind the items being sold felt unnatural and disconnected. I felt there was a need for our industry to have products/tools that stood for more than a gimmick pushed for a dollar sale that all too often carried a sense of dilution to our industry. Cruxe is the result of noticing countless observations and opportunities for progress in my first 10 years of the industry. Every product is designed down to the finest details to be efficient, modern, essential and luxurious delivered through a new set of eyes. It's about moving the focus back towards quality, connection and having a mindset that breaks the mold and questions the norm." 

BRAND AFFILIATIONS
L'Oreal Professionnel Artist ‚Äì Conducting elite workshops and advanced education catered to and customized specific for the artists at hand. Performing on stages around the world, photoshoots for new product launches and advanced academy curriculum.   

BACKSTAGE
 Fashion Week in New York, London, Milan and Paris, Victoria's Secret Shows, Commercial and Advertising Campaigns, and Editorial Publications.  PUBLICATIONS
Drew's work had been included in the likes of:  W Magazine, Vogue Arabia, Vogue Me, Issue
Magazine, We Are Vandals, Bullett Magazine, Essential Homme, Foxes Magazine, Beauty Archive Official, Harpers Bazaar Ukraine, , ESPRIT, Marion Parke and more.

name: Stephen Davis CISM, CDPSE
bio:
Being selected by my peers in 2022 as one of North America‚Äôs top 100 Chief Information Security Officers (CISOs) is truly an honor.

For over 20 years I have been recruited by firms like Revlon, Morgan Stanley, General Dynamics, W.R. Grace & Co., and others to lead cybersecurity teams, build cybersecurity programs, optimize supply chain risk management, ensure secure digital transformation, establish a global threat risk advisory, respond to cyber attacks, and perform other strategic, leadership and advisory roles in information security.

My efforts to advance cybersecurity both for the entities I‚Äôve worked for and the industry as a whole have yielded consistent, appreciable results. For example:

At Revlon, currently serving as VP Chief Information Security Officer, I am leading the development of our cutting-edge Enterprise Cybersecurity Program that protects the business systems, manufacturing operations and intellectual property of the company.

At W.R. Grace & Co. I designed and built the company‚Äôs first Cybersecurity Operations Center, armed with the industry‚Äôs most advanced cybersecurity protection systems.

At Morgan Stanley, I was brought in to reestablish trust in the company‚Äôs fraud investigation, threat monitoring and data protection after a major security incident.

On the industry level, I am a frequent speaker at conferences and roundtables, serve on several advisory boards and was selected for the Cybersecurity Observatory Hall of Fame for my contributions and influence in the cybersecurity community.

I was also a co-contributor to the industry textbook ‚ÄúWireless Security: Models, Threats, and Solutions‚Äù, published by McGraw-Hill.

My career has advanced on a solid educational foundation, earning my Bachelor of Science degree in Business at Fort Hays State University, Digital Transformation Certificate from Cornell University, and currently pursuing my Master of Science degree in Cybersecurity at the University of Nevada Las Vegas.

With energy and enthusiasm I look forward to the challenges ahead.

name: Nanette Wong
position: Vice President, Global Brand Marketing, Fenty Beauty & Fenty Skin
bio:
At 25, I had a quarter life crisis. With a comfortable 9-5 job, no weekend work, and a great manager and mentor, what could be wrong?

Key word here, comfortable. 

What was missing was the challenge, the desire to push beyond my own boundaries and excel to be the best person, and as a result, best employee ever. As one who is always striving for more, I took action.

Turning my comfortable life upside down, I quit that comfy job and its benefits to be a benefit-less intern (thankful for Obamacare!). I changed my life and learned more than I ever thought I would. 

It was this fateful opportunity that sparked my interest in marketing. Following the internship, I honed my skills at a Fortune 500 CPG company, and then moved into tech. The time I spent in these varied industries is how I turned my interest in social media into a keen knowledge about consumer engagement and online brand presence. With a unique perspective and broad knowledge of the digital landscape, my expertise lays in building brands, storytelling, and globally integrated communications. I'm passionate about driving innovation in the space and continually pushing boundaries.

name: Tarang Amin
bio:
Proven CEO who is passionate about assembling high performance teams, building brands, leading innovation, driving operational excellence, and delivering breakthrough results.

Being entrepreneurial has played a major role in my life since the age of 14, when my family took every penny that we had to buy a small motel. I believe that every major door that's ever been opened for me goes back to that motel experience. It was here that I learned the importance of cash flow, economic profit, and how to treat others ‚Äì our employees, customers and the community. 

Throughout my career, I have been able to take many of these entrepreneurial skills to scale much larger businesses. Today I have more than 30 years of consumer products experience with a demonstrated record of driving profitable growth ‚Äì taking brands from $50 million to $2 billion. 

In 2014, I became the CEO of e.l.f. Beauty; taking the company public in 2016. I am very proud of our team at e.l.f. Beauty. I lead with the motto, ‚ÄúOne team, One dream‚Äù, and I am committed to building a company culture that empowers our teams to move at e.l.f. speed to get things done. 
 
Prior to e.l.f., I was President, Chief Executive Officer and Director of Schiff Nutrition (NYSE:SHF) with leading brands such as Airborne and MegaRed, building enterprise value from $190 million to $1.5 billion. I also held leadership roles at The Clorox Company, as GM of the $1.5 billion Litter, Food, and Charcoal divisions, taking those businesses to new records as well as creating the company‚Äôs Health & Wellness platform which helped double the size of the Clorox franchise. I began my career in brand management at Procter & Gamble, leading the Pantene and Bounty brands, after getting my B.A. in International Policy and M.B.A. from Duke University.

name: Brittany Chisum, MBA
bio:
Science or Art. Data or People. Metrics or storytelling. I don‚Äôt pick ‚Äúor,‚Äù I thrive with ‚ÄúAND.‚Äù Throughout my career, I not only focus on the technical skills needed to get the job done, but the soft skills and business acumen that are important to excel as a team. After all, if no one understands what I‚Äôm doing or the information they‚Äôre receiving, there‚Äôs really no point!  

I began my career in inventory management, where I gained a solid understanding of supply chain. I then moved to sales, operations, purchasing, and business intelligence, where in each area I learned what things really drive business decisions so I could put KPI‚Äôs in place to track enterprise business performance. This cross-departmental immersion allowed me to be successful in implementing a business intelligence platform company-wide. While this required strong systems knowledge, technical data transformations, data validation, and building visualizations, it also required a significant focus on the human aspect, finding innovative ways to change a culture to one that‚Äôs more data-driven. 

Most recently, I have been overseeing forecasting, inventory, S&OP, and analytics teams, building new data models from scratch, and forging my own path in both analytics and supply chain. This has been a theme throughout my career ‚Äì observing, understanding business needs, adapting my work to fit those needs, and working collaboratively to add value across the enterprise. In 2017 I went back to school to get my MBA so I could better understand how to identify those business needs and potential gaps I could fill. This was one of the best decisions I made for both my career and personal life, as I‚Äôve gained so much more than I ever realized I would being a UNC Tar Heel!

name: Linee Reeves
bio:
My passion for makeup and fashion has been with me from a very early age. While in my teens I experimented a lot with clothes and makeup, giving tips, helping friends, and family with application, and always aspiring to somehow make it into a career. In 2008 I finally took it to the next level and decided I am going to do this. I decided to take a formal course on all aspects of beauty for television, print, movies, runway, bridal, etc. at Studio W of Honolulu. It went from being my passion and hobby into an overnight obsession and art.

Since then, I've worked with local photographers helping models with their portfolios, I've done weddings, fashion shows, organized makeup parties, coordinated an outreach to mentor young mothers on proper skincare and makeup application, and traveled to learn and grow more into my craft. I worked as a makeup artist at Sephora and grew into an Education Expert which then paved my way into becoming a Senior Makeup Artist.

I was able to gain more knowledge and experience at Sephora University in SF, and the Senior Artist workshop in NY where I accomplished my long time goal of going to the Makeup Forever Academy!

I continue to grow and learn from the most experienced makeup artists and estheticians in the industry. I have now branched out on my own building my business services ground up and offering top notch professionalism and quality makeup artistry.

I am currently open to contract/freelance for respective Cosmetics companies. I have done freelance for Guerlain, Cargo Cosmetics, Smashbox, Givenchy, and I formerly represented Josie Maran Cosmetics. 

The core of my business approach and lifestyle is:

Connect, engage, inspire.

I currently reside on the Island of Oahu
For bookings and other info please email mslinee@gmail.com

name: Sasha Muir
bio:
Sasha Muir is a seasoned Executive and Entrepreneur with over 15 years of experience in consumer-focused businesses ranging from Fortune 500 to Start-ups. With a passion for the business of fashion and an eye for the twist, she build brands that always go above and beyond ‚Äòthe expected‚Äô.

Upon graduation from Cambridge University, UK, with a Masters in Engineering, Sasha worked for Gemini Consulting in the Global Strategic Consulting Group. After that, Sasha went on to earn her MBA, with a focus on Branding, Marketing and Entrepreneurship, from INSEAD Business School, France. 

Sasha moved to Seattle in 2002 and engaged with several early stage companies whilst investigating possible ventures to launch on her own. She spotted a gap in the prestige beauty marketplace and founded butter LONDON in 2005. 

As CEO and Chairman, Sasha successfully built butter LONDON into the leading prestige nail lacquer brand recognized world-wide for its high fashion colours, non-toxic formulations, and dressing-table worthy packaging.  In July 2014, butter LONDON completed a significant financing and strategic partnership with Encore Consumer Capital.

Sasha is now focused on her latest venture, BEV√âE - a luxury handbag and accessories brand that is both ‚ÄòBeautiful and Brilliant‚Äô. Launched in March 2014 and available exclusively online at www.bevee.com, BEV√âE is fast becoming the bag of choice for Hollywood stars and NYC go-getters alike. 

Whether it‚Äôs combining designer and fast fashion or urban life and adventure sports, Sasha loves mixing it up. She is passionate about women‚Äôs causes and entrepreneurship. She has backpacked in every continent, except Antarctica, and counts family and friendships as her most treasured possession. 

Still a passionate Brit at heart, Sasha loves living in Seattle with her husband and three young children. Her mantra is, ‚ÄúIf there is fun to be had, I will find it!‚Äù

name: Melissa Harvey
bio:
As the President and co-founder of Zorah biocosm√©tiques, my never ending quest is to find effective cosmetics that are organic, ecological and fair-trade. That has led me to where I am today. 
During a humanitarian trip to Morocco I discovered the virtues of Argan oil. I was so impressed with the courage and determination of the Berber women who grow and produce Argan oil. Upon my return to Montreal in 2007 I founded Zorah biocosm√©tiques. Our mission is to offer high quality cosmetic care products equal to, or better than those available on the market, using organic, eco-friendly and fair-trade ingredients. 
I sincerely believe that we can all make a difference : it starts with educating people about dangers concerning their health and to the environment, starting with production right up to consumption, and by doing so we can make a difference and give our children a greener and fairer future.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Presidente et co-fondatrice de Zorah biocosm√©tiques, j‚Äôai toujours cherch√© des cosm√©tiques efficaces, biologiques, √©cologiques et √©quitables.

Durant un voyage humanitaire au Maroc j‚Äôai d√©couvert les vertus de l‚Äôhuile d‚Äôargan. J‚Äôai √©t√© s√©duite par le courage et la d√©termination de femmes berb√®res qui cultivent et produisent l‚Äôhuile d‚Äôargan. √Ä mon retour √† Montr√©al en 2007, j‚Äôai fond√© la compagnie Zorah biocosm√©tiques qui a pour mission d‚Äôoffrir des soins cosm√©tiques de tr√®s haute qualit√© √©quivalents ou sup√©rieurs aux meilleurs produits sur le march√©, tout en n‚Äôutilisant que des ingr√©dients biologiques, √©cologiques et √©quitables.

Je crois sinc√®rement que nous avons chacun le pouvoir de faire une diff√©rence. Je pense qu‚Äôen √©duquant les gens sur les dangers pour la sant√© et l‚Äôenvironnement qui d√©coulent de nos modes de production et de consommation nous pourrons donner √† nos enfants un avenir plus vert et plus juste.

position: Regional Marketing Director, Aramis Designer Fragrances, Smashbox, Glamglow & Lab Series

name: Jill Tomandl
position: Vice President, Global Product Development, Innovation, and Brand Sustainability
bio:
PORTFOLIO | https://www.jilltomandl.net
Jill Tomandl is a cosmetic industry innovator, award-winning product developer and package designer, creative director, and sustainability advocate.  She is currently the Vice President of Global Product Development, Innovation, and Brand Sustainability at Smashbox Cosmetics, Estee Lauder Companies. Throughout her career, she has led the innovation and growth of cutting-edge brands including Smashbox, Stila, Hard Candy, and Prescriptives by conceptualizing and creating high performance products and unique package design.  

Her artistic vision combined with technical expertise create first-to-market, beauty industry innovation and trends including a new makeup subcategory with the first long-wearing, matte liquid lipstick, the first-ever Smoky Eye Instructional Talking Palette and franchise, the IPDA Grand award-winning Color Wheel Eye Shadow Palette, and award-winning primer-infused products. She drove the launch of the first-ever 3D printed lipstick.

She develops high performance products with efficacious ingredients. Her unique package design tells a story featuring unexpected materials, from agates to sound modules, and original construction. Collaborations include Marchesa Couture, Arianne Phillips, Donald Robertson, and Vlada Haggerty. She initiated and developed the Stila for E! Live from the Red Carpet collaboration resulting in product features on E! News, increased brand awareness, and top-selling palettes. The luxury refillable, solar powered, Stila for E!LRC Illuminating Highlighter compact was developed in partnership with HCP to raise environmental awareness and received the IPDA Sustainable Package Award. 

Her work has been seen on runways, the red carpet, magazine covers and editorials, social media, and advertisements. 

She led the design and development for the repositioning of Jane Cosmetics to a social impact brand supporting trafficking victims, featuring lomography of the life-changing women at Two Wings. 

She is leading sustainability initiatives to reduce CO2 and material waste and develop cruelty-free, vegan products with ingredient transparency. 

She is a member of 1% for the Planet, Environmental Media Association, Sustainable Packaging Coalition, Cosmetic Executive Women, and a mentor for Qualified. She was the keynote speaker at MakeUp in/Luxe Pack and speaks at industry events, FIDM, and Make-up Designory.

She designed and tailored custom clothing for musicians, concert tours, fashion editorials, advertisements, commercials, couture clients, and film.

Experience living and working on four continents (North America, Latin America, Asia, and Europe) with deep understanding of global cultures and business practices.

name: Xavier Gallet
bio: Mr. Xavier Gallet serves as General Counsel Banking & Finance at L'Oreal. Mr. Xavier Gallet served as Legal Manager, Banking and Finance at L'Oreal. Previously, he served as a Legal manager, banking and finance at Veolia Environnement.

name: William Taylor
bio: Mr. William Taylor is a Co-Founder of Pacifica Beauty. He previously served as its Chief Executive Officer.

name: Virginie Morgon
position: Chief Executive Officer and Member of the Executive Board
bio: Ms. Virginie Morgon serves as Chief Executive Officer and Member of the Executive Board at Eurazeo. She also serves as Board Member & Chairwoman of the Audit Committee at L'Oreal. Ms. Morgon has accelerated the firm's diversification and growth across investment strategies and geographies, transforming Eurazeo into a multi-strategy international investment firm able to support companies across size and scale, from venture capital to large cap. Ms. Morgon spent over 16 years as an investment banker at Lazard and became the youngest managing senior partner in Paris in 2001. During her tenure, she advised international groups such as Air Liquide, Danone, Kingfisher, Publicis and Renault. She spent her time in transatlantic cities New York, London and Paris. She serves on the Board of Directors of Asmodee and Moncler and is an independent Board member of L'Oreal. Previously, she served on the Boards of AccorHotels and Vivendi. Since 2011, Ms. Morgon has been regularly ranked on Fortune's Most Powerful Women International 50 list. She is a vocal advocate for diversity in leadership, as a founding member of the Women's Forum for Economy & Society, and for global equality, as Co-Chair of the Paris Committee for Human Rights Watch. Virginie Morgon has a degree from l'Institut d'Etudes Politiques de Paris (Economics and Finance section) and holds a Master's in Economics and Management (MIEM) from the University of Bocconi (Milan, Italy). He also served as Supervisory Board President at Idinvest Partners.

name: Vincent Ruaz
bio: Ms. Vincent Ruaz serves as Chief digital and marketing officer at L'Oreal.

name: Victoria Dolan
bio: Ms. Victoria Dolan serves as Chief Financial Officer at Revlon. Prior to joining the Company, Ms. Dolan most recently served as Chief Transformation Officer for The Colgate-Palmolive Company (Colgate-Palmolive) since October 2017. Prior to that role, Ms. Dolan served as Colgate-Palmolive's Chief Transformation Officer and Corporate Controller from July 2016 to October 2017; Vice President, Corporate Controller and Principal Accounting Officer from February 2011 to July 2016; and Vice President, Finance and Strategic Planning, European and South Pacific Division, from November 2008 to January 2011. Prior to joining Colgate-Palmolive, Ms. Dolan held finance positions at Marriott International, Inc. from 2000 to 2008; The Coca-Cola Company from 1991 to 2000; and ARCO and ARCO Chemical Company from 1985 to 1991. Since January 2020, Ms. Dolan has served as a director of Ocean Spray Cranberries Inc., which is a NASDAQ-listed company. Ms. Dolan received her B.A. in economics from the University of California Los Angeles (UCLA) and M.B.A. in accounting and finance from the UCLA Anderson School of Management. Ms. Dolan is a member of the Board of Trustees of both the TCS Education System and The Chicago School of Professional Psychology and of both of their respective Finance and Audit Committees.

name: Victor Nichols
bio: Mr. Victor Nichols serves as Board Member at Revlon. Mr. Nichols has served as Chairman of Harland Clarke Holdings Corp. (HCH) since January 2019. HCH is a portfolio of companies optimizing customer relationships through a broad variety of omnichannel solutions and a wholly-owned subsidiary of MacAndrews & Forbes. Mr. Nichols has served as a member of the Board of Directors of HCH since January 2017 and served as Chief Executive Officer of HCH from January 2017 until December 2018. Mr. Nichols served as Chief Executive Officer of Valassis Communications, Inc., a wholly-owned subsidiary of HCH, from April 2015 through December 2016. He served as Chief Executive Officer for North America at Experian plc from January 2010 through March 2014, as well as Managing Director for the U.K. and EMEA at Experian plc. Prior to that, Mr. Nichols served as Chief Information Officer for Wells Fargo & Company, as Chief Executive Officer of Vicor, Inc., as President of Safeguard Business Systems Inc., as well as having served in various senior leadership positions at Bank of America Corporation.

name: Vanessa Wittman
bio: Ms. Vanessa Wittman serves as an Advisor at Glossier. She serves as Board Member at Impossible Foods. She serves as Board Member & Chair of the Audit Committee at Impossible Foods. She formerly served as Chief Financial Officer at Dropbox. She also served as Chief Financial Officer & Executive Vice President at Adelphia Communications. She leads the financial operations at Dropbox, including our accounting, corporate development, financial planning and analysis, tax and real estate teams. Previously, she served as Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Motorola Mobility. She previously served as Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at Motorola Mobility. She was previously Chief Financial Officer of Marsh & McLennan Companies, a publicly traded professional services firm. She's a tech finance veteran, having also held Chief Financial Officer roles at 360networks, Metricom and Adelphia Communications, where she joined as part of a new executive team that oversaw one of the most complex bankruptcy cases in U.S. history. She is a Director of SIRIUS XM Radio and has served as Director of InfoSpace.

name: Vanessa Moungar
bio: Ms. Vanessa Moungar serves as Group Chief Diversity & Inclusion Officer at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton.

name: Trisha Ayyagari

name: Tim Schaeffer
bio: Mr. Tim Schaeffer is a co-founder of Depth.

name: Tiffany Daniele
bio: Ms. Tiffany Daniele serves as Chief Financial Officer at Union Square Hospitality Group. Ms. Daniele serves as Chief Financial Officer at USHG Acquisition. From February 2020 through June 2020, Ms. Daniele was Vice President, Financial Planning & Analysis at Cole Haan, Inc. From December 2017 through February 2020, Ms. Daniele was Vice President, Global Corporate Financial Planning & Analysis at Tapestry, Inc., a leading New York-based house of modern luxury accessories and lifestyle brands, comprising the Coach, Kate Spade and Stuart Weitzman brands, all of which have been part of the American fashion landscape for over 25 years. At Tapestry, Ms. Daniele served on the inaugural Inclusion Council, established in 2019 to ensure that people from diverse perspectives and backgrounds are included in business decisions. From January 2012 through December 2017, Ms. Daniele was at Kate Spade & Company, a global retail based company that operated lifestyle brands primarily focused on the sale of accessories and apparel, where she served as Senior Manager of Global Financial Planning & Analysis, then Director of Global Financial Planning & Analysis and Kate Spade Saturday and Jack Spade Finance, then Senior Director of Global Financial Planning & Analysis and International Finance. From June 2010 through January 2012, Ms. Daniele was a Manager of Corporate Business Development and Strategic Planning at Liz Claiborne, Inc., which owned and operated a global portfolio of retail-based premium brands including Juicy Couture, Kate Spade, Lucky Brand and Mexx, as well as a group of department store based brands that included Liz Claiborne, Monet, Dana Buchman, Mac & Jac, Kensie and others. From August 2006 through March 2010, Ms. Daniele was an Associate and then a Senior Associate at Bruckmann, Rosser, Sherill & Co., a New York-based private equity investment firm that specializes in management buyouts and recapitalizations of high quality, lower middle market U.S. companies in the consumer sector with strong market positions and/or growth potential. From July 2004 through June 2006, Ms. Daniele served as an analyst in the global consumer and retail investment banking division at Citigroup. Ms. Daniele received a bachelor's degree in Commerce from the McIntire School of Commerce of the University of Virginia.

name: Thomas Delarue
position: Marketing Director, Lifestyle Fragrances & Parfums d'Exception - Europe Zone, L'Oréal Luxe
bio: Mr. Thomas Delarue serves as Marketing Director, Lifestyle Fragrances & Parfums d'Exception - Europe Zone, L'Oréal Luxe at L'Oreal.

name: Thomas Cho
bio: Mr. Thomas Cho serves as Chief Supply Chain Officer at Revlon. He served as Chief Operating Officer at Transcendia.

name: Thomas Brown
bio: Mr. Thomas Brown serves as Chief Executive Officer at Mineral Fusion Natural Brands.

name: Tarang Amin
bio: Mr. Tarang Amin serves as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer at E.L.F. Cosmetics. He also serves as Advisor & Board Member at Knox Lane. He has more than 25 years of consumer products experience, as well as a demonstrated record of driving profitable growth at the companies he leads. Previously, he served as President, Chief Executive Officer and Director of Schiff Nutrition, a manufacturer of nutritional supplements, from March 2011 to January 2013. Under his leadership, Schiff, with leading brands Airborne, MegaRed, Digestive Advantage and Move Free, grew enterprise value from $190 million to $1.5 billion. Prior to that, Mr. Amin worked for The Clorox Company, a multinational manufacturer and marketer of consumer products, from December 2002 to March 2011. He served as Vice President, General Manager of The Clorox Company's $1.7 billion Litter, Food and Charcoal Strategic Business Units, taking Kingsford, Hidden Valley and Fresh Step to new records. He also served in senior management roles that helped to double the sales of the global Clorox franchise to $1.5 billion. Prior to Clorox, Mr. Amin held management positions at Procter & Gamble, a multinational consumer goods company, where he helped grow Pantene's sales from $50 million to $2 billion, as well as helped increase sales of Bounty by $300 million. Mr. Amin earned his B.A. in international policy and M.B.A. from Duke University.

name: Sue Nabi
bio: Ms. Sue Nabi serves as Chief Executive Officer & Board Member at Coty. She is a recognized global innovator and beauty industry entrepreneur, the founder and CEO of the new-age luxury skincare line Orveda. She brings a proven track record of success, including 20 years with L'Oréal, where she served in a variety of executive roles, such as President for iconic brands L'Oréal Paris and Lancôme. She has an Advanced master's degree in Marketing Management, ESSEC (Paris Business School) and is a qualified engineer in Agronomy and Environment.

bio: Mr. Stéphane Rinderknech serves as President and CEO of L'Oréal USA, Executive Vice President North America at L'Oreal.

name: Stephane Delbos
bio: Mr. Stephane Delbos serves as Chief Procurement Officer at Coty. He is responsible for implementing Coty's multi-year procurement strategy, which includes achieving a competitive cost structure, reducing complexity, and strengthening Coty's new product pipeline with leading innovation from external suppliers. He is a respected senior procurement professional with over 18 years of experience in the beauty and pharmaceutical industries. Prior to joining Coty, He held several local and global procurement positions at Pfizer and Ipsen.

name: Stefan Hobl
position: Co-Founder, Chief Financial Officer & Board Member
bio: Mr. Stefan Hobl is a Co-Founder of Butter and serves as its Chief Financial Officer and Board Member.

name: Sophie Chassat
bio: Ms. Sophie Chassat an alumna of the Ecole Normale Superieure-Rue d'Ulm and a professor of philosophy, Sophie Chassat has taught for seven years (including four years at the university level) and has published several works. Having created and headed the Verbal Identity Department at communications agency Angie for three years, she was President of Intikka - a consulting firm specializing in brand philosophy - from June 2017 until July 2019. Since July 2019, she has been a partner of the Wemean leadership consulting firm specializing in the strategic issues of raison d'etre (purpose) and mission (official mission statements).

name: Sophie Bellon
bio: Ms. Sophie Bellon, Born August 19, 1961, Nationality: French, Graduate of the Ecole des hautes etudes commerciales du Nord (EDHEC). First appointed: July 26, 1989. Expiration of current term: at the Annual Shareholders Meeting held to adopt the financial statements for Fiscal 2023. Main role: Chairwoman of the Board of Directors, Sodexo and Interim Chief Executive Officer. Sophie Bellon has been Chairwoman of Sodexo's Board of Directors since 2016 and has also acted as interim Chief Executive Officer since October 1, 2021. Background - Sophie Bellon began her career in 1985 with Credit Lyonnais in the United States as a mergers and acquisitions advisor for the bank's French clientele in New York. She joined Sodexo in 1994 as a senior analyst in the Group Finance Department. In 2001, she was appointed Project Manager - Strategic Financial Planning within the Group Strategic Planning Department to develop and implement key performance indicators for the Group. In September 2005, she was named Group Vice President of Client Retention and was responsible for the worldwide deployment of the initiative on client retention. In September 2008, she was appointed Chief Executive Officer of Corporate Services for Sodexo France. In that capacity, she also took over responsibility for Facilities Management (FM) activities in France in September 2010. In November 2013, Sophie Bellon was appointed Vice Chairwoman of the Sodexo Board of Directors (replacing Robert Baconnier), with specific responsibility for increasing the pace of Research, Development and Innovation, particularly in Quality of Life services. On January 26, 2016, Sophie Bellon became Chairwoman of the Board of Directors of Sodexo S.A. Background - Sophie Bellon began her career in 1985 with Credit Lyonnais in the United States as a mergers and acquisitions advisor for the bank's French clientele in New York. She joined Sodexo in 1994 as a senior analyst in the Group Finance Department. In 2001, she was appointed Project Manager - Strategic Financial Planning within the Group Strategic Planning Department to develop and implement key performance indicators for the Group. In September 2005, she was named Group Vice President of Client Retention and was responsible for the worldwide deployment of the initiative on client retention. In September 2008, she was appointed Chief Executive Officer of Corporate Services for Sodexo France. In that capacity, she also took over responsibility for Facilities Management (FM) activities in France in September 2010. In November 2013, Sophie Bellon was appointed Vice Chairwoman of the Sodexo Board of Directors (replacing Robert Baconnier), with specific responsibility for increasing the pace of Research, Development and Innovation, particularly in Quality of Life services. On January 26, 2016, Sophie Bellon became Chairwoman of the Board of Directors of Sodexo S.A. Other positions and corporate offices held - Chairwoman: PB Holding SAS. Member of the Board of Directors: L'Oreal; Chairwoman of L'Oreal's Human Resources and Remuneration Committee; Chairwoman of L'Oreal's Nominations and Governance Committee, Member of L'Oreal's Audit Committee. Member of the Board of Directors: Association nationale des societes par actions (ANSA); Association francaise des entreprises privees (AFEP); Association Comite France Chine; United Way Alliance (UWA). Other positions and corporate offices held within the past five years but no longer held - Vice Chairwoman of the Board of Directors: Sodexo S.A. (Term ended: January 2016), Chairwoman of the Management Board: Bellon SA (France) (Term ended: September 2015), Founding member: Pierre Bellon Foundation (Term ended: September 2018), Co-Chair: Sodexo Women's international Forum for Talent (SWIFT) (Term ended: June 2018).

name: Sidney Toledano
position: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Fashion Group
bio: Mr. Sidney Toledano served as Chief Executive Officer and Vice Chairman at Christian Dior. He also serves as Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Fashion Group at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton. He served as Chief Executive Officer at Christian Dior. He joined Dior in 1994, rapidly making his mark with the launch of the Lady Dior handbag, which remains a bestseller for the brand. He was promoted to ceo in 1998, and since then has overseen a tenfold increase in the brand's revenues.

name: Shirley Pinkson
bio: Ms. Shirley Pinkson is a Co-Founder of W3ll People. She is an A-list beauty pro who brings an elite level of artistry and insight to the W3LL PEOPLE founding team. Her 20 year career working in leadership positions at prestigious corporations ranging from Barney's New York to M.A.C. is most renowned for success in helping shape NARS Cosmetic into a global phenomenon. Leveraging this wealth of experience, and a demanding eye for perfection, Shirley leads W3LL PEOPLE Supernatural Makeup product development. Gifted with an uncanny beauty sensibility, Shirley delivers spot on solutions every time. Performance, simplicity and quiet confidence are the key qualities that shape her winning style. Shirley is highly sought after for her make up genius with high profile clients including Naomi Campbell and Isabella Rossellini. Shirley's work has been featured in every facet of media ranging from print editorial work in New York Times to national TV campaigns

name: Shimei Fan Ph.D
bio: Dr. Shimei Fan serves as Chief Scientific Officer at Coty.

name: Seun Sodipo
bio: Ms. Seun Sodipo serves as Chief Financial Officer at Glossier. Seun most recently led Product Finance & Strategy at Stripe after having spent multiple years in private equity and mergers & acquisitions and will lead the Accounting and Finance teams. Seun's strategic finance background, combined with fundraising and public market knowledge, sets Glossier up well as they continue to scale their business and brand. Seun will partner with Vanessa to transition to the finance org when she joins.

name: Ségolène Frère-Gallienne
bio: Ms. Ségolène Frère-Gallienne serves as a Board Member at Christian Dior.

name: Scott Milsten
bio: Mr. Scott Milsten serves as Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Chief People Officer at E.L.F. Cosmetics. He has served as Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary since January 2014 and, in addition, as Chief People Officer since August 2016. Previously, he served as Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary at Schiff Nutrition from July 2011 to January 2013. Prior to that, he was Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary of Celera Corporation, a healthcare diagnostics company, from August 2009 until Celera's sale to Quest Diagnostics Incorporated in June 2011. He also served as Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary of Celera from November 2008 to August 2009. Prior to Celera, he was Deputy General Counsel for Gen-Probe Incorporated, a molecular diagnostic products and services company. Prior to joining Gen-Probe, he practiced corporate law with the law firm of Latham & Watkins LLP. he holds a J.D. from the University of Pennsylvania Law School and a B.A. in English from Duke University.

name: Sarah Stuart
bio: Ms. Sarah Stuart serves as Chief People Officer at Glossier.

name: Samuel du Riale
bio: Mr. Samuel du Riale serves as Chief Executive Officer at L'Oreal.( Korea)

name: Roxanne Quimby
bio: Ms. Roxanne Quimby is a Co-Founder of Burt's Bees.

name: Ronald Perelman
bio: Mr. Ronald Perelman is the Founder and serves as Chairman & Chief Executive Officer at MacAndrews & Forbes. He also serves as Vice Chairman at Dan's Hamptons Media. He is also the Chairman of Scientific Games. The principal interests of MacAndrews & Forbes include AM General, Deluxe Entertainment Services Group, Harland Clarke, Merisant, Revlon, Scantron, Scientific Games Corporation, SIGA Technologies, Valassis and vTv Therapeutics. Over the past four decades, Mr. Perelman has become known as an accomplished industrialist and generous philanthropist. He is recognized as an innovative leader and a major supporter of many of the nation's most prominent cultural, educational and medical institutions. In April 2014, the Ronald O. Perelman Center for Emergency Services at NYU Langone Medical Center opened. The Center more than tripled the size of the former Emergency Department, helping to meet the growing need for emergency care service in NYC. Mr. Perelman's commitment to education and passion for entrepreneurship is reflected by his landmark donation to Columbia Business School in 2013, establishing the Ronald O. Perelman Center for Business Innovation. The gift will fund the creation of a new facility and develop programming for the next generation of global business leaders. A longtime supporter of the University of Pennsylvania, Mr. Perelman announced the creation of the Perelman Center for Political Science and Economics in February 2013. The Center will foster the teaching and research required to develop positions on national and international matters. His commitment to cutting-edge health research translates into life-changing advancements for patients in New York and around the world, particularly through his establishing the Ronald O. Perelman Heart Institute at New York Presbyterian Hospital (2009), the Ronald O. Perelman and Claudia Cohen Center for Reproductive Medicine at Weill Cornell Medical Center (2008), and the Ronald O. Perelman Department of Dermatology at New York University Langone Medical Center (1991). As chairman of Revlon, Mr. Perelman has demonstrated a longstanding commitment to improving women's health. In 1990 he created the Revlon/UCLA Women's Cancer Research Program, which led to the development of Herceptin, the groundbreaking treatment for breast cancer. The EIF Revlon Run/Walk has raised more than $100 million to fight women's cancers. In 2014, he co-founded, along with Barbra Streisand, the Women's Heart Alliance to raise awareness, encourage action and drive new research to fight heart disease in women. As a champion of culture, in June 2016, Mr. Perelman announced a $75 million lead gift to fund the Perelman Performing Arts Center at the World Trade Center. Scheduled to open in early 2020, the new Perelman Center will serve as a world-class performance space in Lower Manhattan, producing and premiering new works of theater, dance, music, film and opera. Mr. Perelman is the Vice Chairman of the Apollo Theater Foundation and sits on the board of many institutions. Among them are: The Museum of Modern Art; New York Presbyterian Hospital; Weill Cornell Medical Center; Columbia Business School; NYU Langone Medical Center and The One Foundation. Mr. Perelman received a BS in Economics and an MBA from the Wharton School of Business at the University of Pennsylvania. He is an Angel Investor.

name: Robyn Fenty
bio: Ms. Robyn Fenty is the Founder and Creator & serves as Chief Executive Officer at Fenty Beauty.

name: Robert Singer
bio: Mr. Robert Singer serves as Board Member, Chair of Audit & Finance Committee & Lead Independent Director at Coty. From 2006 to 2009 he served as Chief Executive Officer of Barilla Holding S.p.A., an Italian food company, and before that, he served as the President and Chief Operating Officer of Abercrombie and Fitch Co. from May 2004 until August 2005. He served as Chief Financial Officer of Gucci Group N.V. from 1995 to 2004. Mr. Singer started his career at Coopers & Lybrand in 1977. Mr. Singer also serves as a director of Gianni Versace S.p.A. and a director and member of the audit committee of Mead Johnson Nutrition. He also serves as a director and chair of the audit committees of Tiffany & Co. and Jimmy Choo PLC. Mr. Singer has served as a senior advisor to CCMP Capital Advisors, LLC since 2011. He received a Bachelor of Arts Humanities degree from Johns Hopkins University, a Master of Arts degree in Comparative Literature from the University of California, Irvine and graduated from New York University with a Master of Science in Accounting.

name: Robert Cohen
bio: Mr. Robert Cohen serves as Chairman & Chief Executive Officer at Astral Brands.

name: Robert Caruso
bio: On June 15, 2022, the Company appointed Robert Caruso, Managing Director of Alvarez & Marsal (A&M), as Chief Restructuring Officer of the Company (CRO).

name: Richelle Parham
bio: Ms. Richelle Parham serves as a Board Member at Best Buy. She also serves as Executive chairman at Shyn (Personal Products). She serves as an advisor at Cantico and Girls Who Code, She serves as Board Member at Drexel University Endowment. She served as Board Member at TOCA Football. She served as Managing Director at WestRiver Group. She served as Operating Partner at Camden Partners. She is a seasoned senior-level Executive, who possesses more than 20 years of global strategy and marketing experience for prolific corporations such as eBay, Visa, Digitas, and Citibank. She has a proven track record of leading high-performing business and marketing teams, utilizing strategic and analytical decision-making expertise to successfully drive key business performance. Most recently, Ms. Parham served 4.5 years as VP Chief Marketing Officer of eBay where she leveraged her background in consumer and digital marketing to develop strategies and execute all marketing activities to reach 180+ million active eBay users. Prior to joining eBay, she served as head of Global Marketing Innovation and Initiatives, and head of Global Marketing Services at Visa. Her experience also includes 13 years at Digitas, a world-leading marketing agency, where she held a variety of senior leadership roles. She earned a double B.S. degree from Drexel University in Business Administration and Design Arts.

name: Richard Wolford
bio: Richard G. Wolford is Diamond Food's interim President and Chief Executive Officer. He has served as member of the Diamond Food's Board of Directors since April 0f 2011. Previously, he served as Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer of Del Monte Foods from May of 2000 through March of 2011. Mr. Wolford began his career in the food industry at Dole Foods, where he held a range of management positions. In 1996, he worked with TPG, a private equity partnership, to acquire Del Monte Foods. On completion of the acquisition, he was named Chief Executive Officer. He successfully took the Company public in a 1999 and was elected Chairman in May 2000. Since September 2011, Mr. Wolford has served on the Board of Directors of Schiff Nutrition International, Inc., a provider of vitamins, nutritional supplements and nutrition bars, and Advantage Sales and Marketing LLC, a sales and marketing agency. From March 2008 to August 2009, Mr. Wolford served on the Board of Directors of Pulte Homes, Inc. Mr. Wolford holds a B.A. from Harvard University. He also serves as Advisor & Board Member at Knox Lane.

name: Richard Baruch Jr.
bio: Mr. Baruch has served as our Senior Vice President and Chief Commercial Officer since February 2014. Mr. Baruch most recently served as Senior Vice President and Chief Commercial Officer at Schiff Nutrition from July 2012 to January 2013. From December 2010 to June 2012, he was Vice President, Category Advisory Services at Coca-Cola Refreshments, a division of The Coca-Cola Company, a leading global beverage company, where he led an initiative to build a new organization and bring a new set of capabilities to Coca-Cola's North American business. From January 2009 to December 2012, Mr. Baruch was President and Chief Operating Officer of Cotn'Wash, Inc., a laundry products company. Prior to that, Mr. Baruch spent 14 years at The Clorox Company in a number of leadership roles, with the most recent as Vice President and General Manager of the Home Care business. He began his career at Procter & Gamble in various sales management roles. Mr. Baruch holds a B.A. in English from the University of Pennsylvania.

name: Reneé Snyder MD
bio: Ms. Reneé Snyder is a Co-Founder of W3ll People & serves as Physician. She is a board certified Dermatologist who brings an unprecedented level of scientific research and technology to W3LL PEOPLE. Her active participation in the American Academy of Dermatology and leadership in her own nationally recognized dermatology practice, affords W3LL PEOPLE the privilege of remaining on the forefront of medical discovery. Though Reneé enjoys leveraging the latest technological advancements to serve her clients, she is most concerned with product safety and long term health consequences. She applies the same approach in the oversight of W3LL PEOPLE product development. As a medical doctor, Reneé is committed to the use of the most effective, safe and healthy ingredients in W3LL PEOPLE cosmetics. Reneé is a member of Alpha Omega Alpha and graduated Magna Cum Laude from the University of Texas Medical Branch. She completed her internship at Christus St. Joseph Hospital in Houston and her dermatology residency training at the University of Texas Medical Branch in Galveston.

name: Renaud Donnedieu de Vabres
bio: Mr. Renaud Donnedieu de Vabres serves as a Board Member at Christian Dior.

name: Ravi Sankar
bio: Mr. Ravi Sankar serves as Chief Transformation Officer at Revlon. The Transformation Office will lead the implementation and execution of the Revlon Global Growth Acceleration (RGGA) program, driving Revlon towards sustained long-term growth and a stronger organizational capability. In his previous role with Revlon, he served as the Vice President, Finance and Business Operations., leading the 2018 Optimization Program, Global FP&A, Corporate Real Estate and Revlon's Shared Services operations. Before joining Revlon in 2018, Ravi had a long career with Colgate Palmolive Company in various leadership roles spanning the Middle East, Europe and North America as Finance Director, Division controller, and leading Colgate's global Finance transformation program. Ravi is a Chartered Accountant and a Graduate in Mathematics from Mahatma Gandhi University, India.

name: Ralph Bijou
bio: Mr. Ralph Bijou is a Co-Founder and serves as President and Board Member at Milani Cosmetics. He also serves as President of Jordana Cosmetics

name: Ralph Almanzar
bio: Mr. Ralph Almanzar serves as Board Member at Boosh Food.

name: Raj Nal
bio: Mr. Raj Nal serves as Chief Manufacturing Officer at Stila Cosmetics.

name: Prudvi Kaka
bio: Mr. Prudvi Kaka serves as Chief Scientific Officer at Deciem.

name: Pietro Beccari
bio: Mr. Pietro Beccari serves as Vice Chairman & Co-Chief Executive Officer at Christian Dior. He is a Business Administration graduate of Parma University in Italy. Pietro Beccari spent his earlier career in Marketing at Benckiser in Italy and Parmalat in the US, then in General Management at Henkel in Germany, where he was Corporate Vice-President for Haircare. In 2006 he joined LVMH as Executive Vice-President Marketing and Communications for Louis Vuitton before becoming Chairman and CEO of Fendi in 2012. Since February 2018, he has been Chairman and CEO of Christian Dior Couture. He also becomes a member of the LVMH Executive Committee.

name: Pierre Denis
bio: Mr. Pierre Denis served as Chief Executive Officer & Board Member at Jimmy Choo. He serves as a Venture Partner at Giant Ventures. He served as Senior Advisor to the Board at Coty. Mr. Denis was named CEO of Jimmy Choo in July 2012. Mr. Denis brings extensive experience in the global luxury fashion industry and joined Jimmy Choo from John Galliano, where he also held the position of CEO. He also serves as an Advisory Board Member at Giant Ventures. Mr. Denis began his career in perfume and cosmetics and joined LVMH, the diversified luxury goods group, in 1992. In 1999, he was appointed Managing Director, Asia Pacific for Parfums Christian Dior; in addition, he took over managing the Dior Couture Asian business in 2004. In 2006, Mr. Denis moved back to his native Paris to serve as Managing Director for Christian Dior Couture in Europe, the Middle East and India. After joining John Galliano in 2008, Mr. Denis successfully managed the business side of operations, developing the John Galliano and contemporary Galliano lines, and expanding the licensing business. Mr. Denis is a graduate of ESSEC Paris and is based in the London head office of Jimmy Choo.

name: Philippe Schaus
position: Executive of Wines and Spirits & Member of Executive Committee
bio: Mr. Philippe Schaus serves as Executive of Wines and Spirits & Member of Executive Committee at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton. A graduate of INSEAD, Philippe Schaus began his career in 1987 at J.P. Morgan Inc. before joining The Boston Consulting Group in 1990. In 1992 he became International Commercial Director of the Porcelain Tableware Division at Villeroy & Boch A.G. before being promoted Managing Director for the Division in 1999 and then Member of the Board. He joined Louis Vuitton in 2003 as President of the Europe Zone and was appointed Senior Vice President, International, in 2006. Between 2009 and 2011 he was Executive Vice President of Louis Vuitton. Mr. Schaus joined DFS Group in Hong Kong in 2011 as Group President of Merchandising and Marketing. He was named Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of DFS Group in 2012. He has been a member of the Executive Committee of LVMH since 2012.

name: Philip Solomon Jr.
bio: Mr. Philip Solomon serves as Executive Chairman at Palladio Beauty Group. Mr. Solomon Founded and served as Chief Executive Officer at Palladio Beauty Group. He serves as Board Member at Mineral Fusion Natural Brands.

name: Peter Harf
bio: Mr. Gerd Harf serves as Board Member at Keurig Dr Pepper. He also serves as Executive Chairman & Chairman of the Board at Coty. Peter Harf served as Coty's Chief Executive from 1993 to 2001. Peter is Managing Partner and Chairman of JAB and has extensive industry experience thanks to his previous roles as Deputy Chairman of Reckitt Benckiser and Chairman of AB InBev. He is also a former Board Member of Burger King. Peter holds an MBA from Harvard Business School as well as a Diploma and Doctorate in Economics from the University of Cologne, Germany.

name: Payal Jauhar
bio: Ms. Payal Jauhar serves as Associate Group Representative Director at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton.

name: Paul Murphy
bio: Mr. Paul F. Murphy serves as President and General Manager at Mirage Cosmetics.

name: Paul Bulcke
bio: Mr. Paul Bulcke serves as Board Member at Roche Holding. He serves as Chairman & Board Member at Nestlé. Mr. Paul Bulcke served as Chairman & Chief Executive Officer at Nestlé. He also serves as a Board Member at F. Hoffmann-La Roche. He also serves as Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors & Member of the Strategy and Sustainability, Nominations and Governance & Human Resources and Remuneration Committee at L'Oreal.

name: Patrice Caine
position: Chief Executive Officer, Member of the Executive Committee & Chairman
bio: Mr. Patrice Caine serves as a Board Member, Member of the Strategy and Sustainability Committee & Member of the Nominations and Governance Committee at L'Oreal. Mr. Patrice Caine serves as Chief Executive Officer, Member of the Executive Committee & Chairman at Thales Group. Patrice Caine is a graduate of the École Polytechnique and the École des Mines de Paris and holds the rank of Ingénieur en Chef of the Corps des Mines. He began his career in 1992 with the pharmaceutical group Fournier before becoming an adviser on mergers, acquisitions, and corporate strategy. From 1995 to 1998, he was a special adviser to the Prefect of the Franche-Comté region of France and head of the Industrial Development and Energy Division at DRIRE, the French agency responsible for industry, research, and the environment. From 1998 to 2000, he joined the Conseil Général des Mines, in charge of human resources for the Corps des Mines. At the same time, he was responsible for training engineering students at the École des Mines de Paris for the Technical Grand Corps of the French State. From 2000 to 2002, he served as the technical advisor on energy at the cabinet office of the French Minister for the economy, finance, and industry. In 2002, Patrice Caine joined the Thales Group's Strategy department before being appointed to manage the following operating units - Air & Naval, Communication, Navigation & Identification, Air Systems, Radio-communication Products, and Network & Infrastructure Systems and Protection Systems. In February 2013, he was appointed Senior Executive Vice-President, Chief Operating Officer, and Chief Performance Officer and joined the Executive Committee. Patrice Caine was appointed Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Thales in December 2014. He was awarded the Médaille de la Défense Nationale (National Defence Medal - Bronze) and in 2014, he was named Chevalier de l'Ordre National du Mérite (Knight of the National Order of Merit). He served as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer at Thales Corporate Ventures.

name: Pasquale Cusano
bio: Mr. Pasquale Cusano is a Co-Founder and serves as Board Member at Deciem.

name: Pascale Guerin-Laffineur
position: Chief Financial Officer Acquisitions - Active Cosmetics and Professionnal Products
bio: Ms. Pascale Guerin-Laffineur serves as Chief Financial Officer Acquisitions - Active Cosmetics and Professional Products at L'Oreal. She serves as a Board Member at Klesia. He served as a Board Member at Planet Payment. She joined as a Non-Executive Director in January 2017. She has spent the majority of her career in the travel retail industry at L'Oréal Travel Retail International, where she is currently Risk Management Director. Her previous roles within the company at the Group level include Deputy Director of Internal Audit as well as CFO, a post she held for several years. Prior to joining L'Oréal Ms. Pascale worked at KPMG.

name: Olivier Goudet
bio: Mr. Olivier Goudet serves as Non-Executive Chairman of the Board at JDE Peet's. He serves as board member at Coty. He serves as Chairman at Pret A Manger. He is the Chief Executive Officer and a Managing Partner of JAB, a position he has held since 2012. He started his professional career in 1990 at Mars, Inc. (Mars). After six years, he left Mars to join Valeo S.A. In 1998 he returned to Mars, where he became Chief Financial Officer in 2004. In 2008, his role was broadened to become the Executive Vice President as well as Chief Financial Officer. Previously, he served as an adviser to the board of directors of Mars and as the Chair of Anheuser-Busch InBev SA/NV. He holds a degree in Engineering from l'École Centrale Paris and graduated from the ESSEC Business School in Paris with a major in Finance.

name: Olga Levinzon
bio: Mr. Olga Levinzon serves as Senior Vice President, Investor Relations at Coty.

name: Nitin Passi
bio:
Mr. Nitin Passi serves as Managing Director at Lotus Herbals. He has been instrumental in increasing the revenues of Lotus Herbals by 25 folds within a span of 10 years and making it one of the most well respected Indian beauty brands in India and numerous other countries. Under his guidance Lotus Herbals expanded rapidly within India, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, Nepal, UAE, Oman, Mauritius and various other countries serving millions of customers though a distribution network of 150,000 premium outlets and 15,000 spas and beauty salons.
Before joining Lotus Herbals, Mr. Passi was a Senior Consult with Deloitte Consulting (part of Deloitte Touche Tohmastu), one of the most prominent management consulting firms of the world. Based out of Deloitte's Pittsburgh, USA office. Mr. Passi advised clients on critical management issues ranging from business process re-engineering, enterprise technology selection and implementation and mission-critical project management. He holds a Master of Business Administration (MBA) specializing in Strategy and Finance and Master of Science (MS) in Information Systems from the Katz Graduate School of Business at University of Pittsburgh, USA. He got his undergraduate education in Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA), specializing in marketing and consumer behavior. He additionally holds a Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com) - Honors in Tax Planning and Financial Management from the University of Delhi.

name: Niklas Haukohl
bio: Mr. Niklas Haukohl is a Co-Founder and serves as Chief Operating Officer and Chief Product Officer at Butter (Other Financial Services).

name: Nicolas Meyers
bio: Mr. Nicolas Meyers serves as Board Member & Member of the Audit Committee at L'Oreal. Mr. Nicolas Meyers, aged 32, aged has appointed as Director since 30th June 2020. French. Member of the Supervisory Board of the family holding company Tethys since 2011, member of the Supervisory Board of the investment subsidiary Tethys Invest since 2016, and Director of the Bettencourt Schueller Foundation since 2012. Nicolas Meyers has been a Director of L'Oreal since June 2020. Professional address: Tethys - 27-29, rue des Poissonniers - 92200 Neuilly-sur-Seine - France. Holds 1,500 L'Oreal shares. OTHER CORPORATE OFFICES AND DIRECTORSHIPS HELD - French companies - Tethys SAS - Member of the Supervisory Board. Tethys Invest SAS - Member of the Supervisory Board. Lille Capital SAS - Chairman. Others - Bettencourt Schueller Foundation - Member of the Board of Directors.

name: Nicolas Hieronimus
position: Chief Executive Officer, Member of the Executive Committee & Board Member
bio: Mr. Nicolas Hieronimus serves as Chief Executive Officer, Member of the Executive Committee & Board Member at L'Oreal. Mr. Nicolas Hieronimus serves as Deputy Chief Executive Officer at L'Oreal. he successfully created the Fructis haircare range. In 1998, he became General Manager of the Garnier Maybelline division in the UK. In 2000, he was named General Manager, L'Oréal Paris France, and then International General Manager for L'Oréal Paris, which he repositioned as the "accessible luxury" brand. In particular, he developed skincare with the creation of Dermo expertise, Solar expertise, and Men expert. In 2005, he became General Manager of L'Oréal Mexico. In 2008, he became General Manager of the L'Oréal Professional Products Division and he increased its global leadership, driven in particular by the launch of Inoa hair color. In January 2011, he was appointed President L'Oréal Luxe, a role that he held until the end of 2018. In addition to this role, he took up his new position as President Selective Divisions (Luxury, Active Cosmetics, Professional Products,) on 1 July 2013. He was most recently named Deputy CEO in charge of Divisions on May 1, 2017.

name: Nicolas Bazire
bio: Mr. Nicolas Bazire serves as Managing Director and Board Member at Financière Agache. He is a Board Member & Executive, Development, and Acquisitions at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton. He serves as Managing Director at Groupe Arnault. He previously served on Board of Carrefour. He is a graduate of the French Naval Academy (1978), the Institut d'Etudes Politiques de Paris (1984) and studied at the Ecole Nationale administration. He is an honorary public auditor with the French Cour des Comptes, the state audit body. He served as Cabinet Director for Prime Minister Edouard Balladur from 1993 to 1995. In 1995 he joined Rothschild et Cie Banque as a Managing Partner. He was appointed Managing Director of Groupe Arnault in 1999 and became a member of the LVMH Board of Directors. He is a member of the Executive Committee. He serves as Board Member at Suez and Atos. He is a Commander in the French Naval Reserve. He has been awarded the honorary titles of Officier dans l'Ordre National du Mérite and Chevalier de la Légion d'Honneur.

name: Nicola Kilner
bio: Ms. Nicola Kilner is a Co-Founder and serves as Chief Executive Officer at Deciem.

name: Nathan de Wissocq
bio: Mr. Nathan de Wissocq serves as Director, Corporate Finance & M&A at L'Oreal. He served as Finance Director - Corporate of Africa-Middle East at L'Oreal. Earlier he served as Project Manager, M&A and Corporate Finance at L'Oréal. Previously, he served as an Internal Auditor at L'Oréal.

name: Nathalie Kristo
bio: Ms. Nathalie Kristo serves as Chief Executive Officer and Board Member at Pacifica Beauty. She previously served as Chief Executive Officer at Huda Beauty. In this role, she led the brand's omnichannel strategy with the rapid acceleration of its direct-to-consumer business and helped expand the brand into new global markets and product categories. Prior to that, she spent most of her career at L'Oreal, notably as the Global Brand President of NYX Professional Makeup where she scaled and globalized the business, amplifying the brand's unique social and digital footprint to drive explosive growth. She has also held the positions of Senior Vice President of Marketing for L'Oreal Paris USA and General Manager of Maybelline New York and Garnier in Canada.

name: Natacha Valla
bio: Ms. Natacha Valla serves as Board Observer at Wakam. Ms. Valla serves as Board Member at Tikehau IM. Doctor of economics, graduate of the European University Institute of Florence, Ms. Valla began her career in 2001 as an economist at the European Central Bank. After a stint at Goldman Sachs as Executive Director, in 2014 she became head of the Policy & Strategy department of the EIB (European Investment Bank). A member of several boards of large groups over the past 10 years, she, also dean of the School of Management and Innovation at Science-Po Paris, has been Deputy Director General for Monetary Policy at the ECB since 2018.

name: Nabil Mallick
bio: Mr. Nabil Mallick serves as General Partner at Thrive Capital. He serves as Board Member at Glossier. He also serves as a Partner at Thrive Capital. He serves as Board Member at Guru and Grailed. He is an Angel Investor. He served as Head of Heinz North America Budgeting & Business Planning at H.J. Heinz Company.

name: Mike Ferry
bio: Mr. Mike Ferry serves as Operating Partner, Consumer Group at Gryphon Investors. He serves as Board Member at Metagenics. He serves as Board Member at RoC. He serves as Board Member at Milani Cosmetics. He served as Operating Partner at CAVU Venture Partners. He joined Gryphon in 2020 as an Operating Partner for Gryphon's Consumer Team. He has over 25 years of experience building brands and delivering profitable growth across numerous consumer packaged goods companies. At Gryphon, he works closely with the senior management of portfolio companies to aid in delivering strong sales and profitability performance utilizing commercial and operational levers. In addition, he is a member of Gryphon's investment review committee and works closely with the consumer deal team to identify, evaluate, and execute investments.

name: Mike Ferraro
bio: Mr. Mike Ferraro serves as Chief Commercial Officer at Pacifica Beauty.

name: Michelle Taylor
bio: Ms. Michelle Taylor serves as Chairman of the Board at Milani Cosmetics. She served as Interim Chief Executive Officer at Milani Cosmetics. Ms. Taylor served as Executive Advisor at Gryphon Investors.

name: Michelle Kluz
bio: Ms. Michelle Kluz serves as Chief Executive Officer at Stila Cosmetics.

name: Michael Kremer
bio: Mr. Michael Kremer serves as Chief Marketing Officer at Naturium. Mr. Michael Kremer serves as Chief Marketing Officer at Pacifica Beauty.

name: Michael Kennedy
bio: Mr. Michael Kennedy serves as General Manager and Chief Financial Officer at Pacifica Beauty.

name: Michael David
bio: Mr. Michael David serves as Chief Omnichannel Officer at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton.

name: Michael Cape
bio: Mr. Michael Cape serves as Chairman at Groupe Marcelle.

name: Meagan Fitzsimmons
bio: Mr. Meagan Fitzsimmons serves as Vice President & Chief Compliance Officer at Revlon.

name: Maureen Watson
bio: Ms. Maureen Watson serves as Chief Product Officer at Madison Reed. She also serves as Advisor & Board Member at Knox Lane.

name: Matthew Farron
position: Deal Partner & Head of Consumer Group
bio: Mr. Matthew Farron serves as Deal Partner & Head of Consumer Group at Gryphon Investors. He serves as Board Member at RoC. He serves as Board Member at Mechanix Wear. He serves as Board Member at Revision Goodier. He serves as Board Member at Metagenics. He also served as Board Member at Matrixx Initiatives and Dessert Holdings. He joined Gryphon in 2005 and is currently a member of the Consumer- Retail Group. He is responsible for analyzing, executing, and monitoring investments. Previously, Mr. Farron was an investment banker at CIBC World Markets. He earned a B.S. in Business Administration from Boston University. He serves as Board Member at Milani.

name: Mary Van Praag
bio: Ms. van Praag serves as Chief Executive Officer at Milani Cosmetics. Ms. van Praag is President, Intimates Group of Chico's FAS, which includes the Soma and TellTale brands. She joined the Company in September 2017, bringing over 30 years of global, omnichannel leadership experience. Ms. van Praag has a proven track record of developing brands and executing growth strategies. She is recognized as a passionate leader that has enabled the Soma organization to achieve excellence by inspiring capabilities for long-term success. Under Ms. van Praag's leadership, Soma's comps turned strongly positive, innovation is center to key product launches, new partnerships increased customer awareness, acquisition and sales, and she successfully launched the Company's first digital-only brand, TellTale. Prior to joining Chico's FAS, she was Chief Executive Officer of Perricone MD where she led the prestige skincare brand through digital, broadcast and international expansion. Previously, Ms. van Praag held international and domestic executive leadership roles at Coty, Inc., including serving as General Manager of OPI Products Inc., as well as corporate and regional positions at Johnson & Johnson. In 2019, Ms. van Praag was named a Top Woman in Retail by Total Retail and Women in Retail Leadership. She received a Bachelor of Science in Business, with a Marketing Major from Miami University, and completed the General Management Program at Harvard Business School. The Company's intimate brands, Soma and TellTaleTM, will continue to be led by Mary van Praag, President, Intimates Group, who joined the Company in September 2017.

name: Martine Williamson
bio: Ms. Martine Williamson serves as Chief Marketing Officer at Revlon. She served as Chief Marketing Officer and Executive Vice President at Glansaol. Martine comes with over 20 years of experience in the Beauty and Fashion sector with expertise in Global Consumer Marketing, Brand Management, and Digital Content Creation.
