As CMO of Glansaol, Martine oversees all marketing efforts across Brands, including marketing development, consumer engagement, product development & all Media and Advertising. Prior to Glansaol, Martine spent over 15 years at Revlon Inc., where she was most recently Senior Vice President of Global Marketing responsible for the $1B Revlon portfolio worldwide. She was responsible for all aspects of the consumer experience including Strategy, Communication, Product Development and Digital across all of Revlon's product lines globally. Martine led the Brand through a successful turnaround and left delivering both Net sales and profit and building the Brand back to relevancy with strong market share growth. Prior to Revlon, Martine spent a number of years at Calvin Klein focused on Women's Collection and Ready-to-wear, as well as the highly productive, prestige fragrance business, where she was responsible for the development and delivery of consistent Brand messaging and advertising at Retail. Martine holds a Bachelor's degree from the State University of Oswego in New York.

name: Martina Joseph
bio: Ms. Martina Joseph serves as Chief Executive Officer at Dr. Hauschka.

name: Marie-Veronique Belloeil-Melkin
bio: Ms. Marie-Veronique Belloeil-Melkin a graduate of ESSEC, Marie-Veronique Belloeil-Melkin joined Parfums Christian Dior in 1987 to work for the Travel Retail Europe department and was involved in the Company's development over a period of more than 30 years in a field sales position in the European markets. Marie-Veronique Belloeil-Melkin has held the role of Retail Manager for Parfums Christian Dior since 1996 and is based in Helsinki, Finland. An elected member of the SE Works Council of Agache (formerly Groupe Arnault SEDCS), Christian Dior and LVMH from 2014 to 2020, Marie-Veronique Belloeil-Melkin was appointed Director representing the employees of LVMH SE by the SE Works Council on November 10, 2020.

name: Marie-Josee Kravis
position: Vice Chair of Boards and Chair & Member of Board of Governing Trustees
bio: Ms. Marie-Josée Kravis serves as Vice Chair of Boards and Chair & Member of Board of Governing Trustees at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center.

name: Maria Aramburuzabala Larregui
bio: Ms. Mariasun Aramburuzabala Larregui serves as Board Member at Coty. She joined the Board in December 2020. Ms. Aramburuzabala is President of the Board & CEO of Tresalia Capital, a leading global investor with investments and transactional experience throughout Latin America, Asia, Europe and the U.S. Tresalia has a particular expertise in consumer goods companies, with an investment portfolio including Anheuser-Busch InBev (ABI), Tory Burch, Kio Networks, Casper, Multiplan, Kraft-Heinz, Aliat, and Medistik, as well as early-stage investments like Kavak, Kovi, Editas, Minu, Miroculus, and GAIA. Ms. Aramburuzabala also serves as a Board Director for several global corporations and institutions, including Anheuser-Busch InBev (ABI) and Grupo Modelo. She is one of Latin America's most prominent business leaders and her achievements have been recognized by multiple institutions. Ms. Aramburuzabala graduated from Instituto Tecnológico Autónomo de México.

name: Marc-Antoine Jamet
bio: Mr. Marc-Antoine Jamet serves as General Secretary at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton. He has been President of Cosmetic Valley since 2011, and several LVMH Maisons and entities are located there: Guerlain, Parfums Christian Dior and LVMH Recherche, the Group's perfumes and cosmetics R&D unit.

name: Mandy Fields
position: Chief Financial Officer, Finance & Chief Accounting Officer, Accounting
bio: Ms. Mandy Fields serves as Senior Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at E.L.F. Cosmetics. She serves as Board Member at Allbirds. Previously she served as Chief Financial Officer at Beverages & More. She joined BevMo! after successful stints at Albertsons Companies, Gap, Inc., and J.P. Morgan. She has proven to be an extremely accomplished leader in guiding the financial operations for the number one specialty beverage retailer on the West Coast. She joined e.l.f. Beauty in 2019 with over 16 years of finance experience, most recently as the Chief Financial Officer of BevMo!, the number one retailer of alcoholic beverages on the West Coast. At BevMo!, she was responsible for overseeing accounting, risk management, investor relations, financial planning and analysis, and merchandise planning. Prior to this, she held positions of increasing responsibility at Albertsons Companies LLC, a grocery company. She began her retail finance career at The Gap, Inc., after working in equity capital markets at J.P. Morgan. She holds a Bachelor of Science in Finance from Indiana University of Bloomington's Kelley School of Business.

name: Lynn Tilton
bio: Ms. Lynn Tilton is the Founder and serves as Chief Executive Officer at Patriarch Partners. Ms. Tilton served as Chief Executive Officer and Chairman at MD Helicopters. She also served as Chief Executive Officer at DURA Automotive Systems. Ms. Tilton served as Chief Executive Officer at Jane & Company. She is a Co-Founder and also serves as Chief Executive Officer at Ken Paves You Are Beautiful. She serves as Board Member at Scan-Optics. She also serves as Chief Executive Officer at Stila Cosmetics. Ms. Tilton serves as sole director and chair of the board at all of her portfolio companies including Natura Water. She is passionate about saving American jobs by saving American companies. Since 2000, through affiliated investment funds, Ms. Tilton has had ownership in and restructured more than 240 companies with combined revenues in excess of $100 billion, representing more than 675,000 jobs. He served as Board Member at Universal Instruments.

name: Lori Keith
bio: Ms. Lori Keith serves as Board Member at E.L.F. Cosmetics. She serves as Senior Research Analyst & Portfolio Manager at Parnassus Investments. She joined Parnassus Investments in 2005 and was previously a Parnassus research intern. Prior to joining the firm, Ms. Keith was a Vice President of Investment Banking at Deloitte & Touche Corporate Finance LLC and was a Senior Associate in Robertson Stephens & Company's investment banking division. Prior to that, she worked in the management consulting practice at Ernst & Young. Ms. Keith received her bachelor's degree in economics from the University of California, Los Angeles and her master's degree in business administration from Harvard Business School.

name: Laurie Minc
position: Co-Founder, Senior Advisor and Board Member
bio: Ms. Laurie Minc is a Co-Founder and serves as Senior Advisor and Board Member at Milani Cosmetics.

name: Laurie Lam
bio: Ms. Laurie Lam serves as Chief Brand Officer at E.L.F. Cosmetics.

name: Laurent Schmitt
position: Global Head of Corporate Finance, Treasury and Financing
bio: Mr. Laurent Schmitt serves as Global Head of Corporate Finance, Treasury and Financing at L'Oreal. He also serves as Chief Executive Officer at BOLD (Business Opportunities for L'Oréal Development). He serves as Chief Executive Officer at Business Opportunities for L'Oréal Development. Previously, he served as a SVP, Corporate Finance at L'Oréal Group. He serves as a Board Member at EcoMundo.

name: Laurent Mercier
bio: Mr. Laurent Mercier serves as Chief Financial Officer at Coty. After graduating from the Parisian business school ESSEC, Laurent joined EY to go on to Danone, where he held several roles in Custodian and Business Planning, Sales and Marketing as well as Corporate. He then served as CFO at Evian Volvic Germany before a three-year-stint in Singapore as CFO for Asia, Middle East and Africa. He also led Danone's Dairy Turnaround in Europe.

name: Laurent Kleitman
bio: Mr. Laurent Kleitman serves as Co-Chief Executive Officer & President at Christian Dior.

name: Lauren Levitan
bio: Ms. Lauren Levitan serves as Chief Financial Officer at Faire. Ms. Levitan served as Chief Financial Officer at Fanatics. She joined Fanatics as Chief Financial Officer in June 2015 and oversees accounting, financial planning, strategic analysis and investor relations to drive ongoing multi-channel growth across all divisions of the company. Lauren has more than 20 years of strong operational, financial and strategic experience across a variety of retail businesses. Lauren was most recently the Co-Founder and Managing Partner at Moxie Capital LLC where she provided capital investment and advisory services to branded, consumer-facing businesses that operated in wholesale, retail, eCommerce and direct sales. Prior to launching Moxie Capital LLC, Lauren was a Managing Director and Senior Research Analyst at Cowen & Co. where she established the investment bank's inaugural consumer retail franchise, while also leading a team of analysts covering many other consumer sectors. She joined Cowen from Robertson Stephens, where she was a Managing Director covering specialty and multi-channel retail and was the first analyst to apply retail industry experience to the emerging online retail channel. Prior to joining Robertson Stephens, she worked in various capacities in the retail industry at Crate & Barrel and the Gymboree Corporation gaining experience in merchandising, inventory management and store operations. Earlier in her career, she worked in equity capital markets and investment banking at Goldman Sachs. Lauren, who earned an MBA from Stanford University and a Bachelor of Arts degree in Political Science from Duke University, is a sports fan with particular passion for Duke basketball, Stanford football, San Francisco Giants, Chicago Blackhawks and the Chicago Bears. Lauren is active in initiatives to support women's leadership development in business, including the Stanford GSB's Women's Initiative Network (WIN) where she serves on the Advisory Committee. Lauren is also Co-Chair of the Duke University Northern California Women's Forum and is the former Chair of the Stanford Graduate School of Business Trust.

name: Laura Nelson
bio: Ms. Laura Nelson is a Co-Founder of Seed Beauty. She is also a Co-Founder of ColourPop & serves as its President. SHe has over 17 years of retail, sales and marketing, and product development experience. Laura received her BA in Retail and Consumer Studies from the University of Arizona.

name: Kyle Leahy
bio: Ms. Kyle Leahy serves as Chief Executive Officer at Glossier. Kyle spent the past nine years at Cole Haan, including time as part of Nike Inc., in multiple Strategy, General Management, E-Commerce and Retail leadership roles, most recently as the Executive Vice President & GM of North America. Kyle will be responsible for driving revenue and building end-to-end customer experiences across channels. Kyle will lead the Retail, Sales, International, and Operations teams.

name: Kristin Dolan
bio: Ms. Kristin A. Dolan serves as Board Member at The Wendy's Company, Revlon and AMC Networks. She is the Founder and serves as Chief Executive Officer at 605. She served as Chief Operating Officer at Cablevision Systems. She is the Founder and Chief Executive Officer of 605. She founded 605 in November 2016, bringing more than 30 years of media and entertainment experience to her role with the company. At 605, she leads all day-to-day business operations including key client relationships, product development, sales, research, finance, legal and marketing. She is also the Founder and Managing Partner of Dolan Family Ventures (DFV), as well as a member of the Board of Directors for AMC Networks, MSG Networks Inc., The Madison Square Garden Company (MSG), The Wendy's Company, and Revlon Inc. Most recently, she served as Chief Operating Officer of Cablevision Systems Corporation leading all aspects of the company's cable operations and overseeing thousands of employees, including the company's entire customer and field service workforce. She also oversaw Cablevision Media Sales, the company's advertising sales division, which was widely recognized for its pioneering data strategy that paved the way for an audience-driven approach to television advertising, providing deep insights into viewership in the New York DMA (the nation's most influential viewing market). She has also previously served on the Foundation Board for SUNY Albany and the National Board for Women in Cable & Telecommunications (WICT). She received an M.A. in English Literature from Long Island University, an M.S. in publishing with a concentration in marketing from Pace University and a B.A. in English from the State University of New York at Albany.

name: Kristin Blazewicz JD
bio: Ms. Kristin Blazewicz serves as Chief Legal Officer and General Counsel at Coty. Kristin was responsible for Securities and Exchange Commission filings, corporate governance and mergers and acquisitions. Kristin holds both a JD and LLM, International Law and Legal Studies, from Duke University School of Law. In addition, she holds a Bachelor of Science, Business Administration and Management degree from the University of Vermont and studied International Business at Wirtschaftsuniversität Wien (Vienna University of Economics and Business) in Austria.

name: Kory Marchisotto
position: Chief Marketing Officer, Marketing & Senior Vice President
bio: Ms. Kory Marchisotto serves as Senior Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer at E.L.F. Cosmetics. Ms. Marchisotto has more than 20 years of beauty experience, across a diverse portfolio of brands, business models and distribution channels. Most recently, Ms. Marchisotto led strategic brand management for Shiseido, a global beauty corporation, and served as Senior Vice President, Marketing for Shiseido Americas' bareMinerals brand. Ms. Marchisotto played a key role in bareMinerals' ongoing transformation, most notably leading the brands digital transition and integrated marketing strategy, while also solidifying its stronghold in complexion through core franchise invigoration and top-ranked foundation launches. Prior to bareMinerals, Ms. Marchisotto spent 16 years in Shiseido's Beauty Prestige Group, supporting a $155 million growth in retail sales through strategic brand portfolio management, new brand integration, and multi-channel business development. During her tenure, in addition to managing their stable of licensed brands, Ms. Marchisotto also led the negotiation, integration and business development of the Hermes, Burberry and Ferragamo beauty brands. Ms. Marchisotto started her beauty career in marketing and sales roles at both Puig and LVMH.

name: Kirsten Green
bio: Ms. Kirsten Green is the Founder and serves as Managing Partner at Forerunner Ventures. She serves as Board Member at Wanelo. She served as Board Member at Modern Fertility, The Yes, and HENRY. She serves as Board Member at Serena & Lily. She serves as Advisor at Stylitics. She also serves as a Board Member at Curated ( Internet Retail), Rockets of Awesome, Draper James, Glossier. Ms. Green is the Founder and serves as Managing Director at Forerunner Ventures. Previously, she was an adviser to TSG Consumer Partners. Before founding Forerunner Ventures, she was an analyst in the equity research department at Banc of America Securities (Montgomery Securities). Prior to that, she was an associate at Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette. She graduated from UCLA with a B.A. in Business Economics, and she holds a CPA license and a CFA certification. She serves on the board and executive committee of the Full Circle Fund.

name: Kirk Perry
bio: Mr. Kirk Perry serves as President and Chief Executive Officer at Information Resources, Inc. He also serves as a Board Member at E.L.F. Cosmetics. He currently serves as President, Brand Solutions at Google Inc., a technology company, a position he has held since December 2013, and is responsible for driving Google's revenue with the world's largest advertisers and advertising agencies. Prior to this role, he was President, Global Family Care at Procter & Gamble from May 2011 to December 2013. He held numerous positions of increasing responsibility with Procter & Gamble beginning in 1990 in marketing and general management roles, including General Manager Northeast Asia Baby & Family Care from 2001 to 2003, Vice President North America Baby Care from 2003 to 2008 and Vice President, North America Marketing and U.S. Operations from 2008 to 2011. He served as a member of the board of the Hillerich & Bradsby Co. (Louisville Slugger), a sporting goods manufacturer, from September 2013 to August 2016.

name: Keyla Lazardi
bio: Ms. Keyla Lazardi serves as Chief Scientific Officer at Revlon. She has over 20 years of global experience in the consumer products and consumer health industries with an exceptional track record of delivering breakthrough innovation. She has worked in Asia, Europe, LA and the US. Most recently, She held the position of R&D Vice President at e.l.f. Cosmetics and previously held leadership positions of increasing responsibility at Schiff Nutrition, Reckitt Benckiser and Procter & Gamble. Ms. Lazardi received her PhD in Biochemistry from the Venezuelan Institute of Scientific Research and an MSc in Biology from Universidad Central de Venezuela.

name: Ken Kilar
position: Chief Technology Officer & Vice President, Technology
bio: Mr. Ken Kilar serves as Chief Technology Officer & Vice President, Technology at Stila Cosmetics.

name: Keith Stimson
position: Deal Partner & Head of Heritage Group
bio: Mr. Keith Stimson serves as Deal Partner & Head of Heritage Group at Gryphon Investors. He serves as Board Member at Milani. He also served as Board Member at Matrixx Initiatives. He is responsible for leading the origination and monitoring of investments, and for managing the group. He originated and led Gryphon's platform investments in Amport Foods, Ann's House of Nuts (Amport and Ann's were consolidated under Flagstone Foods), C.B. Fleet Laboratories, The Original Cakerie, Consolidated Fire Protection, and TrustHouse Services. In addition, Keith led multiple add-on acquisitions for platform companies, including for Consolidated Fire Protection, Flagstone Foods, TrustHouse Services, and K&N Engineering, as well as the sale processes for Flagstone Foods, Consolidated Fire Protection, TrustHouse Services, Sheplers, and Miller Heiman Inc.

name: Katrina Lake
bio: Ms. Katrina Lake is a Co-Founder and serves as Executive Chairperson at Stitch Fix. She previously served as Chief Executive Officer at Stitch Fix. She serves as Venture Partner at Female Founders Fund. She is also a Board Member of Grubhub. Previously, she served at Polyvore, Harvard Business School, and Leader Ventures. She holds a B.S. in Economics from Stanford University and an M.B.A. from Harvard Business School.

name: Katherine Mossman
bio: Ms. Katherine Mossman is a Co-Founder and serves as Partner at New Theory Ventures. He serves as Board Member at Pacifica Beauty.

name: Julie Laverriere
bio: Ms. Julie Laverriere serves as General Counsel & Director, Legal at L'Oreal. She served as General Counsel Travel Retail Worlwide at L'Oreal. Previously, she served as a Senior Legal Counsel at L'OREAL SA.

name: Julian Steinberg
bio: Mr. Julian Steinberg is a Co-Founder and serves as Managing Partner at Alliance Consumer Growth. He oversees current and prospective investments for ACG and currently sits on the Boards of The Honest Kitchen, Tata Harper, NUDESTIX, Pacifica, Clio, Way Better Snacks, Lola and Milk Makeup. Julian was previously a board member of Babyganics, Krave Jerky, Krisers Natural Pet, Suja, DenTek Oral Care and Plum Organics. Currently, serves the board at Smashmallow. In 2015, ACG was named by GrowthCap as one of America's Top 25 Growth Equity Investment Firms across all industries. Also in 2015, Mr. Julian and his partners Josh Goldin and Trevor Nelson were all named to Fortune Magazine's "40 Under 40" list, which recognizes the most influential young people in business. Julian has also been named one of the top "40 Under 40" investors in growth equity. Prior to co-founding ACG, Mr. Julian built Atlas Advisors' principal investing affiliate, Atlas Consumer Growth, while also advising on M&A transactions as a Managing Director at Atlas. Prior to Atlas, Julian was a Vice President at Goode Venture Partners, where he evaluated acquisition and investment opportunities and served as interim COO for portfolio company, Inform Technologies, LLC. Julian began his career as an investment banker at Bear Stearns. Mr. Julian holds an M.B.A. from Columbia Business School and a B.A. in History from Brown University.

name: Julia Pichler
bio: Ms. Julia Pichler serves as Chief Financial Officer at Christian Dior.

name: Josh Franks
bio: Mr. Josh Franks serves as Senior Vice President at E.L.F. Cosmetics. Mr. Franks has 20 years of operations and supply chain experience. Previously, he served as Senior Vice President of Operations at Lyrical Foods, makers of innovative plant-based dairy substitutes under the Kite-Hill brand. Before Lyrical, Mr. Franks was Vice President of Operations at Raybern Foods, a vertically integrated frozen food manufacturer. Prior to that, he spent 7 years with Del Monte Foods in supply chain positions of increasing responsibility. Mr. Franks holds a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration with concentrations in Operations Management and Supply Chain Management from North Carolina State University.

name: Joseph Conklin
position: Senior Vice President & Global Deputy General Counsel
bio: Mr. Joseph Conklin serves as Senior Vice President and Global Deputy General Counsel at Coty.

name: Jose Urquijo
bio: Mr. Jose Urquijo serves as Chief Information Officer at Revlon. He is responsible for leading our Global IT strategy including digital tools transformation, core platforms modernization, IT services and process optimizations through innovative technology solutions. Mr. Urquijo has over 30 years of IT experience in multiple industries. Prior to this role Mr. Urquijo led the Technology Delivery team at Revlon. He has previously held various leadership roles at Clarivate, a carveout of Thompson Reuters, Teleflex, BASF Block drugs and GSK. Jose holds a Bachelor of Science (BS), Computer Science from Montclair State College.

name: John Thomas
bio: Mr. John Thomas serves as Chief Operating Officer at E.L.F. Cosmetics.

name: John Nelson
bio: Mr. John Nelson is a Co-Founder & serves as Chief Executive Officer at Seed Beauty. He is a Co-Founder and serves Chief Executive Officer at ColourPop. He has over 20 years of startup, rapid scaling, brand development, general management and financial planning experience within the beauty industry. In 2014, he co-founded SEED Beauty which has incubated and rapidly scaled five brands; ColourPop Cosmetics, Fourth Ray Beauty, Sol Body, Kylie Cosmetics, KKW Beauty with other brands in the incubation stage. SEED Beauty was built on the vertical integration of SPATZ Laboratories, a family business where John served as CEO for 12 years. In 2014, John along with his business partner and sister, Laura Nelson, disrupted his family business from the inside out by transforming the business from being one of the largest outside suppliers to the global beauty brands to a vertically integrated platform focused on launching and building its own brands. John received his MBA from Northwestern's Kellogg School of Management in 2002.

name: Johannes Huth
bio: Mr. Johannes Huth serves as Partner & Head of KKR EMEA at Kohlberg Kravis Roberts. He serves as Board Member at Coty. He served as Board Member at SoftwareONE and Axel Springer. He served as Chairman of the Supervisory Member at NXP Semiconductors. He joined KKR in 1999 and is a Member of KKR and Individual Partner of Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co Partners. Mr Huth is responsible for KKR's operations in Europe, the Middle East and Africa. He has participated in investments including Wincor Nixdorf, Zumtobel, Demag Holdings, MTU Aero Engines, DSD, Selenia, Kion Group, NXP Semiconductors, Pro7 Sat1, BMG, Wild, and WÃ¼rttembergische Metallwarenfabrik AG (WMF). He formerly served as the Chair of Impetus-PEF. He is currently a member of the Supervisory Board of Kion. He served as Vice Chairman of the Supervisory Board of NXP BV and Chairman of the Supervisory Board of ProSieben Sat 1 Media AG. He is a member of the Advisory Board of Wild Flavors GmbH, Chairman of the Supervisory Board of WMF, and member of the Board of Hertha KGaA. Prior to joining KKR, Mr Huth was a member of Investcorp's Management Committee and was also responsible for the firm's operations in Europe. Previously, he was with Salomon Brothers, where he was a Vice President in the Mergers and Acquisitions departments in London and New York. Mr Huth holds a BSc with highest honors from the London School of Economics and an MBA from the University of Chicago. He is Chairman of the Trustees of the Private Equity Foundation, Trustee of the Design Museum, the Staedel Museum in Frankfurt and a governor of the London School of Economics. He is also an Angel Investor. He also serves as Board Member & Member of Remuneration and Nomination Committee at Coty.

name: Joachim Creus
bio: Mr. Joachim Creus serves as Board Member at Coty. Mr. Creus has served as a Partner, General Counsel and Head of Tax at JAB Holding Company S.a r.l. since October 2010 and has held various executive officer roles at several JAB Group entities from time to time. Prior to that, he served as the Tax Director at Siemens from 2007 and held other legal- and tax-related positions from 2000. Mr. Creus holds several degrees from KU Leuven and an LL.M. in international tax law from Vienna University of Economics and Business.

name: Jessica Tang
bio: Ms. Jessica Tang is the Founder of C'est Moi.

name: Jean-Victor Meyers
position: Board Member & Member of the Audit Committee
bio: Mr. Jean-Victor Meyers serves as Board Member & Member of the Audit Committee at L'Oreal. A member of the Supervisory Board of the family-owned holding company Tethys since January 2011 and a member of the Supervisory Committee of the investment subsidiary Tethys Invest and Chairman of Exemplaire and Constantine Capital, Jean-Victor Meyers has been a Director of L'Oreal since 2012 and is a member of the Audit Committee and the Strategy and Sustainability Committee.

name: Jean-Pierre Breault
bio: Mr. Jean-Pierre Breault serves as Chief Financial Officer at Groupe Marcelle. He served as Chief Financial Officer & Vice President at Christie Innomed.

name: Jean-Paul Agon
position: Chairman of the Board of Directors & Strategy and Sustainability Committee
bio: Mr. Jean-Paul Agon serves as Chairman of the Board of Directors & Strategy and Sustainability Committee at L'Oreal. He Joined the L'Oreal Group in 1978. Following an international career as Chief Executive Officer of the Consumer Products Division in Greece and of L'Oreal Paris in France, International Managing Director of Biotherm, Chief Executive Officer of L'Oreal Germany, Chief Executive Officer of the Asia Zone, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of L'Oreal USA, Jean-Paul Agon was appointed as Deputy Chief Executive Officer of L'Oreal in 2005, and then Chief Executive Officer in April 2006 and finally Chairman and Chief Executive Officer in 2011. A Director of L'Oreal since 2006, he is also the Chairman of the Strategy and Sustainability Committee. Jean-Paul Agon is also the Chairman of the L'Oreal Corporate Foundation and Director of Air Liquide. By decision of the Board of Directors following the 2021 Annual General Meeting, Jean-Paul Agon will hold the office of Chairman of the Board of Directors without assuming the office of Chief Executive Officer as from 1May 2021. Professional address: L'Oreal - 41, rue Martre - 92117 Clichy Cedex - France. Holds 1,365,432 L'Oreal shares. OTHER CORPORATE OFFICES AND DIRECTORSHIPS HELD - French companies - Air Liquide S.A. - Director. Other - L'Oreal Corporate Foundation - Chairman of the Board. L'Oreal Fund for Women - Chairman of the Board. Raisesherpas - Director. French Association of Private Enterprises (AFEP) - Director. French Institute of International Relations (IFRI) - Director.

name: Jean-Baptiste Voisin
position: Chief Strategy Officer, Member of the Executive Committee and President, LVMH Métiers d'Art
bio: Mr. Jean-Baptiste Voisin serves as Chief Strategy Officer, Member of the Executive Committee and President, LVMH Métiers d'Art at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton. He is a graduate of the Ecole Polytechnique and the Ecole des Mines de Paris. He began his career with Danone France in production and then marketing. In 1996, he joined the McKinsey & Company consulting firm, becoming a partner in 2002. He was co-leader of the retail practice for Europe and then worldwide. Jean Baptiste Voisin joined LVMH as Chief Strategy Officer in 2006. He has been a member of the Executive Committee since 2012. As well as these functions, he has been President of LVMH Métiers d'Art since 2015.

name: Jean Jacques Guiony
position: Chief Financial Officer & Member of the Executive Committee
bio: Mr. Jean Jacques Guiony serves as Chief Financial Officer & Member of the Executive Committee at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton. After graduating from HEC business school in 1984, he began his career in 1985 as a Research Analyst with Banque Nationale de Paris in Paris and then with Merrill Lynch in 1988 in London. In 1990 he joined the Mergers & Acquisitions department of Lazard Frères, becoming a Partner in 1997 and then Head of Mergers & Acquisitions in 2000. He joined LVMH in 2003 as Deputy Finance Director before becoming Chief Financial Officer in 2004. He is also Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of La Samaritaine since 2010. Jean-Jacques Guiony is a member of the LVMH Executive Committee. He has been awarded the honorary title of Chevalier de la Légion d'Honneur.

name: Jean Carof
bio: Ms. Jean Carof serves as Executive at L'Oreal.

name: Jay Brown
bio: Mr. Jay Brown serves as Chief Executive Officer at Roc Nation. He serves as a Board Member at Savage X Fenty. Prior to RocNation, Mr. Brown served as Executive Vice President for Def Jam Recordings from 2005 to 2008 and as Senior Vice President of Elktra Rcords from 1999 to 2004. He served as the Board Member at CitizenGlobal.

name: James Walker
bio: Mr. James Walker is a Co-Founder of W3ll People and serves as its Chief Marketing Officer. He is the visionary and wellness fanatic behind W3LL PEOPLE. Before aspiring to become a makeup mogul, he spent over 20 years as a marketing strategist guiding branding efforts for numerous Fortune 500 companies, including Whole Foods. After making a splash on Madison Avenue as a creative director with the likes of Young and Rubicam, James returned to Austin, TX; home of his university alma mater, to co-found TKO Marketing. It was there that his passion for conscious commerce led him to the W3LL PEOPLE concept and uniting the founding team. From conception to production, James ensures W3LL PEOPLE remains true to its mission of sustainability and social responsibility. While James may leave the make up to his female counterparts, he drives W3LL PEOPLE with extraordinarily different ideas about how to make business, branding and beauty better.

name: Isabelle Parize
bio: Ms. Isabelle Parize serves as Board Member at Coty. She serves as Executive Chairman at Delsey. She serves as the Chief Executive Officer and Board Member at Nocibe. She serves as Board Member and Member of the Audit Committee at PANDORA. She also serves as Chief Executive Officer, Managing Director and Executive Board Member at Douglas Holding.

name: Iris Knobloch JD
bio: Ms. Iris Knobloch serves as Vice Chairman at Accor. She has served as President of Warner Bros. France S.A. since 2006, in which capacity she oversees all of Warner Bros.' business in France, including theatrical production and distribution, television distribution, home video, games, consumer products, online and emerging distribution technologies as well as Warner Bros.' Home Entertainment business in the Benelux. From 2001 to 2006, she served as Senior Vice President of International Relations of Time Warner Inc. From 1996 to 2001, Ms. Knobloch was Vice President of Business and Legal Affairs for Warner Home Video's European management team in London, Los Angeles and Paris. Prior to that, Ms. Knobloch practiced law with Norr, Stiefenhofer & Lutz and O'Melveny & Myers, where she provided strategic counsel on international transactions to major U.S. and European media and entertainment clients. Ms. Knobloch received a J.D. degree from Ludwig-Maxmilians-Universitaet in Munich, Germany in 1987 and an L.L.M. degree from New York University in 1992. She also serves as Board Member at Central European Media Enterprises. She founded and served as Chairwoman & Chief Executive Officer at I2PO.

name: Ilham Kadri
bio: Ms. Ilham Kadri serves as a Member of the Board of Directors, Member of the Finance Committee, Chief Executive Officer & Chairman of the Executive Committee at Solvay. She holds a degree in chemical engineering from L'Ecole des Hauts Polymères in Strasbourg, and a PhD in macromolecular physico-chemistry from Strasbourg's Louis Pasteur University. Under her purpose-driven leadership and mandate to unleash Solvay's potential, Solvay developed and launched in less than a year its strategy G.R.O.W. with its bold and holistic Solvay One Planet sustainability objectives, as well as Solvay's Purpose: We bond People, Ideas and Elements to Reinvent Progress. Soon after the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic, she created the Solvay Solidarity Fund for employees and their families who are in need due to the crisis. He is a world citizen with a rich professional experience across a variety of industries on four continents and with leading industrial multinationals, including Shell, UCB, Huntsman, Dow Chemical and Sealed Air. Prior to Solvay, Ilham Kadri was CEO and President of Diversey in the United States has led the company's return to profitability and resulting in a spin-off and divestiture. She is an independent board member at A.O. Smith, L'Oréal, and Catalyst. In addition, she is an Executive Committee member of the World Business Council for Sustainable Development, a member of a steering committee of the European Round Table of Industrialists as well as a permanent member of the International Business Council. She holds a degree in chemical engineering from L'École des Hauts Polymères in Strasbourg and a PhD in macromolecular physico-chemistry from Strasbourg's Louis Pasteur University.

name: Hélène Desmarais
bio: Ms. Hélène Desmarais is a Co-Founder and serves as Executive Chairman at Ivado Labs. She also serves as a Board Member at Christian Dior. She is a Director of Spinlogic Technologies. Ms. Desmarais holds a Bachelor of Business Administration degree from l'École des Hautes Études Commerciales. She is Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of the Centre d'Entreprises et d'Innovation de Montréal (CEIM), which she founded in 1996.

name: Guillaume Mott
position: Deputy Chief Executive Officer of Fashion Group
bio: Mr. Guillaume Mott serves as Deputy Chief Executive Officer of Fashion Group at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton.

name: Gordon von Bretten
bio: Mr. Gordon von Bretten serves as Chief Transformation Officer & Member of the Executive Committee at Coty. He served as Managing Director at KKR Capstone. He joined KKR Capstone in 2015 to lead cross-functional value creation efforts across the KKR Private Equity and Special Situations portfolios. In this capacity he has supported KKR's investments in Selecta, Hilding Anders, Hensoldt and Travelopia. In addition, Mr. von Bretten acts as European Procurement Head. Mr. von Bretten joined KKR Capstone from KloecknerPentaplast Group, where he headed up the €300m Pharmaceutical Films division as senior vice president. Prior to that he acted as KloecknerPentaplast's chief procurement officer, leading its global purchasing function with €700m in annual spend. Mr. von Bretten also spent 15 years in management consulting, most recently with AlixPartners and A.T. Kearney, where he focused on corporate turnarounds and implementing sustainable cost reductions. Mr. von Bretten holds a Bachelor in International Business from IBS, Lippstadt (Germany) and an M.B.A. from Wilfrid Laurier University in Waterloo (Canada).

name: Georges Liarokapis
bio: Mr. Georges Liarokapis, aged 58, has appointed as Director since 15th July 2014. French Greek. Coordinator of Sustainability for L'Oreal Western Europe. Georges Liarokapis was appointed by the CFE-CGC union as a Director representing employees in 2014; his term of office was then renewed for a period of four years in 2018. He is a member of the Audit Committee. Professional address: 41, rue Martre - 92117 Clichy Cedex - France. OTHER CORPORATE OFFICES AND POSITIONS HELD - None. CORPORATE OFFICES AND POSITIONS HELD OVER THE LAST FIVE YEARS AND EXPIRED - None.

name: Fritz Willis
position: Sales Lead, Corporate New Business Development/Mergers & Acquisitions
bio: Ms. Fritz Willis serves as Sales Lead, Corporate New Business Development/Mergers and Acquisitions at Burt's Bees. Previously he served as Global Sales Planning, Technology, Training and Trade Capabilities at The Clorox Company.

name: Frederic Roze
bio: Mr. Frederic Roze serves as Chief Global Growth Officer.

name: Francoise Meyers
bio: Ms. Françoise Meyers is the Founder & serves as President at Fondation Bettencourt Schueller. She is the Founder of Téthys Invest. She serves as Vice Chairwoman of the Board of Directors & Member of the Strategy and Sustainability, Nominations and Governance & Human Resources and Remuneration Committee at L'Oreal.

name: Francis Deroy
bio: Mr. Francis Deroy serves as Legal Director Mergers and Acquisitions at L'Oreal.

name: Fabrice Megarbane
position: President - North Asia Zone & Chief Executive Officer L'Oréal China
bio: Mr. Fabrice Megarbane serves as President - North Asia Zone & Chief Executive Officer L'Oréal China at L'Oreal.

name: Fabienne Dulac
position: Deputy Chief Executive Officer of the Group & Chief Executive Officer of Orange France
bio: Ms. Fabienne Dulac serves as Deputy Chief Executive Officer of the Group & Chief Executive Officer of Orange France at Orange. She has been in the telecommunications sector for over 20 years. She holds a Master of Advanced Studies in Political Sociology from the Paris Institute of Political Sciences. After having started a doctoral thesis on the sociology of public action, Fabienne Dulac began her career at the French Interior Ministry. She joined the business world in 1993 through VTCOM, a company which developed multimedia services at the time of the emergence of the Internet and the appearance of a new business sector, where she was Head of Communication and Marketing. Fabienne Dulac joined France Telecom in 1997 within the newly created Multimedia Division. Her responsibilities in the area of marketing and communication include all of France Telecom's multimedia activities within its range of subsidiaries such as Wanadoo, Voila and Mappy. For a decade, she held various positions within marketing, business development, and customer relations, and accompanied the transformation of the market and the company, as well as the development of new commercial territories and customer experience at the heart of the operator's strategy. In 2008, she became Director of Sales and Online Customer Relations at Orange France; she brings innovation to the field and drives the company's digital transformation in terms of sales and customer relations. In 2011, Fabienne became head of the Orange North France division, where she was responsible for managing an operational entity with over 5,500 employees. In September 2013, she was appointed Director of Communication of Orange France. In August 2015, Fabienne Dulac took over as head of Orange France.

name: Fabien Petit
position: Chief Marketing Officer & Executive Chief Digital, Germany & Austria
bio: Mr. Fabien Petit serves as Chief Marketing Officer & Executive Chief Digital, Germany & Austria at L'Oreal. Mr. Fabien Petit serves as Chief Marketing Officer, Germany at L'Oreal.

name: Fabien Dewasmes
bio: Mr. Fabien Dewasmes serves as CFO - M&A - L'Oreal Luxe Division at L'Oreal. Earlier he served as Corporate Control Director and M&A Coordinator of Asia Pacific at L'Oreal. Previously, he served as a Finance Manager - Accounting at Qatar Luxury Company.

name: Eric Liaw
bio: Mr. Eric Liaw serves as General Partner at IVP. He also serves as a Board Observer at NextRoll. Board Member at App Annie. He serves as Board Member at The Players' Tribune, MasterClass, Aiven, Glossier and Whoop. He also served as Board Member at Fandom. He is focused primarily on later-stage investments in high-growth companies across a variety of sectors including enterprise software, Internet, and mobile. Eric serves as a Board Director or Observer for IVP portfolio companies AdRoll, Mindbody, OnDeck (ONDK), RetailMeNot (SALE), Supercell, The Honest Company, and ZipRecruiter and led IVP's investment in Klarna. He previously served as a Board Director for Dropcam (GOOG) and was actively involved with DeNA, HomeAway (AWAY), MarkMonitor (TRI), and Varolii (NUAN). Prior to joining IVP, Eric was with Technology Crossover Ventures (TCV) as a Vice President and he completed minority and control investments in private and public companies across the Internet and software sectors. Eric was actively involved in originating, executing and managing a number of investments, including Adknowledge, Altiris (acquired by Symantec), eHarmony, Fandango (acquired by Comcast), Global Market Insite (acquired by WPP), Intelligent Beauty, Netflix (NFLX), TechTarget (TTGT), Tiny Prints (acquired by Shutterfly), Webroot Software, and Zillow (Z). Earlier in his career, Eric was a member of Morgan Stanley's Technology Investment Banking Group. During his time at Morgan Stanley, Eric was involved in strategic and financing transactions valued at over $4 billion for clients across multiple technology sectors, including C|Net, Crystal Decisions, JD Edwards, Hewlett-Packard, Science Applications International Corporation (SAIC) and others. Eric also held technical and marketing positions with Trend Micro and Canon Software Publishing. Eric holds a B.A. in Economics with a minor in Computer Science and an M.S. in Management Science and Engineering, both from Stanford University.

name: Erhard Schoewel
bio: Mr. Ehrhard Schoewel serves as Board Member at Coty. He joined the Board of Directors of Coty Inc. in 2006 and serves as Chair of the Remuneration and Nomination Committee. From 1999 to 2006, he was Executive Vice President responsible for Europe at Reckitt Benckiser PLC. From 1979 to 1999 he held positions of increasing responsibilities at Benckiser. Prior to that, he worked for PWA Waldhof. In 2012, Mr. Schoewel was elected to the Supervisory Board of the Jahr Holding GmbH & Co. KG in Hamburg, Germany. He was Chairman of Birdseye Iglo Ltd London and a director of Phorms SE Berlin. Mr. Schoewel received a Diplom-Kaufmann degree from University of Pforzheim.

name: Emmanuel Grebil
bio: Mr. Emmanuel Grebil serves as Information Manager at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton.

name: Emily Weiss
bio: Ms. Emily Weiss is the Founder and serves as Executive Chairwoman at Glossier. She also serves as a Board Member at Allbirds. Prior to this, she has worked as a Styling Assistant with Vogue and Fashion Assistant with W.

name: Ely Bar-Ness
bio: Mr. Ely Bar-Ness serves as Chief Human Resources Officer at Revlon. Ely joined Supresta in August 2004. He is a member of the Company's Executive Leadership Team. He is responsible for developing and executing global human resources strategy in support of the Company's business plan. Mr. Bar-Ness joined Revlon with over 30 years of global human resources experience across various industries including chemical, cosmetics and pharmaceuticals. Prior to Revlon, he served as the Global Human Resources Leader for Ashland Ingredients, a $4.5 billion division of Ashland, Inc. Mr. Bar-Ness received his B.S. in Industrial and Labor Relations from Cornell University and an M.B.A. from Rutgers University in Management and Labor Relations.

name: E. Beattie
bio: Mr. E. Scott Beattie serves as Chairman of the Board at NexJ Systems. He also serves as Vice Chairman at Revlon. He formerly served as the Chairman, President and CEO of Elizabeth Arden, Inc., a Nasdaq listed global beauty products company from 1995 to 2016 until the sale of the company to Revlon, Inc. in September 2016. Mr. Beattie was a board member and investor of Janna Systems Inc., a TSX listed CRM company until its acquisition by Siebel Systems in 2000. He has been involved in the financing, management and development of a number of private and publicly traded businesses in the financial services, information technology, consumer product and retailing sectors through Bedford Capital, a Toronto-based private equity firm he co-founded in 1989. Prior to that, he served as a Vice President in the Mergers and Acquisitions group of Merrill Lynch, Inc. and as a Manager of Accenture Consulting. He holds an M.B.A and a degree in Honours Business Administration from The Ivey School of Business at the University of Western Ontario.

name: Dipin Passi
bio: Mr. Dipin Passi serves as Managing Director at Lotus Herbals.

name: Diego Della Valle
bio: Mr. Diego Della Valle is the Founder and serves Co-Chief Executive Officer, President & Chairman at TOD'S. He has developed it to the point of transforming it into the parent company of a multinational Group that is a leader in the luxury market. He has been Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Tod's S.p.A. since 2000. In 2000 he received a degree honoris causa in Business and Economics from the University of Ancona.

name: Didier Tisserand
bio: Mr. Didier Tisserand serves as Managing Director, Brazil at L'Oreal.

name: Dennis O'Brien
bio: Mr. Dennis O'Brien serves as Operating Partner, Consumer Group at Gryphon Investors. He works closely with senior management teams of portfolio companies to maximize short and long-term operating and financial performance, while also working closely with deal teams in screening and completing due diligence on prospective investments. He serves on the boards of current portfolio companies Mechanix Wear and Milani Cosmetics, and formerly served as a Chairman or Director of Dessert Holdings, DLC, ECG Management Consultants, Flagstone Foods, Fleet Laboratories, K&N Engineering, Matrixx Initiatives/ZICAM, Sheplers, Staffing Now, SynteractHCR, Trinity Consultants, and TrustHouse Services. Mr. O'Brien also serves on the Board of TreeHouse Foods, a publicly-traded supplier of products and services in the private label and food services industries. Previously, Mr. O'Brien was President and COO of ConAgra's $8.5 billion Retail Products organization. Mr. O'Brien has 27 years of operating experience in the consumer packaged and durable goods industries with ConAgra Foods, Armstrong Industries, Campbell's Soup, Nestle Foods and Procter and Gamble, beginning his career in field sales and brand management then progressing into general management. Through his experiences, Mr. O'Brien developed deep expertise in marketing, sales, operations, product development, restructurings, joint ventures, divestitures and acquisition integrations. In these various roles, he has built and restructured numerous well-known, branded consumer businesses including Chef Boyardee, Healthy Choice, Orville Redenbacher, Slim Jim and Swiss Miss at ConAgra, as well as Nestea, Nestle Toll House, Pepperidge Farm and V-8 juices at Nestle and Campbell's Soup.

name: Denis Dalibot
bio: Mr. Dalibot serves as a Board Member at Financiere Agache Private Equity.

name: Delphine Arnault-Gancia
position: Board Member, Executive Vice President & Member of the Executive Committee
bio: Ms. Delphine Arnault serves as Board Member, Executive Vice President & Member of the Executive Committee at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton. She graduated from EDHEC business school and the London School of Economics before beginning her career with the international management consultancy firm McKinsey. In 2000, she was part of the development of John Galliano's company where she gained a solid grounding in fashion. In 2001, she became a director of Christian Dior where she managed many product ranges, contributing to their exceptional commercial success worldwide; she also sits on the management board of Loewe where she is responsible for product strategy.

name: Debra Perelman
position: Chief Executive Officer, President & Board Member
bio: Ms. Debra Perelman serves as Chief Executive Officer, President and Board Member at Revlon. She also serves as Executive Committee & Board Member at Partnership for New York City. Debra Perelman (44) has been a Director of the Company since June 2015 and has served as Executive Vice President, Strategy and New Business Development, of MacAndrews & Forbes since 2014. Ms. Perelman joined MacAndrews & Forbes in 2004 as Vice President. Prior to joining MacAndrews & Forbes, Ms. Perelman held various positions at the Company in corporate finance and brand marketing. Ms. Perelman also serves as a founding member and Vice Chairman of the Child Mind Institute, an Advisory Board member for the Social Enterprise Program at Columbia Business School, and as a trustee of the NYU Langone Medical Center and as a trustee of the Children's Museum of the Arts. Ms. Perelman is the daughter of the Company's Chairman of the Board. During the past 5 years, Ms. Perelman has served on the boards of directors of the following public reporting companies: Revlon, Inc. (2015 - present); and Scientific Games (2014 - 2015). On May 22, 2018, the Board of Directors of Revlon, Inc., elected Debra G. Perelman as the Company's President and Chief Executive Officer, effective immediately.

name: David Suliteanu
position: Chief Executive Officer of Kendo Holdings
bio: Mr. David Suliteanu serves as Chief Executive Officer at Kat Von D Beauty. Mr. Suliteanu also serves as President & Chief Executive Officer at Fenty Beauty. He serves as Chief Executive Officer of Kendo Holdings at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton.

name: David Cape
bio: Mr. David Cape serves as President, Secretary & Board Member at Groupe Marcelle. He became president of Groupe Marcelle in 2003. He began his professional career as president of Princeton Transportation Consulting Group, developing software systems for large U.S. motor carriers. In April 1994, he returned to Montreal to work with his father Michael Cape and take on the position of executive vice president at Groupe Marcelle. Today, he serves as the chair of the Centre for Israel and Jewish Affairs (CIJA). He holds a Bachelor of Science in Engineering Management Systems from Princeton University.

name: Cyril Chapuy
bio: Mr. Cyril Chapuy serves as President - LUXE at L'Oreal.

name: Cristiana Falcone Sorrell
bio: Ms. Cristiana Falcone Sorrell serves as Board Member, Strategic Adviser and philanthropist investor at Revlon. Ms. Cristiana Falcone Sorrell served as Board Member at Viacom. Ms. Cristiana Falcone Sorrell serves as Board Member at Revlon. She served as a Board Member at SVF Investment 3. She also served as a Board Member at Wondermento.

name: Corey Smith
bio: Mr. Corey Smith serves as Vice President, Diversity and Inclusion at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton.

name: Constantin Sklavenitis
bio: Mr. Constantin Sklavenitis serves as Chief Prestige Brands Officer at Coty.

name: Connie Marples
position: Founder, President & Interim Chief Executive Officer
bio: Ms. Connie Marples serves as Founder, President & Interim Chief Executive Officer at Boosh Food.

name: Clara Gaymard
bio: Ms. Clara Gaymard is the Co-Founder of RAISE. She also serves as Board Member & Member of the Governance Committee at RAISE. She began her career in 1982 at the City of Paris. She is then Auditor and Referendum Advisor at the Court of Accounts from 1986, then Commercial Counselor at the Economic Expansion Office in Cairo in 1991. Returned to Paris, she is in charge of trade relations with the EU at the Ministry of Finance. Economy. In 1995, she became Cabinet Director of Colette Codaccioni at the Ministry of Solidarity between Generations. She then led the "SME Mission" until 2003 to the Ministry of Economy and Finance, before being appointed Ambassador Delegate for International Investment and Managing the French Agency for International Investments (AFII). A former student of the 'ENA, She is a graduate of the IEP in Paris and holds a degree in law and history. She is an Officer of the National Order of Merit and Knight of the Legion of Honor.

name: Cindy Elenes
bio: Ms. Cindy Elenes serves as Vice President, Accounting & Controller at Milani Cosmetics.

name: Christophe Babule
position: Chief Financial Officer & Member of the Executive Committee
bio: Mr. Christophe Babule serves as Chief Financial Officer & Member of the Executive Committee at L'Oreal. He has built his entire career within the Group, which he joined in 1988 at the end of his studies at HEC Paris. He started in the Luxe Division in Italy where he stayed for 7 years. Then he discovered Asia, first based in France in the Zone, before becoming Director of Administration & Finance in China, a role that he held for more than 8 years up until 2007. Appointed Administration & Financial Director for Mexico, he continued his international career path on another large continent. In 2010, after many years abroad, he returned to France as Director of Internal Audit in charge of controlling all of the Group's entities. He stayed in France for nearly 5 years before returning to Asia as Administration & Financial Director for the Zone located in Shanghai and then in Hong Kong.

name: Christine Yuss
bio: Ms. Christine Yuss serves as Controller at Pacifica Beauty.

name: Christian De Labriffe
bio: Mr. Christian de Labriffe serves as a Board Member at Christian Dior. He also serves as a Chairman of Supervisory Board at Tikehau Capital. Mr. de Labriffe served as Chief Executive Officer, Investment committee Member at Salvepar. He is a graduate of ISC Paris Business School. He started his career at Lazard Frères & Cie. in 1972 where he was appointed Managing Partner in 1987. In 1994, he became Managing Partner of Rothschild & Cie. He joined Tikehau Capital in 2013 as Chairman and CEO of Salvepar, a function he has fulfilled until 2017.

name: Chris de Lapuente
bio: Mr. Chris de Lapuente serves as Chief Executive Officer & President at Sephora. He serves as a Member of Executive Committee, Head of Perfumes & Cosmetics, Chairman & Chief Executive Officer of Selective Retailing Division at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton. He is an economics graduate of the University of Buckingham. He joined Procter & Gamble in 1983, holding positions of increasing responsibility in many different countries, including the UK, Spain, Turkey, Germany and Switzerland. In 2004 he was appointed the youngest ever president in the history of Procter & Gamble, in charge of the Hair Care division. Chris de Lapuente joined LVMH in 2011 as Chief Executive Officer of Sephora. He has also been head of all LVMH Perfumes & Cosmetics brands (except Parfums Christian Dior) since May 2015.

name: Charlotte Vohtz
bio: Ms. Charlotte Vohtz is the founder & serves as Chief Executive Officer at Green People.

name: Ceci Kurzman
bio: Ms. Ceci Kurzman serves as Board Member at Revlon. She is the founder of The OurX Collective. She serves as a Board Member, Member of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee & Member of the Compensation Committee at Warner Music Group. She is the founder and President of Nexus Management Group, Inc. ("Nexus"), former talent management and current investment company. Ms. Kurzman currently serves on the Board of Directors, Audit Committee, and Compensation Committee of Revlon, Inc., as well as on the Board of Directors of various organizations including Man Group plc and Cirque du Soleil Entertainment Group. An accomplished investor and entrepreneur, Ms. Kurzman also achieved numerous business and marketing successes as an executive at Arista Records and Sony Music's Epic Records, before founding Nexus and managing an impressive roster of superstar artists. Today, Ms. Kurzman continues to combine her strategic business leadership, with her ability to anticipate trends and drive revenue growth from an investment portfolio of trailblazing companies, in partnership with established private equity partners.

name: Casey Delatorre
bio: Ms. Casey Delatorre serves as National Account Manager, Maybelline at L'Oreal. Casey Delatorre served as Vice President, Sales (North America) at Eve Snow.

name: Carolina Kishimoto
bio: Ms. Carolina Kishimoto serves as Controller at Pacifica Beauty.

name: Brook Harvey-Taylor
bio: Ms. Brook Harvey-Taylor is a Co-Founder and serves as President and Brand Director at Pacifica Beauty. She previously served as its Chief Executive Officer.

name: Blanca Juti Ph.D
position: Chief Corporate Affairs and Engagement Officer
bio:
Dr. Blanca Juti serves as Chief Corporate Affairs and Engagement Officer at L'Oreal. She served as chief communications and public affairs officer at L'Oreal. She is an anthropologist by training, with a Ph.D. from Cambridge University, an MBA from the University of Dallas, and over 25 years of experience working in consumer-facing. industries in the technology, entertainment and food & beverage sectors. After 5 years working as the Cultural Attaché for the Mexican Embassy in Finland, Blanca started her corporate career at Nokia in 1998.
During her time with Nokia, she held a variety of roles across the Communications, Public Affairs, Commercial and Marketing functions - and was eventually appointed to the role of Vice-President of Marketing. In 2013, Blanca took up the role of Chief Brand Officer at Rovio, before being appointed Chief Corporate Affairs Officer at the Heineken Group in 2016.

name: Beverly Morgan
position: Senior Vice President, Global Human Resources
bio: Ms. Beverly Morgan serves as Senior Vice President, Global Human Resources at Benefit Cosmetics.

name: Beth Pritchard
bio: Ms Beth Pritchard serves as Board Member at Cabela's. Ms. Pritchard has served as a member of our Board since November 2017. She currently serves on the board of directors of Loblaw Companies Limited (TSE: L) & The Vitamin Shoppe and has previously served on numerous public and private company boards. Ms. Pritchard served as Principal and Strategic Advisor of Sunrise Beauty Studio, LLC, a beauty branding company, from February 2009 to October 2017. She served as North American Advisor to M.H. Alshaya Co. from 2008 to 2013. From 2006 to 2009, Ms. Pritchard was the President and Chief Executive Officer and subsequent Vice Chairman of Dean & DeLuca, Inc. Ms. Pritchard was the President and Chief Executive Officer of Organized Living Inc. from 2004 to 2005. Prior to that, from 1991 to 2003, she held executive positions with L Brands, Inc., serving as President and Chief Executive Officer of Bath & Body Works, Chief Executive Officer of Victoria's Secret Beauty, and Chief Executive Officer of The White Barn Candle Company. Ms. Pritchard received her B.A. in International Relations from the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee and her M.B.A. from Marquette University.

name: Bernard Arnault
position: Co-Founder, Chief Executive Officer, Chairman of the Board of Directors & Member of the Executive Committee
bio: Mr. Bernard Arnault is a Co-Founder and serves as Chief Executive Officer, Chairman of the Board of Directors & Member of the Executive Committee at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton. He also serves as Board Member at Devialet. He also serves as Executive at Aglaé Ventures. He began his professional career that year as an engineer with the Ferret-Savinel construction company and successively was promoted to various executive management positions before becoming Chairman in 1978. He remained there until 1984 when he undertook the reorganization of the Financière Agache holding company. He returned the group to profitability as he embarked upon a strategy of developing the world's leading luxury products company. In the process, he reinvigorated Christian Dior as the cornerstone of the new organization. In 1989, he became the majority shareholder of LVMH Moët Hennessy - Louis Vuitton, creating the world's leading luxury products group. He has been Chairman and CEO of the company since that date. He also serves as President of the Board of Directors of Groupe Arnault S.E. (his family holding company).

name: Beril Yildiz
position: Chief Accounting Officer, Accounting & Controller, Finance
bio: On effective September 28, 2021, Beril Yildiz was elected Vice President, Chief Accounting Officer & Controller for Revlon, Inc. and its wholly owned operating subsidiary, Revlon Consumer Products Corporation. Prior to joining the Company, Ms. Yildiz, age 43, served as Director of Financial Reporting, Technical Accounting and Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) Compliance and in various finance and accounting roles for Colgate-Palmolive Company from 2018 to 2021. Ms. Yildiz served as Senior Manager of SEC Services for PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) from 2016 to 2018, and prior to that served in various roles for PwC in its New York City, Istanbul and Houston offices since 2000. Ms. Yildiz is a Certified Public Accountant, with an Executive M.B.A. from Bogazici University.

name: Benoît De La Source
bio: Mr. Benoît De La Source serves as Tax Director, Mergers & Acquisitions at L'Oreal.

name: Belen Garijo Ph.D
position: Board Member & Member of the Human Resources and Remuneration Committee
bio: Ms. Belen Garijo serves as a Board Member & Member of the Human Resources and Remuneration Committee at L'Oreal. She served as Chairwoman and Chief Executive Officer of Merck Healthcare, an entity holding all the pharmaceutical operations of the German group Merck and member of the Executive Committee of this Group, Belen Garijo will hold the office of Chairwoman of the Management Board and Chief Executive Officer of the Merck Group as from 1 May 2021. Belen Garijo has been a Director of L'Oreal since 2014 and is a member of the Human Resources and Remuneration Committee. She is also a Director of BBVA (Spain).

name: Beatrice Guillaume-Grabisch
bio: Ms. Beatrice Guillaume-Grabisch serves as Board Member & Member of the Audit Committee at L'Oreal. Ms. Beatrice Guillaume-Grabisch, aged 56, has appointed as Director since 20th April 2016. French. Executive Vice-President Human Resources and Business Services of Nestle Group, which she joined in 2013. She was formerly Chief Executive Officer of Nestle Germany after a career in various consumer goods groups (Colgate-Palmolive, Beiersdorf, Johnson & Johnson, L'Oreal, Coca-Cola). Beatrice Guillaume-Grabisch has been a Director of L'Oreal since 2016 and is a member of the Audit Committee. Professional address: Nestle - Avenue Nestle, 55 - CH 1800 Vevey - Switzerland. Holds 1,400 L'Oreal shares. MAIN CORPORATE OFFICE HELD OUTSIDE L'OREAL. Nestle S.A. (Switzerland) - Executive Vice-President Human Resources and Business Services. OTHER CORPORATE OFFICES AND DIRECTORSHIPS HELD - Others - GS1 - Director. CORPORATE OFFICES AND DIRECTORSHIPS HELD OVER THE LAST FIVE YEARS AND EXPIRED - Foreign companies - Nestle (Germany) - President - 2019. Henkel (Germany) - Director - 2016. Others - Marken Verband/Brand producers' association (Germany) - Member of the Management Board - 2019.

name: Beatrice Ballini
position: Board Member & Chairman of the Remuneration and Nomination Committee
bio: Ms. Beatrice Ballini serves as Board Member & Chairman of the Remuneration and Nomination Committee at Coty. Ms. Ballini is a senior member of the Retail Practice at Russell Reynolds Associates, a global leadership advisory and search firm, where she leads Family Business Services and is a Steering Committee Member of the Board and CEO Advisory group. Prior to joining Russell Reynolds Associates, Ms. Ballini was the Chief Executive Officer of a prominent men's clothing manufacturer in Milan where she assisted with the company's strategic growth. Prior to that, she held positions at Goldman Sachs & Co.'s M&A Department in New York and Bain & Co. in London and Boston.

name: Bastien Renard
bio: Mr. Bastien Renard serves as Managing Director at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton.

name: Barry Schwartz JD
bio: Barry F. Schwartz was appointed to our Board of Directors in May 2017. Mr. Schwartz has served as Executive Vice Chairman Emeritus of MacAndrews & Forbes Incorporated since July 2019. Mr. Schwartz was Executive Vice Chairman and Chief Administrative Officer of MacAndrews & Forbes Incorporated and various affiliates from October 2007 to December 2015. Prior to that, Mr. Schwartz was Executive Vice President and General Counsel of MacAndrews & Forbes Incorporated and various affiliates since 1993 and Senior Vice President of MacAndrews & Forbes Incorporated and various affiliates from 1989 to 1993. Mr. Schwartz is a director of Revlon, Inc. and Revlon Consumer Productions Corporation. Mr. Schwartz was formerly Vice Chairman and served as a member of the Board of Trustees of The City University of New York until 2020. He is Trustee Emeritus and former Chairman of the Board of Trustees at Kenyon College and formerly a member of the Georgetown University Law Center Board of Visitors. Mr. Schwartz is a Trustee and member of the Board of Directors of NYU Langone Medical Center and a member of the Board of Directors of the Jazz at Lincoln Center. Mr. Schwartz served as a member of the Board of Directors of Scientific Games from 2003 until September 2020, where he served as a member of the Compliance Committee and Compensation Committee.

name: Barbara Lavernos
position: Deputy Chief Executive Officer, in Charge of Research, Innovation and Technology
bio:
Ms. Barbara Lavernos serves as Deputy Chief Executive Officer, in Charge of Research, Innovation and Technology at L'Oreal. She joined the L'Oréal Group in 1991, where she pursued a very diverse career. After becoming Director of the Rambouillet plant in 2000, she was appointed Group Purchasing General Manager in 2004, before being entrusted with the General Management of Travel Retail markets in 2011. In 2014, she joined the L'Oréal Executive Committee as Chief Operating Officer, dealing with packaging design, product development, purchasing and product supply for L'Oréal's 40 factories, as well as the worldwide supply chain for over 6 billion products per year. In February 2021, Barbara Lavernos took over the newly created Department of Research, Innovation and Technologies, with a dual ambition: enabling L'Oréal to invent the Beauty of the future, while transforming itself into the Company of the future. With the support of the Group's 4,000 researchers, this Department will continue to pursue L'Oréal's historic goal to "bring the best of science and innovation to consumers" while introducing new services thanks to the opportunities offered by cutting-edge technologies. In parallel, with the support of our 1 700 IT & Technology experts, the Department will bring new technologies and data to the heart of each of the Group's entities and businesses, setting them up for success in a world revolutionized by digitization.
In addition to her role of Chief Research, Innovation and Technology Officer, Barbara Lavernos was named Deputy Chief Executive Office on May 1, 2021.

name: Ayesha Zafar
position: Chief Accounting Officer, Accounting & Controller, Finance
bio: Ms. Ayesha Zafar serves as Senior Vice President & Group Controller at Coty.

name: Asmita Dubey
position: Chief Digital Officer and Member of Group's Executive Committee
bio: Ms. Asmita Dubey serves as Chief Digital Officer and Member of Group's Executive Committee at L'Oreal.

name: Ashley Rosebrook
bio: Ms. Ashley Rosebrook serves as Chief Creative Officer at E.L.F. Cosmetics. Ms. Ashley Rosebrook Co-Founded and served as Co-Creative Director at Pinhole Press. Prior to Pinhole Press, Ashley was the creative director for the eco-concept lifestyle brand, Pistachio, owned by Indigo Books & Music of Canada. From 2002 - 2007, Ashley was Executive Design Director at Estee Lauder's Aveda Corporation. Ashely has a BFA from The Rhode Island School of Design.

name: Antonio Belloni
bio: Mr. Antonio Belloni serves as Group Managing Director, Board Member & Chairman of the Executive Committee at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton. After earning a degree in economics from the University of Pavia (Italy), he joined Procter & Gamble in 1978. He held a series of positions of increasing responsibility in the United States, Greece, Belgium, and Switzerland before being appointed President of Procter & Gamble Europe in 1999. He joined LVMH in 2001 as Group Managing Director, with responsibility for the strategic and operational management of Group companies. He is a member of the Board of Directors of LVMH and Chairman of the Executive Committee.

name: Antoine Vanlaeys
position: Chief Operations Officer & Member of the Executive Committee
bio:
Mr. Antoine Vanlaeys serves as Chief Operations Officer & Member of the Executive Committee at L'Oreal. He leads the entire supply chain of all L'Oréal Group, worldwide - from packaging design and product development, purchasing, manufacturing, and market logistics operations (more than 6 billion products). Antoine, along with his teams, implements winning Supply strategies and is leading Operations' major transformations including e-commerce acceleration, Industry 4.0, and sustainability. Prior to this, Antoine was Senior Vice President Operations for the Asia Pacific region for 5 years. In his tenure, he enabled together with his teams the rapid growth of the Group in the region, and particularly the acceleration of e-commerce in China. Antoine is passionate about leading Operations transformations, driving excellence through people and technology. Previously, he has enjoyed a rich career path, holding various senior management positions in Operations. In 2011, he was appointed Senior Vice President Operations of L'Oréal Luxe, where he led the industrial transformation to support the growth of the luxury brands. In 2008 he was appointed Supply Chain Director Europe for the Consumer goods Division, and in 2006 he was Plant Manager in Aulnay-sous-Bois (France).
Antoine joined L'Oréal Group in 2002, after a 10-year experience at Mars, where he headed different important responsibilities in France and overseas, in manufacturing and supply chain. As an Engineer, he graduated from ICAM (Mechanical Engineering school), in France.

name: Antoine Tessier
bio: Mr. Antoine Tessier serves as Chief Technology Officer at LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton.

name: Annie Larivière
bio: Ms. Annie Larivière serves as Vice President, Finance at Groupe Marcelle. As the vice president of finance for Groupe Marcelle, Annie leads the company finance teams. She has worked for the company for over 17 years, starting as a controller. Prior to joining the company, Annie spent 6 years working as a financial analyst at Essilor and 3 years at PwC accounting firm. She holds a Bachelor of Business Administration in Professional Accounting from HEC Montréal.

name: Anne Mazzucotelli Ph.D
bio: Dr. Anne Mazzucotelli serves as Senior Licensing and Business Development Manager at L'Oreal. Previously, she served as a Licensing & Business Development Manager at L'Oréal.

name: Anne Jaeckin
bio: Ms. Anne Jaeckin serves as Chief Human Resources Officer at Coty. Anne Jaeckin provides strategic leadership in the planning and implementation of an integrated human resources program. Anne has gained a wealth of HR experience at international and global organizations. After joining Coty, she led HR for Supply Chain and then Coty's Turnaround HR agenda - a key element of Coty's transformation. Most recently, as Senior VP of HR Turnaround & Global Functions, she has been coordinating the HR global function in a temporary capacity. Anne has been with Coty since 2017 and is based at Coty's headquarters in Amsterdam.

name: Anna Sui
bio: Ms. Anna Sui is the Founder of Anna Sui Vision. Before the end of her senior high school year, she was accepted to Parsons School of Design in New York. After two years at Parsons, she styled with her friend Steven Meisel and designed for several sportswear companies before launching her first collection in 1981. Her business continued to grow throughout the 1980s and in 1991 with the help of her friends Naomi Campbell and Linda Evangelista she premiered her first runway show. Today, she has over 50 boutiques in eight countries and her collection and products are sold in 300 stores in over 30 countries.

name: Anna Makanju
bio: Ms. Anna Adeola Makanju serves as Board Member at Coty. On December 2020, the Board appointed Anna Makanju as member of the Board, effective as of December 18, 2020, Anna Adeola Makanju is a renowned expert in global policy who brings over fifteen years of experience across U.S. government and leading private sector companies. Currently Global Policy Manager for content regulation at Facebook, Makanju drives the company's approach to emerging regulatory frameworks around the world. She has also practiced international law in the Hague and at Cleary Gottlieb Steen and Hamilton LLP and taught at Princeton University's School of Public and International Affairs. Makanju served as a Special Adviser for Europe and Eurasia to then-Vice President, now President-elect, Joseph R. Biden, focusing on policy and engagement strategies with 51 countries, including Russia and Turkey. She has also served as a Senior Adviser to the U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations and as Director for Russia on the U.S. National Security Council.

name: Anna Bayern
bio: Ms. Anna Bayern serves as Chief Corporate Affairs Officer at Coty. Anna oversees global communications, investor relations, and public affairs. Prior to joining Coty, she was a political journalist at Bild, Germany's most widely read traditional media brand. She was a member of the federal press conference, founding anchor of Germany's first digital political talk show, and has written two bestselling political biographies. Before attending Axel Springer Journalism school, she graduated with a BA in politics and history from Stanford University, a MA in writing from the University of East Anglia and a MA in politics, philosophy and economics from Ludwig-Maximilians-University Munich.

name: Ana Amaral
bio: Ms. Ana Amaral serves as Board Member & Member of the Human Resources and Remuneration Committee at L'Oreal. Ms. Ana Sofia Amaral, aged 55, has appointed as Director since 15 July 2014. Portuguese. Scientific and Technical Affairs Director for L'Oreal Portugal, Ana Sofia Amaral was appointed in 2014 by L'Oreal's Instance Europeenne de Dialogue Social (European Works Council) as a Director representing employees; her tenure was renewed for a period of four years in 2018. She is a member of the Human Resources and Remuneration Committee. Professional address: Rua Dr Antonio Loureiro Borges, Edificio 7 - Arquiparque - Miraflores - 2796-959 Linda A Velha - Portugal. OTHER CORPORATE OFFICES AND DIRECTORSHIPS HELD. Foreign companies - EMBOPAR Embalagens de Portugal SGPS S.A. Permanent representative of L'Oreal Portugal on the Board of Directors. Member of the Remuneration Commission. CORPORATE OFFICES AND DIRECTORSHIPS HELD OVER THE LAST FIVE YEARS AND EXPIRED - Sociedade Ponto Verde - Director. Member of the Remuneration Commission. 2020.

name: Ali Samei
bio: Mr. Ali Samei serves as Vice President, Operations at Boosh Food.

name: Alexandra Palt
position: Chief Corporate Responsibility Officer & CEO of the Fondation L'Oréal
bio: Ms. Alexandra Palt serves as Chief Corporate Responsibility Officer & CEO of the Fondation L'Oréal. A lawyer by training, Alexandra specialized in human rights. She began her career at a law firm and then worked for Amnesty International in Germany. For the next ten years, Alexandra worked at organizations specializing in CSR, diversity, change management and sustainability. In 2012, she joined L'Oréal as Chief Sustainability Officer, launching "Sharing Beauty With All", L'Oréal's sustainability program, which sets commitments for 2020 addressing the company's impact across its value chain. In 2017 Alexandra was appointed Chief Corporate Responsibility Officer, becoming the Executive Vice President of the L'Oréal Foundation in addition to her role as head of the CSR & Sustainability Department Instrumental to the launch of the Women4Climate initiative since its early beginning, Alexandra has been mentor of Paris 2017 and 2018 Women4Climate cohorts.

name: Alan Shamah
bio: Mr. Alan Shamah is a Co-Founder of E.L.F. Cosmetics. Mr. Shamah has a degree from New York University (Stern).

name: Alan Sefcik
bio: Mr. Alan Sefcik serves as a Vice President-Total Rewards at L'Oreal USA. He serves as Direct Filing Entity at Pension Plan Of L'Oreal USA, Master Retirement Trust. Previously, he served as a Senior Consultant at Alcatel-Lucent.

name: Alan Bernikow
bio: Mr. Alan Bernikow serves as Director at Revlon. He served as a Board Member at Destination XL Group. He serves as Board Member at K2 Intelligence. He serves as Board Member at Florida Community Bank. Prior to that, he held various senior executive positions at D&T and certain of its predecessor companies, which he joined in 1977. He currently serves as a director of Revlon, Inc., a worldwide cosmetics and beauty care products company listed on the New York Stock Exchange, as a director and chairman of the audit committee and compensation committee of Mack-Cali Realty Corporation, a real estate investment trust traded on the New York Stock Exchange, and as a director and member of the audit committee of Casual Male Retail Group, Inc., a specialty retailer of men's apparel traded on the NASDAQ Stock Market. He also serves as a director or trustee, and chairman of the audit committees, of certain funds for which UBS Global Asset Management (US) Inc., a wholly-owned subsidiary of UBS AG, or one of its affiliates, serves as investment advisor, sub-advisor or manager. As a result of his long career in various operating and directorship positions, he provides the Board of Directors with business, leadership and management experience and insights into many aspects of our operations. From 1998 until his retirement in May 2003, he served as the Deputy Chief Executive Officer of Deloitte & Touche LLP, or D&T, a global professional services firm.

name: Abhishek Grover
bio: Mr. Abhishek Grover serves as Chief Digital Officer at L'Oreal.
